Mavie Patrina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and gromozones.

loans.name: Jumaboi

texts.ru: Джумабой женат и имеет четверых детей. Он более 15 лет является бригадиром в колхозе. Имеет 3,8 гектар арендованной земли, на который выращивает  кукурузу, пшеницу, помидоры и другие сельхозпродукции. Кроме этого он перерабатывает абрикосы, а также дома занимается разведением и откормом скота. В бизнесе помогают его семья, и они вместе дружно работают. Джумабой хочет приобрести минеральные удобрения для обработки земли, с этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за поддержку.
texts.en: Jumaboi is married and has four children.  He has been a foreman at a collective farm for over 15 years.  He leases 3.8 hectares of land, where he grows corn, wheat, tomatoes and other agricultural crops.  Besides this, he also processes apricots, and is involved in breeding and fattening up livestock at home.  His family helps him with the business, and they work well together.  Jumaboi wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for treating the land, and is requesting a loan in the sum of 5000 Somoni for this purpose.  He hopes to receive your help and thanks you in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is 38-years-old with 2 children who are at school age. She sells bamboo for making artificial goods  and makes dry rice noodle. Her business started 2 years ago. Participating in our credit program in 2008, she used loans for the bamboo selling service  and she  wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to  buy more bamboo for sale.

loans.use: to  buy more bamboo for sale.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 49 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.
Enriquita has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from food vending.
Enriquita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is single. 

Janeth has a shop that sells clothing products like shirts, blouses and underwear.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothing like t-shirts and blouses to sell.

Janeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Janeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of clothing like t-shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Profetisa

texts.en:
Profetisa is widowed, with three children. Profetisa is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines.                    

Profetisa is a farmer and grows palay to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer.

Profetisa has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for five years. In the future, Profetisa hopes to harvest more palay during every cropping.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don Manuel de 40 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol vive con su familia en casa propia, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su familia con las ganacias que obtiene de sus evntas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y herramientas para su cultivo de maiz y frijol y tambien para mejorar su terreno que muestra la fotografia que es donde siembra sus cultivos. para poder tener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Manuel is 40 years old and he lives with his family in a house of his own. He is a farmer planting corn and beans. He is a hardworking person and he is very responsible with his household's obligations, and offering the best to his family is his main characteristic. By selling his products he earns an income he uses to pay for his household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, weed-killers and tools he needs for his corn and beans crops; he also wants to make improvements to his land that is shown in the picture and where he plants his crops, in order to earn a better income and to grant his family a better economic stability.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, weed-killers and tools.

loans.name: Sasunik

texts.en: Sasunik lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region with his large family. He lives with his wife, son and two daughters. Sasunik for many years used to work as a driver, now he is employed at the private company and he is also engaged in farming and potato cultivation. Sasunik’s wife is unemployed and she greatly helps her husband in their farming works especially cattle care. They work hard as it is the main and the constant source of income for their large family needs. Sasunik’s elder son works at the police station, second daughter Amalya is unemployed, the smallest daughter is a student an in future she is psychologist. The family is a worried of the Amalya’s health state since she has some claims connected with her health. Sasunik hopes so much that Kiva lenders will help him with loan amount of 1.400.000 Armenian drams which he will use to for his smallest daughter’s proper medical exam at the hospital, with great hope that there will be nothing serious with her.

loans.use: to pay for his smallest daughter’s proper medical exam at the hospital, with great hope that there will be nothing serious with her

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 24 years old single with no children.She has been in this business for 3 years and employs 2 casual workers. She prepares chips and traditional foods such as Ugali, mixed vegetables-Sukuma week, and porridge. Chips move very fast and she experiences shortage during peak hours at lunch time. Currently the existing cooker can not allow her meet the demand during these hours.

loans.use: She needs money to purchase a higher capacity cooker that would be able to increase the output of chips two folds.

loans.name: Vodu

texts.en: Vodu is a trader in livestock such as fowls, ducks and sheep. She has been trained on the need to keep proper records on her business by the TEACH lending promoters - Kraban Support Foundation. Maame Vodu, as she is affectinately called, wants a capital loan of $600 from KIVA to enable her buy more animals to breed and sell.

loans.use: Woring CAPITAL

loans.name: San Juana

texts.en:
Mrs. P. has 7 years' experience in sales. Every time she moves she puts up a convenience store. "I depend solely on my little store and don't know how to do anything else. I just moved and would like some help, $1,200 to fill every corner of my store with products."

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. P. tiene una experiencia de 7 años como comerciante, cada vez que se muda de domicilio instala su negocio de abarrotes. "Dependo de mi tiendita al 100 % no se hacer otra cosa mas que vender acabo de cambiarme de domicilio y me gustaría que me ayudaran con $1,200.00 dlls para llenar de productos todos los rincones de mi negocio".

loans.use: To buy convenience store items

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: N. T. T. Hoa is 38 years old. Her husband is N. Thu Thuy, and he is 39 years old. They have 3 children (12, 10, and 7 years old) who are in 7th, 5th, and 2nd class. He works as a daily labor, and she sells fruit at the Muong Man market. Their average income is 11$US/month/person. She wants to borrow 50$US to increase her capital.

loans.use: Sells fruit

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Three years ago, Galina started a small business selling personal manicure sets and grooming supplies at one of the busy outdoor markets in Zaporoshye, Ukraine. She tries to maintain an excellent selection of manicure sets and currently has a virtual monopoly for them in the market. Galina is single and has one grown son. Her business, from which she makes around $200-$300 a month in profit, is a very important source of income for her.

Galina would like to see her business continue to expand. She recently was able to purchase her own sales kiosk and eventually hopes to have it remodeled. She has requested a short term loan of $300 to add to her working capital and allow her to purchase additional inventory, expanding the price range of products she has available. Galina has been a good client in the past with Nadiya Ukraine and we look forward to continuing to assist her in the future.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Assaad

texts.en: Assaad is a 33-year-old father of three children. He lives with his family in the region of Tyre, where he grows vegetables. He needs $1,200 to fumigate the greenhouses he works in so as to control the emergence of weeds. Assaad needs to generate more revenue in order to take care of his nine-month-old daughter, who suffers from a chest allergy.

loans.use: Fumigation of greenhouses

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. E. Srey was married in 1984 and has three children, two sons and one daughter. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in 1992 and began her silk weaving business in the same year. She is also buying and reselling fish in the village in the morning, and continues weaving silk in the afternoon. Her husband, Mr. Kheng Khoeun, is a construction contractor. He used to work for a neighbor and started a contracting construction business by himself in 1990. Two of her sons are also working; one is a security guard and other one is working as construction worker with her husband.

After borrowing money from MAXIMA several times, her living condition is getting better. She has a chance to set up a new loom for her daughter.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and buying and reselling fish.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and buying and reselling fish.

loans.name: Mariane's Group

texts.en:
Mariane S. currently rents her retail space. With a loan, Mariane wants to build her own shop to save money.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda Da Co

texts.pt:
Rosa Esmeralda da Conceição teodósio L. is a resident of the Infulene district. She is a single mother of 1 daughter. She is in her second loan cycle and is asking for $425.00US for 6 months to purchase goods. She works at the Republic Attorney's office of the Province of Maputo.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa Esmeralda da Conceição teodósio L., residente no bairro de infulene Solteira mãe de 1 filha esta no 2º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 10000 a pagar em 6 meses, para comprar bens é trabalhadora da Procuradoria da República da Provincia de Maputo.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Esperanza's Group

texts.en:
This committee of fifteen women was formed recently by a group of women entrepreneurs. They work independently from one another in different businesses selling food, drinks, clothing, and items for the house. Although they have their independent businesses, they come together to ask for loans, support one another in their business plans, and also to make payments on their loans.

Today they are asking for a small loan to continue increasing their business ventures. All of the women will get a portion of the loan that they need and with it, they will buy things like food, refreshments, clothing, and goods for the home.

loans.use: To buy food, refreshments, clothing, and goods for the home to sell.

loans.name: Punkhan

texts.en:
Punkhan M. is a 42-year-old farmer who breeds sheep for meat sales. He has ten years of experience in this field. He lives with his family in the small village of Saatli region.

Punkhan needs $1200 USD to purchase 20 additional sheep for an estimated cost of 60 USD each. He is going to purchase them now, because it is very good time to feed them, when all fields are full of fresh grass, and Punkhan does not need to purchase additional fodder. The sheep can grow until the autumn, which is wedding season, and good time for sheep sales.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 23 years old and is married. She takes care of one person, aged 32. Amina is a clothes seller, a business she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more vitenge (clothes) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge (clothes) for her business.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vu Thi H., 29 years , is the 12th member of TYM. Her husband currently working in Hanoi so she has to take care of her two small children by herself back home. Her primary income is from the internet cafe which give her about 200 to 220 USD per month. This earning has enable her to increase her family standard of living include buying furniture and buying books for her children. Up to now, she has taken out a total of 2000 USD through loan. During this cycle she would like to borrow 575 USD to buy more computer and increase the profit.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Hiền, 29 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 12 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chồng chị hiện đang làm thuê cho 1 công ty tại Hà Nội, một mình chị ở nhà trông 2 con nhỏ. Công việc hiện nay của chị Hiền là kinh doanh dịch vụ Internet. Nhu cầu tìm hiểu thông tin ngày càng nhiều nên cửa hàng chị Hiền luôn đông khách. Mỗi tháng chị thu khoảng 200-220USD. Số tiền này được chị Hiền dùng trang trải cho cuộc sống, mua sắm đồ đạc và chăm lo cho các con. Tính cho đến nay chị đã vay của Quỹ khoảng 2000USD. Với mong muốn được tham gia Quỹ lâu dài để vay vốn. Vòng này chị Hiền đề nghị xin vay 575USD để mua thêm máy mới về kinh doanh.

loans.use: Buy computer

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun M., 49, and her husband, Mr. Tha Choub, 53, live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have seven children, two sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home and the others help in the family business.

Mrs. Yun has been selling grilled meat and pickle for more than 10 years. She buys the foods from a wholesaler for resale at Preak Anchanh Market. Her husband has been a mason for five years. Mrs. Yun is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to build walls and a concrete floor for her house.

loans.use: Home improvements.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia dedicates herself to the sale of all types of cheeses, such as the chaqueño and San Javier which are in great demand in the local markets. She lives alone in a small apartment which has a bedroom, bathroom and kitchen. She has one daughter who now has a home of her own, and they only see each other some weekends. She used to have other people bring back her cheeses, or she received them by parcel post. Now, she personally travels to buy them herself at better prices.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Julia, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de quesos como ser el chaqueño y el san Javier, muy solicitados dentro de los mercados de la ciudad, vive sola en un pequeño departamento que cuenta con un dormitorio, baño y cocina, tiene una sola hija la cual ya tiene su hogar, y solo se ven algunos fines de semana. Ella hacia traer los quesos con otras personas o los recibía en encomienda, ahora ella personalmente viaja para comprarlos a menor precio.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through the primary school level. Gladys sells onions, dried tilapia, and other food items in Abura, which she has done since 2000. Her husband repairs electronics.

Gladys uses her income to pay for school items like books, etc. for the children. Gladys will use the loan to increase her business capital. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys plans to help build their own house.

loans.use: to increase her business capital

loans.name: Leat

texts.en: Leat C., 45, is a true entrepreneur and has a business selling fish at the market. She earns approximately US$4 each day. Her husband catches fish from the river for his wife to sell and he also plants many kinds of vegetables. Sometimes he only catchs a few fish so she needs to order more fish from other fisherman. This couple has five children and all of them are students. The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Leat C. included. Leat would like a loan of US$800 to buy more fish to sell in the market. Currently, she has many customers but sometime she does not have enough fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Rachel's Group

texts.en:
Rachel has been buying and selling fabric in Dodoma, Tanzania for six years. She is now hoping to take out her first loan so that she may increase her inventory of cloth to sell. She works for 8 hours every day and earns a profit of approximately US$ 20 each month. If she is able to increase her profit, she will put the money towards buying more food for her family.

Rachel is 39 years old, married, and has two children, ages 19 and 13. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Amina, Kibibi, Devotha, and Ashura.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for re-sale

loans.name: Manju

texts.en: Mrs. Manju R. lives in Tangal. Tangal is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in business activities. Mrs. Manju R. lives with her husband and one daughter. Her husband, Mr. Binod R., works in a printing press. Her daughter is in primary school.  Mrs. R. opened her shoe shop in Lagankhel in the footpath market. She sells different types of shoes and sandals. The rent for shops in that area is very high, so she can't afford to pay rent. She needs to purchase different varieties of shoes and sandals for her shop. So she requests a $275 loan to purchase different types of shoes and sandals, particularly children and ladies shoes.  She wants to provide good education to her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and sandles

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy N., 46, and her husband, Mr. Heng Siem, 48, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1980 and have eight children: four sons and four daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home; two children are silk weavers; another two are a farmer and fisherman, and the three youngest attend school.

Sophy has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from fellow villagers, and a farmer since 1982, selling her finished products to the middleman who resells them in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been farming and fishing since 1979. The couple is in the process of building their new house but lack the money to finish the project. Therefore, Sophy is requesting a loan of $600 for that purpose.

loans.use: To build the stair rail and hand rail of her house.

loans.name: Vann's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vann S. is a group leader of six, who are all living in Batheary village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a 1 hectare field. In her plantation, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough rice seeds to cultivate. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Vann S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice seeds for this purpose.

Her husband, Mr. Min Moeng, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Vann S. is 54 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom help their parents on the plantation, while the remaining two attend the local school.

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma Vereceles is 31 years old and mother of three children; Juvil – 12 years old, high school freshmen , Jovelyn – 10 years old grade five student and Judy Jr – 8 years old grade three student. Vilma is married to Judy, a farmer assists her in maintaining their eggplant production.  She said that in their family, they experience difficulties but most of the time they just ignore them and try to be happy.  

For three years, her vegetable production business has been their main source of income. Vilma is now asking for a loan of $125 that she can use to sustain and expand her business.  She is also hoping that she can have other types of vegetables that she can add to their harvest or engage in the hog raising business which will contribute to the financial benefit of their family.  Vilma's business also helps her in supporting the educational needs of their children.

loans.use: To be used in sustaining and expanding her business

loans.name: Vely Fredy

texts.es: El Sr. Vely Q. es una persona que desde muy pequeño se dedicó al oficio de Cerrajería, labor que aprendió de su abuelo y su padre quienes tambien eran cerrajeros. Hoy por hoy es uno de los Cerrajeros más conocidos y cotizados de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz, una zona residencial de la ciudad. Con el tiempo se especializó en la fabricación de techos de melamina para lo cual ya cuenta con su taller de metales y mecánica, muestra responsabilidad en sus pagos y puntualidad.
texts.en:
Vely Q. has worked since he was very young as a locksmith, a trade he learned from his grandfather and his father who were also locksmiths. Now he is one of the best-known and sought-after locksmiths in the southern part of the city of La Paz, a residential area of the city. After time, he specialized in making melamine roofs (hard plastic roofs made of melamine resin) which he manufactures in her metal and mechanic workshop. He proves to be responsible and punctual in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.ru: Хусейнова Мукаррам проживает в районе Гиссар. Живет в своей большой семье. Ей 38 лет и она имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Работает на рынке , торгует хлопковым маслом. Товар получает на масложирном комбинате города Душанбе и реализует в розницу. Ее товар пользуется большим спросом у населения и поэтому ее оборотная сумма не дает ей развивать бизнес. Теперь она решила получить кредит и при помощи чего она сможет развернуть бизнес.
texts.en:
Mukarram H. lives in the Gissar region. She lives with a large family. She is 38 years old and has four children. She has secondary education. Mukarram works on the market and sells cotton oil. She gets the merchandise from the factory in Dushanbe and sells it in retail. Her merchandise is very popular among the residents and this is why her working capital lets her expand the business. Right now she decided to apply for a loan to help her develop her business further.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up the inventory

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
El señor Noe B. desea el préstamo para las protecciones de su casa, la cual adquirió por medio de un crédito gubernamental, tiene poco de vivir en su propiedad, Don Noe trabaja en una línea de trasportes y su horario de trabajo es la mayor parte del día, en la casa solo se quedan su esposa la señora María Victoria Rivera y su hijo de pequeña edad.
 Es portal motivo que están solicitando el préstamo para las protecciones de las ventanas y puertas de su casa, y así podrá ir a trabajar un poco más tranquilo dejando, a su familia con puco más de seguridad. (En la foto ha parecen  su esposa e hijo ya que él señor Noe  se encontraba en horario de trabajo).
texts.en:
Mr. Noe B. desires the loan to protect his house, which he obtained through a government loan. He has not lived on his property for very long. Mr. Noe works for a transportation line and his work schedule is mainly during the day. His wife, Mrs. María Victoria Rivera and his young son stay home alone during the day. The reason he is asking for a loan is to add protection to the windows and doors of his home and in that way he will be able to go to work more at ease, leaving his family a little safer. (His wife and son appear in the photo because Mr. Noe was working).

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make the doors and windows of his home safer

loans.name: Margie Rose

texts.en:
Margie lives in Misom, Baliangao, Mis. Occ. She is married to a motor driver. They had only one child. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 for the purchase of farm inputs, such as fertilizer, medicines, and labor expenses. The ricefield is a legacy from their parents.

Margie is positive that today's harvest would be greater than before based on what they have observed about how the palay grows and develops. The family's income is taken from her husband's driving income. It is used for their daily needs, especially on their meals and groceries. The couple is wishing that they can improve their way of living and finish their child's college course to allow for a decent job someday.

loans.use: To purchase rice fertilizer and medicines and pay for labor.

loans.name: Rosa Ester

texts.es:
La señora Rosa M. se dedica arduamente a atender su pulpería que ella misma posee  en el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León. Es importante destacar que ella se ha desarrollado en su negocio y ha salido adelante beneficiando a sus pequeños hijos.

Hoy en día ella atraviesa la necesidad urgente de obtener los productos y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para hacer las compras a sus proveedores y luego ofertarlas en su pulpería que tanto requiere de su apoyo financiero para mantenerla.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa M. works hard attending to her small grocery store, which she owns in the area of Nagarote in the city of León. It is important to point out that she has grown through her business and has gotten ahead to benefit her young children. Today she has the urgent need to obtain products, and this is why she has turned to Ceprodel to be benefitted with a credit to make her purchases from her suppliers and later offer them in her store that is in so much need of financial support to keep it going.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of consumer goods

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence Y. is a 42-year-old married mother of four children, one son and three daughters, who are currently in junior high and primary school. She lives with her family in a house in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. 

Florence's husband is a teacher by profession, and Florence is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey, a food made from corn dough and served hot with ground pepper and fried fish. She prepares the food at home and hawks to sell in her community. Florence procures bags of maize from nearby communities. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to purchase bags of maize in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from Oroquieta City. She is 47 years old. Evelyn is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a squid business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught squid in the local community.

Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2006, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional squid to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional squid to sell

loans.name: Wahab

texts.en: Wahab M. is forty-two years old. He is married and has two children, both of whom are still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Wahab works hard to be able to provide for the family. He is a livestock dealer. He deals in livestock such as goats, sheep, etc. He distributes mostly to food vendors and restaurant operators. Wahab brings the live animals all the way from northern Ghana, where he buys them, and treks to other towns to sell them. He has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy livestock in bulk. He aspires to improve his standard of living and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.es:
La señora Rose Mary Pairazaman G. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 4º de secundaria, tiene 4 hijos y solo 2 dependen económicamente de ella.
Rose Mary se dedica a la venta ropa para jóvenes y adultos en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro productos de belleza como labiales, colonias, talcos, cremas, etc los que vendió a sus amistades y familiares.
El crédito de 1000 lo invertirá para comprar ropa para niños y adultos que traera de la Ciudad de Lima. 
Rose Mary sueña con tener un puesto en el centro comercial de la Ciudad de Trujillo, donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Ms. Rose Mary Pairazaman G. is a 40-year-old woman who lives in the Víctor Larco district, in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Perú.

This entrepreneur nearly finished secondary school. She has 4 children, just 2 of whom depend on her financially.

Rose Mary sells apparel for youth and adults from home for a living. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased beauty products, such as lipstick, perfume, powders, lotions, etc., which she then sold to her family and friends.

She will invest this 1,000.00 PEN loan in purchasing apparel for children and adults. She will obtain this apparel from the city of Lima.

Rose Mary dreams of having her own stand at the Trujillo shopping center, where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apparel for children and adults

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has owned and run a small retail kiosk for the past two years. A 23-year-old man, David has requested his second loan of Ksh. 40,000 in order to buy stocks of sugar, wheat and maize flour. He has successfully repaid one loan of Ksh.20,000 and he hopes that this loan will help to raise his income and allow him start a wholesale business. One day, David wants to buy a plot of land and build his own rental houses. David describes himself as jovial, faithful and sociable.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: add to his inventory

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly D. is 48 years old. She lives in Maricaban, Pasay City with her husband Elvin, 30, who works as a driver. They have a child in elementary school. Nelly opened a sari-sari (general) store three years ago, the same year she joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. Loans from the cooperative have helped her grow her store and helped her meet her family's daily, basic needs. From her sari-sari store, Nelly has a monthly profit of P7,500. Nelly is working hard to support her child's education. She wants to see her child finish college, which Nelly wasn't able to do herself. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is engaged in the hog raising business. She lives in Tammuco Sto. Nino, Cagayan with her family.  She is married to Jeffrey, a simple farmer and they have four children: Joeden-14 years old; Rica Mae-10 years old; Shaina Carla-5 years old and Michaela-4 years old. They are all enrolled in public school near their home. Eden is hoping that she and her husband can afford to send their children to college.  

Eden wants to request financial assistance from KIVA lenders in the amount of PHP10,000 for the maintenance of her business. Eden is lucky because her husband helps her in managing the business. This loan will be utilized to buy piglets and feed supply. She believes that maintaining the business will greatly help her in supporting their family and so with the education of their children.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Decadas Group

texts.en:
Milagros P. will be using her loan to purchase charcoal, which she will then sell to her community. Milagros is 56 years old and lives with her husband, one of her four children, and her granddaughter in Punta Pescadora (Fisherman’s Point), a neighborhood on the outskirts of San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. Life in the poorer neighborhoods of San Pedro D. Macorís can be very basic: charcoal for heat and cooking, no potable water and unpleasant housing conditions. Charcoal is a valued commodity here and Milagros has had great success as a saleswoman in her community.

Milagros is one of the coordinators for the group "Decadas" and her story is representative of those in her group. She is very thankful for this loan and hopes that with it her business will be successful and grow. Since her granddaughter is still very young, Milagros hopes that she can use her profits to send the child to good schools and give her a step up in society. This is Milagros’s fourth loan with Esperanza and she has a perfect repayment record! Thank you for lending to Milagros and the Decadas group!

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell to her neighbors

loans.name: Simon Bolivar Group

texts.es: El Grupo “Simon Bolívar” esta representado por la señora Simona y conformado por 12 miembros enteramente femeninos que en su mayoría se dedican al comercio D. diversos productos, pero una D. las actividades que mas sobresale entre las socias es la venta D. comidas como así también el servicio D. confección y bordado D. blusas mantas y camisas típicas D. la región. En cuanto a la competencia el entorno donD. se desarrollan las actividades cuenta con demanda D. consumidores ya que se realiza la entrega a casas D. venta en zonas comerciales. El crédito otorgado esta destinado al incremento del capital D. trabajo y crecimiento D. los negocios con la compra D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mejor y mayor ingreso para el sustento D. sus familias, el banco se conformo con socias que ya cuentan con experiencia D. trabajo en créditos solidarios gracias a financiamiento en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital  teniendo así un buen informe crediticio para acceder al crédito así como las ganas D. salir adelante que demuestran cada integrante del grupo.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen W. is 35 years old and married to Mary Mumbi. They have 3 school-going children. He has been running his retail shop for the last 3 years in Naivasha town. This will be Stephen’s 4th loan with KADET. He heard about KADET through their marketing activities. He has a good credit history with KADET having paid his previous loan on schedule. Stephen plans to add more household goods to sell in his retail shop. In the future he plans to turn his retail shop into a wholesale cereal shop, which will generate greater revenue.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more household goods to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Selia

texts.es:
La señora Selia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ancara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ancara Sector Cahuaya, estudio educación secundaria incompleta.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 1 año y su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado  ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino,  luego del engorde  los venderá en las feria de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando, para poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros, las reuniones y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Selia, 37, is a member of the "San Pedro" communal bank which is located in the Ancara community, Llave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is married and has 4 children. She lives in the Ancara Sector Cahuaya and completed secondary school. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost a year and her initial loan of 500 new soles was used as working capital to buy sheep to resell. She now needs a new, 800 new sol loan, which will allow her to buy more sheep which, once fattened up, will be sold in the local fairs. Her greatest wish is to continue working in order to provide her children with an education. She likes savings, meetings, and the terms of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Success in life totally depends on how one handles and manages the opportunities that come your way. When it comes to family life, success depends on how each partner cooperates and supports the other in all endeavors.

Rosalie P. has always been open to new opportunities that come her way, especially in business. She is always on the lookout for new possibilities where she could use her skills and business acumen. Because she is not afraid to work hard to achieve her goals, she has already accomplished a lot in her 46 years.

Rosalie is married to Pedrito, who is a councilor in their village. Even though he is active in local politics, Pedrito is also an active partner in their hollow blocks factory.

They have four children. The two older ones have already earned their college degrees, and the younger kids are still in school. Rosalie's immediate aspiration is for her two remaining children to finish their studies and for their hollow blocks factory to continue to flourish, enabling them to provide employment to more people in their community in Brgy. Cabatangan, Talisay City, Negros Occidental.

Rosalie's financial situation today is so much improved from her life years ago. Her first business was a "sari-sari" or general store where she sold just a few items. She was very frugal in budgeting her income, making sure that she set aside some of the income to increase her working capital, but she realized that she could not expand her business if she did not have access to outside capital. This is why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in June of 2002. With the additional capital, she was able to increase her income capacity by adding more items to her goods for sale. Later, she also started selling Ready-to-Wear clothes, and then added a Water Refilling Station to her roster of services. With the additional businesses, she hired people to help her in the business.

When she was given the opportunity to start a Hollow Blocks Factory, she did not hesitate, because she knew that this would not only help her family, but also provide work opportunities for people in their village. All her business activities now earn a minimum of $293 a month. She saves most of her income for the education of her children and their household expenses. In her previous loan she borrowed 35,000 PHP which she used as working capital for her business ventures. Now that she is into her next loan cycle, she wants to borrow 38,000 PHP so that she can buy another hollow-blocks machine and increase her production capacity.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for making hollow blocks

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en: Wilhelmina B. is from the village of Paitan, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old and is married. Wilhelmina owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Wilhelmina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Wilhelmina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie I., age 39, is a rice farmer from Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She says that her family really relieson her farm. Whatever income she makes from growing rice is a big help for the family, allowing them to buy food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies so she can increase her harvest and raise her income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Evalin

texts.en:
Evalin L. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and bread and is requesting a loan to buy bags of rice and cooking oil to sell.  Evalin is 28 years old. She is married and her husband is a driver. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Bello Horizonte Group

texts.es: El grupo “Bello Horizonte” esta representado por la señora Sarah y conformado por 12 miembros que van cursando un tercer ciclo juntas demostrando responsabilidad y ganas D. trabajar junto con la institución con la cual están agradecidos por el apoyo económico y la confianza depositada. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como  Venta D. comida, venta D. ropa, venta D. refrigerios, venta D. cosméticos, venta bebidas alcohólicas y algunas socias se dedican a servicios domésticos, por ejemplo las presidenta se dedica a al venta D. comida típica como majaditos, patasca D. trigo pelado y sopas en el mercado trabaja desD. muy temprano y termina en la noche después D. vender sus platos D. cena por lo que pasa muy poco tiempo con sus pequeños niños que es lo que mas le preocupa ella quisiera generar mayores ganancias solo con sus almuerzos para poder pasar el resto del día con sus hijos pero asta que las ganancias no mejoren ella se conforma con poderles pagar una educación y que tengan un techo donD. descansar, así como las señora Sarah muchos D. lso socios deben dejar a sus nichos para trabajar pero es el precio que pagan por sus sustento y para mejoras la vida D. sus hijos. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas que ayuden a generar una mejor ganancia que ayuD. a mantener a sus hogares. La mayor expectativa que tiene las socias es poder darles un hogar estable a sus hijos ya que muchas D.  las socias viven en alquileres o anticríticos y constantemente debe trasladarse en busca D. un nuevo hogar es por esta razón que traban para poder comprarse una cas o construir en lotes que algunos D. los socios ya tienen comprados, dándoles un mejor hogar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Bello Horizonte" group is headed by Sarah and comprised of 12 members, who together, are in the process of their third loan cycle. Such shows responsibility and industriousness, and the group is very grateful for the economic support and trust provided by the parties involved. Most of the members sell products such as food, clothes, domestic appliances, cosmetics, and alcoholic beverages. Some members proviD. domestic services. The group's President sells typical fare such as majaditos (a regional rice dish), patasca D. trigo pelado (wheat with jerked beef) and soup in the market from very early till late. Therefore, she has very little time to spend with her children. She hopes to spend more time with them, by focusing on lunch sales only, thereby increasing her earning potential. However, at present, providing her children with an education and a roof over their heads takes priority. As is the case with Sarah, many of the group's members also have to leave home to work. However, such is the price they pay for household upkeep and to improve the lives of their children. The purpose of the loan is to buy consumables, utensils and other necessary products in order to generate a higher income for the members' households. The members' greatest wish is to be able to proviD. a stable home for their children as most of the members rent accommodation or live in 'anticríticos' (a particular type of renting) and are constantly having to relocate in search of a new place in which to rent. Therefore, members have to work to be able to purchase a property or build on plots of land, which some have already managed to buy and which will proviD. a better life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To generate business income

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Kunthea is from Ta Su village, Takeo province. She is 38 years old and serves as the leader for this 5-member group loan offered by AMK. 
A farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops, she also breeds pigs. In order to support her pig breeding, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food. Her husband, Mr. Savoeun Soeun works in a tobacco company which brings in a small salary to contribute to their living situation.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Amelia's Group

texts.en:
Amelia A. is from the village of Sto. Domingo. She is 35 years old. Amelia is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Amelia A. group.

Amelia is married and has 2 school-aged children. Amelia owns & operates a pig breeding business. Amelia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Amelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Amelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Amelia is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Amelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Kiliyona

texts.en:
Kiliyona L. is currently in the business of selling beer at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Kiliyona is 23 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. They have not produced any children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 35 years old and married with three children who go to school. He has been running a green grocery for seven years.  His wife usually assists him with the household expenses since she is employed.  Elijah also rears chicken and sells eggs locally to his neighbors and friends to get more money.  

He was previously employed by a horticultural firm before he started this business.  He hopes to expand his business since he can access loans from Faulu Kenya. He has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more fruit, carrots, potatoes, and onions for sale.

loans.use: To add stock of fruit, carrots, potatoes and onions

loans.name: Alma Lila

texts.es: La Sra. Alma Lila C. Méndez es madre de tres hijos, dos en edad escolar, casada , y se dedica  a la ardua labor de profesora de educación primaria, este crédito lo solicito para realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, a diario tiene que viajar ya sea en bicicleta o a pie hasta su centro de trabajo.
texts.en:
La Sra. Alma Lila C. Méndez es madre de tres hijos, dos en edad escolar, casada , y se dedica a la ardua labor de profesora de educación primaria, este crédito lo solicito para realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, a diario tiene que viajar ya sea en bicicleta o a pie hasta su centro de trabajo.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de cemento, zinc, arena y mano de obra.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru M. is a small-business married woman. She runs a business selling stoves to customers at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. Cooking with these stoves uses very little charcoal, reducing the rate of environmental destruction through air pollution.

Nuru meets her daily family needs from the income the business generates. She is requesting a loan of Tsh 1,000,000 to buy more business goods to expand her business.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en: Madame Koffi S., a 33-year-old married mother of three, has been selling charcoal and cereals out of her home in Lomé since 1998.  Well-acquainted with WAGES, Madame S. is now requesting her third loan from the organization, seeking 500,000 CFA to purchase more charcoal and cereals to sell.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and grains

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.es:
La señora Porfiria es viuda y vive con el hijo menor en casa propia  en la zona Kenanipata-Pasankeri en la ciudad D. La Paz.
La señora Porfiria  es rentista del magisterio y a la vez venD. comida en la feria D. su zona es así como obtiene sus ingresos .
El crédito solicitado es para comprar una computadora para el hijo y así mejorar su educación.
Esta es la segunda  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y pueD. acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Porfiria is a widow and lives with her youngest son in her own home in the Kenanipata-Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. Porfiria is a retired teacher and sells food in her area’s farmers market; these are her sources of income. She will use the requested funds to buy a computer for her son so that his education may improve. This is her second loan request and the socioeconomic analysis conducted rates her favorably thus qualifying her for access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio de 64 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). El tiene una tienda. 

Para poder solventar los gastos familiares el tuvo que invertir sus ahorros, decidió invertir sus ahorros y vender vivares, frutas y vegetales. Compro arroz, bebidas, frutas, vegetales. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido agrandar mas su negocio.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar enlatados, verduras y frutas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere surtir mas su negocio con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Gregorio, 64 years old, lives in Primavera de Duran (in an urban perimeter that was originally a place with various hills, streams and lagoons which appear as the rest of the area as an ecological zone falling apart). He has a shop. To cover his family costs Gregorio had to invest his savings, and decided to sell supplies, fruit and vegetables. He purchased rice, drinks, fruits and vegetables. Little by little with hard work he has been able to expand his business. With this loan Gregorio wants to buy canned goods, vegetables and fruit for his shop. In the future he wants to stock his shop with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit, canned goods, vegetables

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Юлдашева Сайера проживает в районе Кабадиян. Возраст, 33 года. Разведена, имеет 2 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Образование среднее. Более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Откармливает и продает скот. Имеет большой опыт в этой области. Она любит свою работу и счастлива, что может прокормить свою семью. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество. Она благодарит Кива и людей, которые ей помогают в расширении ее деятельности.
texts.en:
Sayora Y. lives in the Qubadiyon area. She is 33 years old, divorced, and has two children. She lives with her parents. She has a high school education. For more than six years she has worked in animal husbandry. She fattens and sells cattle. She has vast experience in this area. She loves the work and is happy that she can support her family. She is taking out a loan to buy cattle and increase her herd. She is grateful to Kiva and to the people who are helping her expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying necklaces, rings, bracelets, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI   est  constitué de sept hommes, tous mariés du village de Moribila Kafonon dans l’ex l’arrondissement de Kimparana du cercle de SAN, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Ils   vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 37 ans et au moins 7 enfants.
Ils cultivent exclusivement du maïs. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année. 
SURDOUÉE D., compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence et d’intrants pour la production du maïs.
Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI comptent réaliser chacun, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un revenu d’environ 175 000 FCFA à 225 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of seven men who are all married and come from the village of Moribila Kafonon in the old "arrondissement" (district) of Kimparana in the San circle in the region of Ségou (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and average 37 years of age with at least seven children each. They cultivate exclusively corn. Since they are concerned about making their agricultural operations profitable, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program this year. Surdouée D. is planning to use his loan to buy a sufficient quantity of seeds and intrants for his production of corn. After the winter season, the crops are stocked for a certain period of time to gain value before they are sold at the large market in Kimparana, on a retail basis (but also often wholesale) and for cash, to customers who generally come from the large towns. The members of the Benkadi group are expecting to make an income of between 175,000FCFA and 225,000 FCFA each after selling their agricultural products; this will be used for the repayment of their interest and the running costs of their families.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of intrants and seeds

loans.name: Chynara

texts.en:
Chynara D. is a resident of Kant, a small pleasant city near Bishkek. Chynara is 46 years old and she is married. She has two sons and a daughter. The daughter studies at school and the sons sell household appliances in a pavilion. Four years ago, Chynara started to sew blankets and sell them to make money. She started with the initial investment of 3000 soms. She also sells curtains, and in this way she makes 15,000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to start repairing her house and purchase a vehicle. 

Chynara applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase fabrics and materials for sewing curtains.  In the future she wants to purchase a flat for her sons and provide her daughter with good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo Y. is from the village of San Isidro. He is 41 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately $715 per harvest.

In 2010, Eduardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Las Americas Group

texts.es:
Banco D. emprendimiento que se encuentra en su 2do. Ciclo conformado por 8 integrantes D. las cuales 6 viven en la misma zona D. la localidad D. Limoncitos. Excepto 2 personas una que vive en la localidad D. Jorochito y la otra en Santa Rita.                                                                                                                                                                                                  La Actividad D. los socios es variada se dedican a la  venta D. cosméticos, venta D. madera, venta D. carne,  maestra, etc.
La  presidenta es la Sra. Andrea  Se dedica a la venta D. carne hace 5 años en su mismo domicilio del b/ villa feliz D. la localidad D. limoncitos, su Estado civil : concubina con el Señor Juan  y cuenta con una hija que se encuentra en edad escolar, el dinero del credito lo utilizara para comprarse un conservador para así poder mantener su carne en buen estado.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              La Secretaria la Sra. Beatriz  vive en la localidad D. Santa Rita se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos en la misma zona (ambulante), su estado civil: concubina con el señor Richard el  cual trabaja en la elaboración D. losetas, en la misma zona D. santa rita y no tienen hijos, con el dinero del crédito comprara cosméticos al por mayor y también D. catalogo.                                                                                                                                   
                                                                                                                                                                                                                 La Tesorera la Sra. Bella  se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, hace 2 años es concubina con el señor José Luis  y tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar, una familia estable, con el dinero del crédito desea comprar un exhibidor para mostrar sus productos y así poder tener mas ingresos.
Es la segunda secuencia  D. este banco y ellos están muy agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo económico que les brinda.
texts.en:
This communal bank is in their second loan cycle. It is maD. up of 8 members of which 6 live in the same district in the town of Limoncitos and the other 2 live in the towns of Jorochito and Santa Rita. They all do different things for a living including cosmetic sales, wood sales, meat sales, teacher, etc. The president is Señora Andrea. She has been selling meat out of her house in Limoncitos for 5 years. She is in a common law marriage with Señor Juan and has a school-age daughter. She will use the loan to buy a cooler so that she can better store her meat. The secretary is Señora Beatriz. She lives in the town of Santa Rita where she travels selling cosmetic for a living. She is in a common law marriage with Señor Richard who makes tile for a living in Santa Rita. They don't have any children. With the loan she will buy cosmetics wholesale and also by mail-order. The treasurer is Señora Bella. She also sells cosmetics and has been doing this for 2 years. She is in a common law marriage with Señor Luis and they have 2 school-age children and a stable family. With the loan she will buy a display case to show her products so as to increase her income. This is the bank's second cycle and they are very grateful to the institution for the economic support that they proviD. them.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Mrs. Uk S. is a 42-year-old married woman and local farmer who has been living in province of Kompong Chhnang. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Her children, who are all teenagers, study at public school. Mrs. Uk S. has raised a lot of piglets and she had hoped to sell them to buyers three or four months after she began raising them. Unfortunately, the pigs are not big enough, due to the lack of food. To help solve this problem, Mrs. Uk S. would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs. Mrs. Uk S. was not available at the time of the photo, so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Vicencias D.

texts.fr: K. Vicencias D. est née en 1960 à Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Mariée à BONOU Etienne, un frigoriste, Vicencias est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Davatin, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji depuis onze ans environs. Le couple assure ensemble les besoins du foyer. Vicencias n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Vicencias prépare et vend du pâté (fait à base de farine de blé) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Vicencias vend du maïs. Vicencias s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Vicencias exerce cette activité depuis onze ans et a déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus grandissante, Vicencias désire augmenter son fonds de roulement et rehausser le niveau de son activité pour mieux répondre à sa clientèle.
texts.en: Ms. K. Vicencias D. was born in 1960 in Sèmè-Podji, in Benin. Married to Mr. BONOU Etienne, a refrigerator specialist, Vicencias is the mother of three children, who have all attended school. The family has lived in Davatin, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, for about eleven years. The couple jointly ensure that their household needs are met. Vicencias did not attend school. To support herself and her children, she makes and sell pâté (made from wheat flour) out of her home. Secondarily, she sells corn. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been in this business for eleven years and has already had five loans, which were all repaid. Facing a burgeoning demand, Vicencias would like to increase her working capital and raise her level of business in order to respond better to her customers.

loans.use: Buying sacks of wheat flour

loans.name: Sonia Nelly

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva”, ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. EL Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, con  cuatro hijos y con grado D. instrucción D. secundaria incompleta.
La actividad que realiza consiste en la compra y venta D. chuño y papa. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace tres años, con un préstamo D. S/.300. 00 nuevos soles, el cual le sirvió para incrementar  el capital  D. su negocio.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para incrementar la mercadería D. su negocio. 
Su sueño es tener fuerte capital propio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las ganancias generadas por los ahorros.
texts.en: Sonia is a member of the Ciudad Nueva community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno. She is 53 years old, partnered and has four children. She went to high school but didn't finish.  Sonia operates a business buying and selling "chuno" (dried tubers) and potatoes.  She got her first Movimiento Manuela Ramos loan three years ago. She used the loan, for S/.300 new soles, to support her business. She is now applying for a S/.2,000 new soles loan to buy more merchandise for the business. Sonia's dream is to build her own nest egg.  What she most likes about her community bank is the earnings generated by her savings.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

loans.name: Cecilia Ama Kakraba

texts.en: Cecilia Ama Kakraba A. is married and has five dependants. Cecilia sells raw rice that has been bagged in small quantities in Abura. She also sells different types of soaps. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan will be used to purchase varieties of soaps to sell. Cecilia wishes to use the additional income to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of soaps to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther N., who is married to a security man and has three children, has been been selling frozen meat and salted fish in Takoradi for six years. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Esther will add the loan to her income to expand her fish business, and plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded operation back into her enterprise.

The photo shows Esther cutting the salted fish into pieces for sale.

loans.use: Esther will add the loan to her income to expand her fish business.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne T. is 34 years old, married to Kennedy Mugushi, and together they are blessed with four beautiful children. They live in Kibomet in Kitale Town where she runs her business of selling used clothes. She has been in business for four years now and she gets a monthly income of about $125.

This will be Everlyne's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to buy one bale of used clothes for resale, and with the income she will earn she plans to pay back the loan and also save some money for future use. In the future she wants to be a wholesale dealer of used clothes, and also to educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: To buy one bale of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Ti

texts.en:
Ti S., 54, is married and resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. sells fish, earning an income of about $12 per day. Her husband is a skillful fisherman, earning an income of about $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $65 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more fishing tools for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her 4th loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more fishing tools for her husband to improve his business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia C. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 53 years old, married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Virginia raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Virginia's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
Ung S., 38, resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for angkorean temples. S. is a housewife, while her husband is a tuk-tuk driver, earning an income of USD 10 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 75 on food and USD 45 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. She is 41 years old and a widow with five children and all of them go to school. Margret borrowed a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
