David is 51 years old and married with seven children aged between 10 and 26. Five of the children are currently attending school. David is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for 26 years. His farm produces milk, which is sold to the local market. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea, which is also sold locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the basic needs of his family.
David has a good record with Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, after he successfully repaid his previous loan of 100,000 KES. He has requested this loan of 70,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He believes that, with the dairy cow he will acquire, his milk production will increase and this will earn him more income. He will use this income to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 50 years old and married, with seven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy piglets. Jocelyn has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of a dream: to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther T. is married and has two children. She received schooling through junior high school. For the past five years, Esther has been selling smoked fish at Mfuom near Abura to supplement her husband’s income. Her husband is a farmer and shoe maker. Her earnings help pay for their children’s school fees and the household utilities bills. 

Esther's goal now is to increase her earnings so that she and her husband can save up money for their children's higher education.  With a loan from Kiva, she will purchase more fish to sell. She plans to save the additional earnings from the increased sales.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 51 años D. edad y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. TambogranD. – Piura. Martina  vive en la parte rural D. este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos. Esto la motiva a trabajar a toda hora, todos los días.

Martina en la actualidad realiza tres actividades que le permiten ganar dinero para lograr su objetivo el cual es tener una mejor calidad D. vida.

La primera actividad que realiza Martina, desD. hace 4 años, es la D. crianza D. ovinos, hoy en día cuenta con 40 D. estos, a los cuales cría y engorda para comercializarlos. Además, Martina tiene una pequeña tienda en la sala D. su domicilio donD. venD., a una clientela ya establecida, productos D. primera necesidad como leche, huevos, mantequilla y agua. Finalmente, Martina venD. ropa a la gente D. su zona y es por esta actividad que ella solicita un crédito.

Martina solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles cuyo destino será la compra D. prendas D. vestir para entregar a clientes por pedidos realizados.

Martina es conocida en su comunidad por ser una mujer trabajadora y amable, tiene buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Martina is 51 years old and lives with her husband in the district of TambogranD. – Piura. Martina lives in the rural part of the district, which lacks basic services. This motivates her to work all the hours she can, every day. 

Martina currently earns her living by engaging in three separate activities. Her goal is to have a better quality of life. 

The first activity is sheep farming, in which she has been involved for 4 years. She has 40 sheep at present, which she raises and fattens for sale. In addition, Martina has a small shop in the main room of her house, where she sells essential products like milk, eggs, butter and water to an established client base. Finally, Martina sells clothes to people in her area. She has requested the loan for the latter activity, to purchase M. clothes for onward sale. 

Martina has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy clothes to fulfil existing orders from clients. 

Martina is known in her community as a hardworking and kind woman, and has good personal references.

loans.use: To buy clothes for onward sale.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 55 years old and married with four children.

Leonila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Leonila has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Leonila aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Suyunbek

texts.en:
Suyunbek, who lives in Dj.Rasulov, Tajikistan is dedicated to the cattle business which he practices very diligently in his community. From very early in the morning he tends to the animals and he returns in the afternoons, having been exposed to the sun and exhausted from all this, in order to bring food to his table for his spouse and beloved 4 children. Suyunbek says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with proper education. Now, Suyunbek would like to expand his business and purchase young cattle. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 5000 Somoni and with your help he hopes to reach his aim.      


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase  young cattle

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 45 years old. She has eight children who are ages 6-25 years old and all are in school. Her husband is a tailor; she is also a tailor, and she has been a tailor for the past 25 years. She enjoys her profession. She is requesting a loan to buy some fabrics and some tailoring materials. She plans to reinvest in her business with the profits she plans to make.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for making different styles for her clients.

loans.name: Prima Isabel

texts.es:
Prima Isabel es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos.  Estudió la secundaria completa.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de carne como ovino y alpaca, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos, el primer monto solicitado fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 200.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuatro degollados de oveja.  Nos cuenta que las vende sola en el mercado de Mañazo, su esposo trabaja en la  mina. 
Su sueño es tener capital fijo y seguir con el negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la   puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Prima Isabel is a member of Community Bank “Santa Rosa de San José”, located in the Mañazo disrict in the province of Puno. She is 40 years old, lives with her partner and has 5 children. She finished high school. 

Prima Isabel buys and sells meat, like lamb and alpaca. She had worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three loan cycles. The first time she requested a loan, the solicited amount was 500 new soles and she invested the money in her business. With this new loan of 200 new soles, she will buy 4 slaughtered sheep. She sells them by herself in the Mañazo market. Her husband works in a mine. 

Her dream is to have fixed capital, and to continue with her business in order to increase her income. What the Community Bank likes about her are her responsibility and punctuality.

loans.use: to buy four slaughtered sheep.

loans.name: Kisoga United Group

texts.en: Coffee farming and sales have been 39-year-old Ronald's business for two years now in Kayunga. Ronald is a goal-oriented, dedicated and happily married father of three who resides in Kayunga. Previously, this go-getter was involved in mostly odd jobs in and around Kayunga. Time came when he had to find a reliable means of livelihood.  It was about then that he purchased a piece of land, which had some coffee plants on it. The next course of action he took was to purchase more young coffee plants to plant on his farm. Most of the young coffee plants he planted on his farm are maturing as of now and the ones he got on the farm he bought are still sturdy. He is able to harvest coffee that he sells. He says per coffee season, this business can generate him as much as Ugandan shillings 460,000 in sales revenue. This is the second time Ronald's group is getting a loan from this MFI. He intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more young coffee plants to plant.

loans.use: to purchase more young coffee plants

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 45 years old, married and has five children. He repairs shoes to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years and has employed one person. He also runs a grocery shop for extra income.  

Through Faulu Kenya, Benard has learned how to save his money and manage his business. He hopes to become a vegetable supplier in the future. He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy leather for repairing shoes.

loans.use: to buy leather for repairing shoes.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 34-year-old man who is married and has one son and two daughters. He lives in the Jabalia Refugee Camp in Palestine. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Khalil was able to save up a good amount and needs $500 that he took out from FATEN to purchase bedroom furniture. 

FATEN's loan will help Khalil purchase the furniture he needs and not exhaust him financially as it is repaid a small amount at a time. 

Khalil is photographed at FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase home furniture.

loans.name: Isaac Misael

texts.es:
El señor Isaac tiene 32 años de edad,  casado y padre de dos hijos, trabaja como guarda de seguridad desde hace nueve años, su esposa trabaja en servicios domesticos para lograr cubrir los gastos.
Como objetivo de ambos ha sido la construccion de su pequeña casa, ya que es hecha de zinc, e insegura, pero por diversas dificultades no habian podido avanzar, ya que todo esta caro. Es hoy en dia que podra hacer un cuarto atraves del financiamiento de Afodenic. Lo que espera lograr terminar.
Comprara materiales de construccion como, bloques, laminas de zinc, perlines, hierro. Para comenzar la obra. Y gozar de un mejor techo.
texts.en:
Mr. Issac is 32 years old, married, with two children. For the past nine years he has been working as a security guard. His wife works as a housekeeper in order to meet their household expenses.
Both of them have the objective of building a small house. The one they have now is made of zinc and is not secure. Because of various difficulties they have not been able to build a better house. Everything is expensive. Today they will be able to build a room, after they receive a loan from Afodemic. They hope to finish their house.
With this loan they will buy construction materials such as cement block, zinc sheets, and iron in order to begin their work. They would like to have a better roof over their heads.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a room and thereby improve the living conditions for his children.

loans.name: Bintiali

texts.en:
Bintiali is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a fish business, selling at the market to her neighbors and market dwellers. She faces a major challenge of competition from other fish operators in the market. She dreams of establishing a fish selling shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a member of Faulu Kenya under the Empathy group.  She joined the group as a business lady who runs a cafeteria.  Her business has been running for 11 years.  She has retained her business with the financial support from Faulu Kenya. 

Josephine hopes to expand her business so that she can get enough capital to build rental houses within five years.  She has requested 90,000 Kenya shillings to buy utensils for serving food in her cafeteria.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme agé, qui a en charge six personnes dont son épouses et ses trois enfants.Depuis dix ans, il exerce dans le commerce de produits agricoles afin de nourrir et d'entretenir sa famille.Il vend du mil, de l'arachide, des haricots...Il sollicite un pret de 100000f auprés de l'UIMCEC pour acheter 200kg d'arachide qu'il va stocker pour les renendre pendant la période favorable.Son ambition est de construire des chambres pour location dans son domicile.
texts.en: The borrower is an older man who is responsible for six persons: his spouses and his three children. For 10 years he has been selling agricultural produce to support his family. He sells millet, peanuts, dried beans, etc. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs from UIMCEC to buy 200 kilos of peanuts which he plans to stock and then sell when the price is good. His ambition is to build rooms on to his house that he can rent out.

loans.use: to buy 200 kilograms of peanuts.

loans.name: Nkel Group

texts.en:
Fabiola, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children, two of whom go to school. The oldest one is independent. She has been a food vendor for four years now. She works from 5 a.m. to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy land, a fridge, plastic chairs and food stock. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to renovate the place where she sells food by laying floor tiles and also to buy items missing from her food stock. Her dream is to, one day, be able to buy a car.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Nikel" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy food stock and floor tiles for her workplace.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old. She is married and has 10 children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice-retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice-retailing business for 20 years and she also earns an income from a network marketing business.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
La señora María Concepción tiene ya más de diez años con su negocio de venta de artículos de uso personal y escolar. 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de artículos navideños para vender, ya que tiene varios pedidos pendientes para entregar y no quiere quedarles mal a sus clientes. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas planea pagar el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para ella y su hijo quien esta estudiando. 
Desea que su negocio tenga más inventario y así más ganancias y podrá ayudar a su hijo a terminar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
For more than ten years now, María Concepción has sold personal products and school supplies. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in buying Christmas items to sell, since she has various pending orders to deliver, and she does not want to disappoint her customers. 
 
She plans to pay off the loan with part of the earnings she obtains from these sales, since this work is her source of income for herself and her son, who is a student. 
 
She would like her business to have more inventory and thus more earnings, so that she can help her son complete his professional studies.

loans.use: to buy holiday items to sell.

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia is 58 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Alang-Alang, Aurora. Zamboanga del Sur. To make a living, Lelia runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community, which she has been doing for over 11 years. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Lelia is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stocks to sell. In 2011, Lelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is a responsible father whose priority is to improve his family's living condition and let his children finish their studies. He is 34 years old, married and has three studying children.

Juanito has been running his rice fields for fourteen years and he only earnt PHP 20,000 last crop season.  He used his generated income for his family's daily needs, his children's allowances and feed for his raised hogs.  He realized that his farming business requires greater capital input for him to maintain a good harvest.  In this regard, Juanito is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan, which will serve as his additional working capital at his farm.  He will be using this loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and insecticides to improve his rice crops and farmland.

Jaunito hopes to make his business more profitable despite the hardships and difficulties he encounters in maintaining his agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and insecticides to improve his farmland.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio sigue participando en el banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, ella sigue dedicándose a la promoción de venta de productos naturales y sigue también dedicándose a la venta de ropa. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

En esta oportunidad Marco Antonio requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo ropa. 

Marco Antonio se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio continues to participate in the Asociación Arariwa’s “Chaska” communal bank in the city of Cusco. He continues to make his living by selling natural products and clothing. For the past four years, he has been in this business, and it is going very well for him due to the effort he puts into his work. 

At this time, Marco Antonio needs the loan to purchase merchandise, such as clothing.

Marco Antonio is appreciative for the opportunity provided by this means and also he commits to make his payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as clothing.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a very hard-working woman who practices mixed farming and runs a grocery stall as a secondary business. She has been in this business for over five years and earns a monthly profit of 5,000 KES. She is 32 years old, married to a farmer, and has two children. 

She is applying for her first loan which she plans to use partly to buy farm supplies like maize seeds and fertilizers and partly in her grocery business. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. 

She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro, tiene la edad  de 52 años, está casado,  vive con su  hijo y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende compra los insumos como fertilizantes, herbicidas y plaguicidas para mantener su cultivo en buenas condiciones. El lo que quiere es a su  cultivo lo necesario para ponerlo a producir en óptimas condiciones para asa generar una muy buena cosecha  para su posterior venta. el tiene como meta aumentar su ganancias de la producción y así darle a su familia un mejor bienestar familiar cada día y también estabilizar su economía para tiempos duros de trabajo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ramiro, 52, is married living with his son and his wife who are his greatest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy supplies like fertilizer, herbicide and insecticides to keep his crops in good condition.  He wants to provide his crops with everything needed so that they will produce optimally thus generating a very good harvest for subsequent sale.  His goal is to increase profits from the production to provide his family with better wellbeing every day and to also stabilize his economy for the hard times at work.  This is the first loan from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur has provided the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 39-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 7 years to 20 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a densely populated area  and her primary customer is  Kenya Creameries Corporation (KCC). She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor infrastructure of roads during delivery. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a cow. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years.

loans.use: To buy a cow for milking.

loans.name: Mihinmide Group

texts.fr: MIHINMIDE est un groupe composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la sixième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Christine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 31 ans. Christine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Christine est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Gabriel. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Christine et son mari. Pour cette raison, Christine vend des chemises, des produits cosmétiques, du maïs, des pâtes alimentaires, des conserves et du poisson dans sa région, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Christine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIHINMIDE, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de maïs, des pâtes alimentaires, des conserves et du poisson.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a married man. He describes himself to be polite. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 11 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living  standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Mercis

texts.en: Mercis R., who was born in Esmeralda, Ecuador has lived in Guayaquil for 10 years. She is a 42 year-old single mother with 4 children, one of whom (7 years old) still lived in the household. Sra. R. has a fish business which she learned about from her parents. This long-time fish saleswoman of 15 years has been searching for a way to make greater profits so that she can provide for her children. Her daily routine is fairly normal; she wakes up at 4:00 am to buy the catch for the day at which point she brings the fish to her market and sells it until around 1:00 pm. If she does not sell all of her fish at the market, she takes it home with her and finishes selling it there, she says. Mercis wants to take out a $475 loan to buy fish in cash and choose from the freshest fish around. Also, she wants to improve the presentation of her business to market the products better and bring in more clients. Mercis wants lenders to know that she is a very industrious woman who wants nothing more than to have her business succeed so that she can provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: Buy fish in cash at a discount; Market products better with display case

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business diversification

loans.name: Crispinus

texts.en: Crispinus started his business in 1990 with capital from the sale of his farm produce. His business includes buying cattle from the nearest markets and selling them at a higher price to farmers or at slaughter houses. Through his business, he has been able to educate his twelve children up to secondary school levels. With the proposed loan of $300 he intends to increase his stock. With sufficient funds he is able to buy more animals, saving on time as these animals have to be transported long distances. He plans to increase the number of animals moved at a single time in future. Livestock trading is a lucrative business and worth supporting.

loans.use: Cattle trading

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
T. Thi Hoa is 39 and her husband T. T. Sang is 37. The family has four persons. The parents sell bananas at the market. Their two children are in school. The family's average income is $10 per person per month.
They want to borrow $75 to increase their capital and be able to buy more bananas to sell. With their increased profit, they will be better able to cover the cost of their children’s education. They feel sure they will be able to repay the loan during the term.

loans.use: selling bananas

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Ms. Beatriz, 64 years old, is married to Mr. Luis Medina, 67 years old, who is dedicated to agriculture. The couple has two grown-up children, who live on their own. They live in a house they acquired with effort and hard work. Twelve years ago, Beatriz set up a grocery store and, with great sacrifice, watched it grow over time. Among other things, she sells candy, sodas, dairy and canned products, produce, etc. Some years ago, she was victim of a robbery that depleted her stock and forced her to start over; nonetheless, thanks to good sales, her business managed to recover. She wants to continue growing and to diversify the products she offers; specifically, she wants to sell meats and, for this purpose, she needs to acquire a butcher’s electric saw. The cost of this equipment is $600 and she is requesting a loan for this amount, which she’ll timely pay on a monthly basis.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Beatriz, de 64 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Luis Medina, de 67 años, quien se dedica a la agricultura. La pareja tiene dos hijos ya mayores y que viven de forma independiente. Viven en una casa propia que adquirieron gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo. Hace 12 años, Beatriz abrió su despensa que, con mucho sacrificio, vio crecer. Ella vende entre otras cosas golosinas, gaseosas, lácteos, productos enlatados, verduras, etc. Hace unos años atrás sufrió un robo que la dejó casi sin mercaderías, por lo que tuvo que empezar de nuevo y, a pesar de ello, el negocio pudo reponerse pues las ventas son buenas. Hoy día ella desea seguir creciendo y diversificar los productos que vende. Específicamente, ella desea vender carnes y para ello necesita comprar un serrucho eléctrico especial para carnicerías. El costo de esta máquina es de $600, por lo que solicita un crédito, que pagará puntualmente, en forma mensual.

loans.use: Purchase of a butcher's electric saw.

loans.name: Nicolay

texts.es:
Nicolay is a young man of 20 years. He lives with his mother and his little sister. Nicolay was forced to work tailoring clothes and selling bed sets. Nicolay is in his last year of college and he lives in Villa 16 de julio from the city of El Alto.

The loan he requested will be used to buy raw material to support his small shop. He wishes to improve his income to help his family.

This is his first credit with Impro and the social and financial evaluation that was done both qualified him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva volunteer.

Nicolay, joven de 20 años de edad, vive con su madre y hermana menor; para ayudar a la madre con la manutención de la familia se vio obligado a trabajar como costurero y comerciante de edredones y cubrecamas. Nicolay está en último año de colegio y vive en la zona Villa 16 de julio de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para comprar materia prima (compra de tela), de esa forma fortalecerá tu pequeño taller y espera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende, ayudar a la familia.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada, tanto social como económica califica a Nicolay para la aprobación del préstamo.

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Asiah

texts.en:
I am Asiah P. from Arifwala, a small size city in Pakistan. I am 25 and married. I embroider clothes on order and my husband is an electrician. He owns a shop in a nearby market where he sells various electric items. His shop does well and generates good profits. Now, he wants to expand his business further for which he requires a loan. He will buy items such as batteries, wires, and energy-saving bulbs in a suitable quantity. 
We want to have a well-established business before our child comes into this world so that we can ensure him a secure future.

loans.use: Buy electrical goods for the store

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Before setting up his business, Sr. F. worked as a street vendor in Leon's La Terminal market. He sold various things but the little money that he earned wasn't enough to provide the things that he wanted for his family so he decided to apply for a loan that he used to start a soft-drinks business.

He's very grateful for the support that Ceprodel has provided him (37 loans) because his business has grown rapidly and he now has a wholesale business. He's even set up a small shop that supplies local street vendors with soft drinks for sale in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. F. antes de establecer su negocio de gaseosas se dedicaba al comercio de forma ambulante en todo el mercado la Terminal. Vendía productos comestibles pero por los pocos ingresos que le generaba este tipo de actividad no le permitía salir adelante con su responsabilidad familiar por el cual decide realizar un préstamo para poder iniciar su negocio de venta de gaseosas.

Actualmente se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel por medio de los créditos (37 créditos) ya que su negocio ha incrementado rápidamente y ahora sus ventas son al por mayor, además ha logrado tener una mini bodega que abastece parte de la clientela que ofrece gaseosas ambulante por todo el mercado.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Eneng

texts.en: Eneng, 31, is the mother of 2 children, and every day she produces cassava crispy chips, then sells them at the market, earning $13 a day. Her husband, M., is a landless farmer (he works on another's land) who earns $5 a day. She requests a loan of $75 to expand her business, and as a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.en:
María Rosa is in her early forties. She and her husband have two girls aged twenty-two and fifteen, both of whom study. María describes herself as an experienced entrepreneur. She explains that she has great abilities to convince people, and says that she’ll manage to be successful in any business she begins.

María explains that her husband’s salary is not enough to bear all of the family’s expenses. So, in order to help her husband improve their financial standing, María plans on using her loan to start a small business. She’ll be selling silver jewelry and underwear to women of the Altagracia community of Santo Domingo. María hopes her business’ success will help her provide a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To buy silver jewelry and underwear for a small business.

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Koku

texts.en:
Koku is 35 years old, married, and has two children, 15 and 12 years old. Koku owns a small cafe which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 7 am until 9 pm at her cafe and can earn a monthly profit of about US$850.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy various items to improve the cafe.

loans.use: Purchase of various items for a cafe

loans.name: Pricila

texts.en:
Pricila is widow woman with five children, ages 5-22 years old. Pricila owns a small food store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more hot pots for food storage and more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy hot pots for food storage and more food items for her business.

loans.name: Oved

texts.es:
Mr. Oved is requesting a second loan with AFODENIC to invest it to improve his house to build a room, he has been working as a school teacher in the University of URACCAN located in the department of Nueva Guinea for the past 4 years; Oved since he was very little has supported his family, because they are very close and religious, he works very responsibly, as a teacher on computer science, he is also studying for a masters degree, we should point out that this young man is known for his simplicity and humility, but has a high desire of improvement, he wishes to have a house in good conditions, have work stability and health to keep on helping his family.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Oved está solicitando su segundo refinanciamiento con AFODENIC para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es construir una habitación, trabaja como docente en la Universidad URACCAN ubicada en el departamento de Nueva Guinea desde hace 4 años; Oved desde muy pequeño ha apoyado a su familia, ya que son muy unidos y profesan la religión cristiana, desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad, es maestro de informatica, a la vez está estudiando una maestria, vale la pena recalcar que este joven se caracteriza por su sencillez y humildad, pero posee un alto espiritu de superación personal, el aspira tener una vivienda con todas las condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral, salud para asi seguir ayudando a su familia.

loans.use: To build a room / Construcción de una habitación

loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children, all of whom attend school. Her husband works as a farmer and she is a tailor. Souad works from her home, located in a small village near the city of Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Souad would like to request a loan of $500 to maintain her home and business, which was damaged during the war in July of 2006.

loans.use: USD 500 to make some maintenance for her home, which was damaged during the July War 2006.

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en:
Ayishetu sells vegetables and spices such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, garden eggs (egg-shaped eggplant ), etc. in the local market of Koforidua, Ghana. Ayishetu, 36, is married with four children who are enrolled in school. Ayishetu does not really have adequate working capital to support her business. She mostly buys supplies on credit and makes payments after sales. She wants to use the loan to buy more stocks of vegetables and spices to increase her inventory. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children’s education.

Ayishetu belongs to the community group called “Ebe ba mu Trust Group”. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling the repayment.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of vegetables and spices

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a 30-year-old man. He is married and has 4 children. He lives near the international airport of Kabul. He has a carpentry shop that he opened two years ago. Before that, he worked in an apprenticeship with someone else. Now he is brilliant at his business. He would love to expand his business.

So he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani with a term of 12 months to complete his stock and buy new machines for his shop to attract more customers for his business because he is new in his business. He is sure that he can do it.

Abdul is very happy with this loan process specially for those who want to start a new business or people who have less money. He hopes to continue his partnership with both AFSG and Kiva. He would like to thank all lenders.

loans.use: To complete his stock and buy new machines

loans.name: Mary Y.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Mary A..  She is widow and has two children, aged 12 and 20. She also has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans.  In 2005, Mary established her hair salon business. Working 6 days a week, and 9-12 hours a day, she earns about US $40 every month from this business. Mary has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more cosmetics and different styles of hair products. She thanks you for your support.  

Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

loans.use: To buy more cosmatics and different morehair styles.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is 33 years old, single, and lives in Saida, a port-city in the South of Lebanon. Khaled has taken two previous loans from Al Majmoua which he paid back on time. He has requested a new loan of 1000 US Dollars in order to purchase more materials for his house-painting business. The greater supply of paints and tools will allow Khaled to paint two houses at once, increasing his profit margin substantially. Khaled is extremely energetic, and is grateful for the opportunity provided to him by Al Majmoua and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Khaled will use the loan to buy more paints and tools for his house-painting business

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos, Diana de 4 y Jhon de 3. Es una madre luchadora, que desde muy joven se ha dedicado al comercio, es así que hace cuatro años decidió incursionar en la compra y venta de objetos usados, los cuales vende en la feria de los días jueves en la ciudad de Puno. Aproximadamente comienza su labor a las 6 de la mañana hasta aproximadamente las 5 o 6 de la tarde. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es adquirir las cosas que ofrece, ya que la gente quiere vender sus cosas a más precio de lo que valen, pero aún asÍ, Herminia persistente, trata de refaccionarlas para aumentar el precio en su venta. Este es el primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero podrá adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería y comprar algunas cosas para refaccionarlas y venderlas a mayor precio.
texts.en:
Herminia is 30 years old. She is a single mother with two kids - Diana, 4, and Jhon, 3. She is a hardworking mother. From a very young age, she has worked in business. Four years ago, she decided to enter into the secondhand goods trade, selling used objects at the market on Thursdays in the city of Puno. She starts working at around 6 in the morning and finishes at around 5 or 6 in the evening. The hardest part of her job is obtaining the secondhand items, since people want to sell their items for more than what they are worth. Even so, Herminia persists and tries to fix her merchandise to increase its sale value. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She will be very punctual with her payments. With this money, she can obtain more merchandise and buy some pieces to repair and sell at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products to sell

loans.name: Eoeun

texts.en:
Eoeun V., 20, is married and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. This couple together has two young children.  She grows vegetables on a plot of land behind her house. She usually sells her crops and makes $0.50 of profit a day. Her husband Leam Lun, 25, pictured above, is a construction foreman and makes $4 a day. 

Eoeun V. would like to take out a loan of $500 to purchase more construction tools for her husband. This will allow her husband to access big construction.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate T. is a 32 year old wife and mother of one child who is attending school. She has been a food vendor for the last five years. She prepares and sells kenkey, a local dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with all kinds of sauces and soups . It is a delicacy many Ghanaians enjoy everyday, as a breakfast, lunch or dinner. She also sells rice with stew. Kate sells her prepared food at the main market center in Babiani. Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With the loan, she would like to purchase more maize, grains, vegetables, rice and assorted meats, for her operation. Kate hopes this loan will help increase her income and improve her family's well being. She would be very grateful for that assistance. The photo was taking when she was shopping for her next day business supplies.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize, grains, rice, vegetables, assorted meat, etc

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en:
Agartha N. is fifty-three years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to six children, two boys and four girls. She says three of her children are out of school; three are currently in the basic school. Agartha’s husband is a pupil teacher. He teaches in the elementary school in their locality. He farms as well. Agartha and the family live at a family house at Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Offinso are either into farming or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of business. 

Agartha trades in second-hand textiles. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of second-hand clothes including bed spreads, ladies’ wears and men’s wears, etc from Kumasi, a nearby city, and sells in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell. Agartha has been in this business for eight years now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy textiles in bales. She hopes to help sponsor the children to further their education.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand textiles

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria a sus 48 años, es madre de dos alegres jóvenes, Juan de 20 y Mirella de 18 años, vive con ellos en su casa propia y desea poder cubrirles sus estudios superiores y darles una buena profesión. Sale muy temprano para atender su puesto de venta de ropa, el cual se encuentra en el Mercado Bellavista (Mercado importante de la ciudad e Puno), todos los días atiende a varios clientes que vienen a comprar, ella los recibe muy contenta y los atiende muy bien. Lo más difícil del trabajo de Maria es traer la ropa desde el país de Bolivia, ya que el viaje es muy largo y agotador, pero igual ella sigue adelante, con la firme convicción de que en el futuro tendrá una tienda más grande donde pueda ofrecer más variedad de prendas de vestir a sus clientes, puesto que lo que más le gusta es vender y es muy convincente. Son 5 años los que lleva en este negocio, el cual le ha ayudado a darles una vida digna a sus hijos. Este es el primer préstamo de Maria con MFP y ya está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas, ella siempre guarda una parte de sus ventas, en su banco comunal es muy activa y responsable. Planea invertir todo el dinero que solicita en comprar más cantidad de ropa, así podrá incrementar la variedad de prendas de vestir que vende.
texts.en:
Forty-eight years old, Maria is the mother of two happy youths: Juan, 20, and Mirella, 18 who live with her in a house she owns. Maria wants to be able to afford to educate her children beyond High School and start them on a good career. She leaves home very early in order to tend to her stall from which she sells clothing in the Mercado Bellavista (an important market in the city of Puno). Every day she takes care of customers who come to buy: she greets them in a happy manner and is very attentive to them. The hardest part of Maria's job is bringing the clothing from Bolivia as the trip is very long and exhausting. Nevertheless, she continues firm in the conviction that she will have a larger store in the future, a store where she will be able to offer a greater variety of clothes as her favourite thing is to sell and she is very convincing. She has had this business for five years now, which has allowed her to give her children a decent life. This is Maria's first loan with MFP and she is already saving in order to repay the loan. She always sets aside part of her sales; she is a very active member of her community bank and very responsible. She will invest in the purchase of more clothing to increase the variety of clothes she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing to retail

loans.name: Luch

texts.en: Luch M., 21, is a true entrepreneur who has a business selling fish at the market to earn a living. She is able to make US$6 per day. Her husband, pictured here, is a fisherman who always catches and provides fish for his wife to sell at the market. This couple has two young children. Luch M. is asking for a loan to purchase more fish to sell, as currently there is a high demand from her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
C., 39, is a mother of three children; all of them are students. She is married to Choy, 38, who is a local farmer on a plot of farmland which he got from his parents in 1990.

C. is a local farmer and she has been in this field for more than 19 years. She always harvests twice a year because there are only two seasons a year in Cambodia, This year she wants to spread her farming by owning another plot of land, so she is applying for a loan of $1200 to buy a small plot of farmland for her farming. She dreams of having a degree for her children.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of farmland for her farming

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
D. Sharif is married and has two children. Eleven years ago, determined that his children should go to college to get ahead, he started a business of processing and selling dried apricots so as to be able to make enough money to pay for their schooling. His experience in this kind of business allows him to expand his clientele day by day. 

Right now, Sharif needs a loan of $3,000. He is going to use the loan to purchase, process, and sell larger quantities of dried apricots. With your help, Sharif will someday be able to feel proud that through much effort, his children went to college and became honorable people.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy dried apricots for expanding his business.

loans.name: Mujeres Habiles Group

texts.en:
Andrea C. is the coordinator for the group called Mujeres Habiles which in English means "Able Women." Andrea is the owner of a store that sells clothing and other items and is excited to get her first loan from Esperanza. She has two children ages 13 and 19, the youngest is enrolled at a nearby school, and the other is studying medicine at a nearby university.

A dream Andrea has is to continue progressing in her business and life and be able to help people through her business. She would also like to have her own storefront in which to do business. In addition to the storefront, Andrea hopes to be able to afford to finish building the addition on her house that was started a while back. She hopes her children grow up to be professionals.

On behalf of Andrea C., Mujeres Habiles, and all of us here at Esperanza International, thank you for your interest in these entrepreneurs and effort to fight the global issue of poverty!

loans.use: Replenish supplies.

loans.name: Shoista

texts.ru: Шоиста вместе с мужем занимается куплей продажей скота на местных рынках. Нигде не работает, основной доход получает от предпринимательства. Шоисте 47 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Старший сын находится в России на заработках. Шоиста и ее муж выходят на рынок каждую неделю и покупают скотину. Тут же на рынке продают купленный скот, а иногда привозят скот домой. Условия для содержания скотины дома имеются и после недели двух выводят на рынок и продают. Шоиста подала заявку на займ и собирается увеличить свой оборотный капитал.
texts.en:
Shoista buys and sells livestock at local markets with her husband. She is not employed, so her entrepreneurship produces her primary income. Shoista is 47 years old, married, and has four children. Her oldest son is away working in Russia. Shoista and her husband go to the market each week to buy livestock. They sell those animals at the same market, or sometimes bring them home. They have a place to keep livestock at home, and after two weeks they take the animals back to the market to be sold. Shoista applied for a loan to increase their working capital.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva S. is from the city of Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, married, and has seven adult children. Eva owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Eva joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Happy Family Group

texts.en:
Adam S. is the father of six children (most of whom are his sister’s children), who are currently students of a private institution in the Bushrod Island community.

Adam became a client of LEAP when a friend contacted him, and has been in the program for about three years now. He initially received a loan of 4,000 Liberian dollars which he invested in the sale of palm oil. Today, he is dreaming of a bigger business. His goal is to take care of all the children, send them to good schools, and also give them good medical attention.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil to sell by tins and gallons

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La señora Laura, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Totoritas”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Chimu, el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 19 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, y es madre de 1 hijo y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en la Comunidad de Chimu.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó  para la elaboración de artesanías en totora (planta de la zona). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de material quesana, chillihua y soguillas, para elaboración de artesanías en totora.

Su deseo es se mayorista en la venta de quesanas ya que considera que le da muy buenas  ganancias.

A ella le gustan la puntualidad y la responsabilidad en el trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Laura belongs to the communal bank group "Las Totoritas", which is located in the Chimu community of Puno District, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 19 years old, in a common marriage, and the mother of one child. She completed her high school education and lives in the Chimu community.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her initial loan of 300 soles was invested in the production of handicrafts made of totora (a cattail reed that grows in the region).

At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to purchase materials for making quesanas (woven mats), such as chillihua (a native natural fiber) and soguillas (a type of animal hair).

She hopes to be a wholesale vendor of quesanas so that she can earn a good income.

She likes punctuality and the responsibility of her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase craft materials

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es: Anastacia cuenta con 42 años de vida, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, está felizmente casada y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos viven junto a ella en su casa propia. Diariamente se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para rajar la leña y encender su bicharra (cocina a leña), con la que prepara los alimentos. Posteriormente, a eso de las 6am, “la bodeguita de la esquina”, su tienda, se encuentra muy limpia y lista para la atención y a Anastacia se le ve saludando alegremente a sus vecinos y clientes, quienes le han dado su preferencia. En retribución a ello Anastacia les regala su sonrisa y un buen trato a todos, puesto que valora mucho a sus clientes, ya que le generan buenos ingresos a su negocio. Su bodega está abierta sólo hasta las 9 de la mañana, pues luego de esa hora, conjuntamente con su esposo realizan la faena agrícola en sus cultivos, con cuyas ganancias han adquirido un terreno en la ciudad de Lima y esto la anima a seguir labrando sus tierras. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y durante estos años se ha ganado el cariño y el respeto de todos los integrantes de su grupo, ya que en lo ciclos pasados cumplió con el rol de tesorera en su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho aprecio por permitirle trabajar con los créditos. El dinero que ahora solicita es el para el incremento de los productos de su bodega, asimismo el 50% del monto lo derivará a la compra de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Anastacia is 42 and is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She is happily married and has 4 children, 3 of whom live with her in her own home. Every day she gets up at 4 a.m. to split wood and to light her bicharra (a wood stove), with which she prepares her food. Later, at 6 a.m., her "La bodeguita de la esquina" (little corner store), is clean and ready for business. Anastacia can be seen happily greeting her neighbors and customers, who prefer her store. In return, Anastacia gives all of them her smile and good service, because her customers value this a lot and it generates good income for her business. Her store is open only until 9 a.m. because that's when she and her husband do agricultural work in their fields. With the profits from this, they have acquired land in the city of Lima, and this motivates them to keep working their land. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and during these years, she has earned the care and respect of the other members in her group. For previous loans, she has been the treasurer of her communal bank. She is appreciative of her bank for letting her work with her credits. The money she is now requesting will go towards increasing the amount of products she has in her store, and 50% of the loan will go towards buying fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is a retailer of cell phone loads in their village at Barangay Antagan 1st of Tumauini, Isabela. She wants to borrow PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders for her load-retailing business. Both SMART and GLOBE subscribers are being served by Charlita in their village, bringing easier communication for relatives, friends and lovers that are away from their loved ones.

Sometimes, due to other financial needs of her family, Charlita was not able to buy load wallets for the retailing of cell phone loads. Thus, she wants to borrow from Kiva lenders to maintain the business and someday be able to expand in other networks like Sun Cellular. She plans to utilize the entire loan for her business if her request is granted.

Charlita is already 47 years old. She is married to a farmer who also works as a house carpenter. They have four children namely: Ferdinand, the eldest, a high school graduate and already married; the same with their second child Ryan;  third is Romer, who has stopped studying; and lastly is Grave, their youngest, who is currently enrolled in third year high school. Charlita really wanted to send them to finish their schooling in college, but it is their own decision to stop in their studies. She is hoping that her youngest child will earn a degree in college to be able to have a much better future than what they have at present.

loans.use: To buy more cellphone loads to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and other inputs

loans.name: Johnson  Street Business Center Group

texts.en:
The Johnson Street Business Center is a group of five borrowers led by Augustine S., who is 56 years old and married with seven children. The children are between the ages of 8 and 31 years old. The younger ones are in school. Augustine also cares for five siblings. Augustine is a high-school graduate and a trade certificate holder. 

Augustine lives and sells on Johnson Street, a business community close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia. Augustine's business is in construction wood. He buys it at wholesale prices and sells at retail. He has been running this business for five years. He believes that offering good prices and providing strong customer service have allowed him to come this far.

Augustine believes strongly in his business and wishes to improve it to a higher level. He is requesting this loan to purchase more wood for sale so as to acquire more profit. He dreams of giving his family a better education as a means of preparing them for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for sale

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es: Ramona Pérez B. tiene 67 años, este no es primer financiamiento que solicita a Fundación León 2000, ya que es por medio de ellos que ha logrado salir adelante. Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, la ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado central porque es aquí en donde transitan mucho clientes, por lo que anteriormente solo dependía de lo que su esposo le podía ayudar, pero debido a las circunstancias de la vida su él falleció y tuvo que buscar el medio para salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de ropa, cosméticos, artículos para el cabello, lentes para el sol, sabanas y ropa interior. Su deseo es poder seguir teniendo su negocio que es tan necesario para sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Ramona Pérez B. is 67 years old. This is not the first time she has requested financing from Fundación León 2000, whose assistance has helped her to succeed. She currently sells general merchandise from her location in the central market, since it is in an area where many customers pass. Ramona previously relied on her husband to help her, but due to unfortunate circumstances, he passed away and she had to find other ways to get ahead.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy clothing, cosmetics, hair products, sunglasses, bedding, and undergarments. She hopes to continue her business so that she can earn enough money to survive.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for her retail business

loans.name: Mutiyat

texts.en: Mutiyat Y. is 35 years old and lives in Oyo State, Nigeria with her husband and 4 children. She sells sarongs and jewelry and has been in this business for the past 15 years. Mutiyat is requesting a loan amount of $475 to purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA LUISA G. D. O. tiene 56 años, vive en el distrito D. MOCHE, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 6to D. primaria, refiere que es D. la sierra y que cuando ella era niña sus padre no le dieron más estudios D. secundaria, no continuo estudiando por falta D. recursos económicos por lo cual empezó desD. joven a trabajar.  Es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, ya todos mayores y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella . La socia se dedica a la venta D. vegetales como: zanahoria, tomate, zapallo, papas, etc. en el mercado la Hermelinda y también se dedica a criar patos, ovejas y vacas en la chacra que tiene cerca D. su casa.
Con su primer crédito D. S/ 300 nuevos soles compró verduras y patos para criar para luego venderlos. 
Con este crédito D. S/ 1,300.00 nuevos soles comprará vegetales como: tomate, repollo, zanahoria, betarraga, papas, etc. para vender en el mercado; también comprará patos y ovejas para su crianza y posterior venta.
MARIA LUISA  sueña con aumentar sus ventas y asi obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
MARIA LUISA G. D. O., 56, lives in the MOCHE district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the SAN BORJA communal bank. She finished 6th graD. and tells us that she is from the mountain region and, as a little girl, her parents did not proviD. further schooling for her and, for lack of economic resources, did not continue with her studies and started to work while still very young. She is in a relationship and has 5 children, all of whom are adult and no longer dependent on her. She sells vegetables such as: carrots, tomatoes, pumpkin, potatoes, etc. in the La Hermelinda market. She also raises ducks, sheep and cows on the farm she has near her home. With her first 300 new sol loan she bought vegetables and ducks to raise for subsequent sale. With this 1,300 new sol loan she will buy vegetables like tomatoes, cabbage, carrots, beets, potatoes, etc. to sell in the market. She will also buy ducks and sheep to raise for later sale. MARIA LUISA dreams with increasing her sales to obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables like: tomato, cabbage, carrot, beet, potato, etc. as well as ducks and sheep to raise.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca L. is a 57 year-old married woman who lives in the village of Brgy. Maquiling, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. Her husband helps her run their business. They have one adult child.

Even if they don't have a big family to support, Rebecca continues working hard for her business because she wants to improve their living conditions and move their family out of poverty. She had always dreamed of improving their life which is why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she wanted to start a general store, which she set up adjacent to her house.

The loans from NWTF-PD allowed her to expand her business faster than if she had no external source of capital. When her business had sufficiently improved, she diversified to other money-making ventures like a backyard pig-fattening project and a bakery.

Of all her businesses, the bakery gives Rebecca the most satisfaction because it enables her to help other people by providing employment opportunities to people in their community.

Her three business activities now earn a monthly income of 38,000 PHP and provide a comfortable living for their family of three.

In her previous loan, Rebecca borrowed 29,000 PHP which she used as additional capital for her general store, bakery and pig-fattening ventures. Having paid that loan in full, Rebecca now wants to borrow for her 15th loan cycle the same amount of 29,000 PHP to continue sustaining the operations of her bakery and the inventory levels of her general store.

About NWTF

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her bakery and general store.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta P. is from the village of Paddad, Alicia, Isabela. She is 41 years old. Violeta is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Violeta owns & operates a direct sales business venture. The main source of income for the business comes from providing personal use products in the local community. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase some food-processed products. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Violeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly comprised of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase some food processed products

loans.name: Ofu

texts.en:
Ofu V. is 50 and married with 7 children (ages 20 - 35).  She owns a business venture, selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Ofu has many years of experience in this business.  Ofu needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2005, Ofu joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Ofu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Ofu V. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.9 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kiko

texts.en:
Kiko M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal, groundnut paste and beer. She is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and bags of charcoal to sell. Kiko is 35 years old and is widowed. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her capacity to invest

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: Dante C.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is 34 years old, married and has two young children. They are from the village of Baculud, Iguig, Cagayan. Dante has been in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Dante joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Dante has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase fertilizers and other needed materials for his rice field. Dante is requesting a new loan of 28,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his sixth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to his house. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea P. is from the village of Brgy. Lactawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old and single. To make a living, Rhea owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rhea has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $138 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rhea joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rhea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rhea is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Durbubu's Group

texts.en:
The heroes of this story are people of very different ages! The feature they have in common is the smile on their faces. Durbubu B. is the leader of this group. She is sixty five; her husband is retired. Together they have raised eight children and Durbubu is currently raising her grandchildren. She also helps her husband look after the livestock. Cattle breeding brings them a monthly income of $227 and they hope to expand their business by increasing the population of their livestock. Durbubu hopes to obtain a loan and purchase some sheep to breed and to plough their field. She believes that daily labor is the best way to give their granddaughter the best upbringing. 

Durbubu’s partners are:

Rima, 40, is a mother of five children. Her husband works as a shepherd. All her children except the eldest daughter still go to school. Rima has applied for this loan to purchase two sheep. She has plans for her daughter to marry soon. 

Medetbek, 56, trades in cattle and his wife is also a businesswoman. They have two children. His son helps him look after the cattle. Medetbek manages to earn around $129 dollars a month. He needs a loan to buy two sheep to raise for resale. 

Gulbubu, 56, has raised five children. To earn their livelihood, she and her husband keep some cattle. Their children do their best to help their parents. Gulbubu has decided to apply for this loan to purchase four sheep. 

Raskan, 44, is married to an electrician. They have four children. To earn their living they also keep some cattle. Raskan needs a loan to purchase four sheep.

Taasirlan, 22, is single. Despite his young age he is already earning his own livelihood. He breeds and trades in cattle on weekends and needs a loan to buy a cow for resale. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the "Three-Ps" concept — People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team — Supporters of Kyrgyzstan — at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to breed and to plough their field

loans.name: Maheshwori

texts.en:
