Mrs. Maheshwori M. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is one of the under-developed areas of Lalitpur. She lives in an extended family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and one daughter. Her husband, Mr. Rajendra M., is engaged in making brass religious statues.

Mrs. M. opened her tailoring shop eight years ago after six months of training in tailoring from a local tailoring shop. She makes different types of custom-fitted ladies’ dresses in her shop. She prefers to make women's clothes such as kurta-salwar (a pant and tunic outfit), blouses, petticoats, long dresses and dresses for newborn babies.

Mrs. M. is now asking for a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy raw materials like cloth and thread, and a cutting machine for her tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and a cutting machine for her tailoring work

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane J. is from the village of Bitibut Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Mary Jane is single. To make a living, Mary Jane owns a specialized retail store in which the main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month .

In 2009, Mary Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 25 years old and single. Daniel still lives with his parents. He owns his own shop which sells different sorts of products such as cooking oil, water,  juice, soap and so on. Daniel has an experience of two years in his business and employs one person from his community. Daniel starts his business from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day except one day on the week end.

Daniel is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more products which will allow him to earn more profits. With this loan Daniel expects to increase the number of staff in his business who will allow him to run his business well.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Togos

texts.en:
Togos B. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and 15-year-old daughter in an apartment in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her daughter, Tuvshinzaya, attends a local secondary school. Her husband operates a transportation business between Zuunmod and Ulaanbaatar. 

During the day, Togos operates a meat retailing business at a local meat market. She has been operating her business since 1992, and has steadily expanded her business over the past 18 years. With her business profits, she was able to pay her two children's university tuition fees until they graduated. They have been living separately from their parents. 

Togos is an honest and hardworking person who has been working hard to improve her family's quality of life. She has a goal to operate a supermarket in the future. Togos is requesting a 4,000,000 Mongolian Tugrug (MNT) loan to purchase large amount of meat at wholesale prices to resell to her many customers for a profit.

loans.use: to buy meat at wholesale for resale at retail

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou B. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge dont 03 de sa coépouse. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAMBA 15ANS1 dont elle est la présidente depuis la date d’inauguration dudit Banc Villageois le 19 juillet 2002. Elle a 15 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement.  Elle a construit à domicile un petit poulailler où elle élève des poulets de chaire. A côté de cette activité elle fait un petit commerce de tissus teinté et vend devant sa maison sur u e étale de fortune le petit déjeuné. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari pour la nourriture de la famille d’une part, et d’autre part augmenter son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
Bintou B. is a 48-year old woman, married and taking care of five children, three of whom are her husband’s by another wife. She has been the Chair of the Banc Villageois of SAMBA 15ANS1 since its launching on July 19, 2002. She had obtained loans 15 times and never had any problems repaying them. She has built a small chicken coop by her home and raises broiler chickens. In addition, she also earns a bit of money selling dyed fabrics in the mornings in front of her house using a makeshift stand. Her goal is, on the one hand, to help her husband support the family, and on the other hand, increase her savings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improving her home and replacing the roof

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
M. Saodat is an enterprising, capable and very hard-working woman. She lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan, and sells kids' clothes and toys. She began her own business because her husband’s salary was not sufficient for their large family, including their four children. Her business is allowing Saodat to provide her children with the necessary food and education. 

Currently, she needs a loan of $2,000 to buy merchandise in order to increase sales. Saodat wants to continue to support her children and only wishes to work in order to achieve this. Support her!  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothes and toys for kids

loans.name: Airen

texts.en: Airen R.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 30 years old, married and has four young children. They are from the village of Upper Bandera, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte. Airen has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Airen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Airen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,500 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. Airen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo P. is from the town of Talibon. He is 54 years old. Rodrigo is married and has 5 school-aged children. He owns & operates a fishing business, gathering and selling shells and seaweeds at the market. He has been engaged in his business for over 6 years.

Rodrigo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Rodrigo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Rodrigo from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement his family's income and improve their house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara S. lives in Sevan with her son, daughter-in-law, and granddaughter. Tamara worked in a laundry for about 16 years. In 2006 she opened her own food shop and her son helps her a lot in her occupation. 

Thanks to her first Kiva loan, Tamara has organized household goods trading in her shop, which allowed her to increase her income from business and improved her family’s living conditions. 

Tamara purchases the merchandise for her shop from suppliers, but now she wants to receive 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy a car, which will allow her to purchase the merchandise for her shop from Yerevan and so to reduce the costs of her business.

loans.use: To buy a car for her business

loans.name: Musharaf's Group

texts.en:
Musharaf lives with her husband and 2 sons in the second largest city in Pakistan, called Lahore. She owns a house in the area named Mughalpura where she shifted after her marriage. 

She is a very caring and supportive lady by nature. She performs her duties as a housewife and also handles her sewing business. She tries to have a balanced life by giving the required time to her family and her work. She sews clothes for her neighbors and earns a good amount from them. In this way she can share the financial burden with her husband. 

Her husband owns & operates a milk-selling business. He gets milk from his buffalo and sells to different milk shops for profit. He has been doing this for the past 5 years.
 
Both her sons also contribute financially by doing different work. Her elder son works in a private company on a monthly wage while the younger one runs a barber shop.
 
Musharaf has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo to increase sales. She hopes that, with the additional buffalo, her husband will have a better financial outcome and that soon he will open his own shop in the market where he can sell milk to his own customers.  

Musharat is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her 2nd loan cycle. In previous loan years she has proved herself a responsible person who has never missed a meeting and has paid her installments on time.
 
Note: “In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Musharaf”.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for the dairy business

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas C. is a hardworking lady of 27 years who is married to Naftali Terer. Together they have one child aged four years. They live in Kipkaren estate in Eldoret, Kenya. She has been operating a hotel for the past three years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

When Dorcas learned about KADET and having no history with any other MFI, she applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from them. Dorcas intends to purchase plastic chairs for the hotel. She plans to use the profits from upgrading her hotel to expand her business.

Dorcas hopes to grow her business and to see her children realizing their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To purchase plastic chairs

loans.name: G. Blandine

texts.fr: A. G. Blandine est née le 31 Mai 1984 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Blandine n’est pas encore mariée et n’a pas d’enfant. Blandine vit donc seule  à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis environs vingt et un an. Blandine a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Blandine mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (riz, farine de manioc, insecticides, savons, biscuits, mèches, etc.) depuis près de cinq ans. Blandine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et les vend à son domicile. Blandine a déjà obtenu auprès de ALIDé, deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Aujourd’hui, Blandine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits afin d’accroître sa clientèle et de mieux répondre à leurs différentes exigences ; raison pour laquelle Blandine sollicite pour la troisième fois un appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: G. Blandine A. was born on May 31, 1984 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Blandine is not yet married and doesn’t have children. She lives alone in Lokokoukoume, in the community of   Sémè-Podji, where she has lived for about 21 years already. Blandine stopped her studies at the secondary level. In order to support herself, for the last five year she has been  selling various products (rise, manioc flour, insecticides, soap, cookies, hair extensions etc). Blandine stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and sells out of her home. Blandien already had two previous loans from ALIDé and repaid them well. At present, Blandine would like to increase her stock in order to increase her customer base and better meet different customers’ needs, which is hwy she is seeking a third loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing various products (soap, cookies, hair extensions, rice,  manioc flour, etc.)

loans.name: Angélica Liliana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Lourdes. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora  Angélica,  ella tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta linda  relación tiene un niño de 1 año de edad. Su marido trabaja de chofer.

Es una ama de casa y además se dedica a la venta de sandalias por catálogo, trabaja de tres a cuatro días a la semana por las tardes, ella sale con sus productos para enseñar a sus clientes los mismos que les deja a crédito y  cobra cada fin de semana, nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio ya tres años y que en la actualidad se le dificulta un poco porque tiene que llevar a su hijo. Sus productos los pide a Guayaquil y los recibe en Rocafuerte en oficina de los transportes Reina Del Camino.

Este crédito es para comprar más sandalias y mercadería para la venta. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. Su sueño es tener un local propio para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, there is a gathering every two weeks in the communal bank "Banco Comunal Virgen De Lourdes."  The city is known for its traditional cultural and also for being just a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

In this place we find Señora Angélica.  She is 24 years old and is married.  The fruit of this beautiful relationship is a 1-year old boy.  Her husband works as a driver.

Señora Angélica is a homemaker but also earns money selling sandals from a catalog.  She works three or four days a week in the afternoons.  She goes out with her products to show them to her customers.  She leaves her customers their purchases on credit and collects their payments on the weekends.  She tells us that she has been in this business for three years, but that it has been difficult lately because she needs to bring along her son.  She orders her products from Guayaquil and gets them in Rocafuerte's freight office, "Reina Del Camino" (Queen of the Road).

This loan will be used to purchase more sandals and merchandise for sale. Señora Angélica has been with the bank since its inception and she likes it because of the benefits that the institution offers.  Her dream is to have her own shop from which to sell her products.

loans.use: To purchase sandals.

loans.name: Jannet

texts.es: Jannet, de 35 años, está casada con Valerio, de 42 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos, a los que educa y cría en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Desde que era niña, sus padres le enseñaron el hermoso oficio de la artesanía, desde ese entonces hasta el día de hoy se convirtió en su principal pasatiempo y forma de trabajo y  hace 4 años abrió una pequeña tienda donde vende artesanía como: boinas, chompas, ponchos y chalinas tejidas. En el parque central de la población, es donde se instala la feria comercial, así que todos los meses de febrero, julio y octubre; los turistas visitan el “comercial artesanal”, donde se encuentra la tienda de Jannet. Ahora ella tiene planeado viajar a la ciudad de La Oroya, donde comercializará sus tejidos, con ello está segura que logrará incrementar su capital de trabajo, para poder invertirlo en su tienda de artesanías. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y como fundadora de su banco comunal, siente alegría por el progreso obtenido hasta el día de hoy. Con el crédito que obtendrá, le ayudará a comprar, madejas de lana de alpaca, que oscila entre los 25 soles cada una y si le alcanza comprará también adornos artesanales para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Jannet is 35 years old.  She is married to 42 year-old Valerio.  They have four children but only live with two of them who they are educating and raising in their own home which is located in the town of San Pedro de Cajas.

When she was a young girl, Jannet's parents taught her the beautiful trade of making handicrafts.  Since that time, this has become Jannet's main hobby and also her work.  Four years ago she opened a small store where she sells handicrafts such as knitted berets, sweaters, ponchos and scarves.

In the central park of her town, a commercial market is set up every February, July and October.  Tourists visit the "handicrafts market" where Jannet's store is located.  Jannet is planning to travel to the city of La Oroya where she will sell her knitted items.  This way she is sure that she will manage to increase her working capital which she can then invest in her handicrafts store.

This is Jannet's fifth loan from MFP and, as the founding member of her community bank, she feels happy with the progress she has made to date.  She will use her loan to help her buy skeins of alpaca wool which cost around 25 soles each and if she has enough left over she will also buy hand-made decorations to stock her store.

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool and hand-made decorations

loans.name: Chimalpain Group

texts.es:
Ellos son “Chimalpain”, eligieron ese nombre ya que así se llama la comunidad en donde ellos viven, a las orillas de San Miguel Xico. Está conformado por trece integrantes que día a día trabajan para salir adelante y poder brindarle un mejor futuro a sus familias. Los integrantes son: Minerva V. (Bordado de Bolsas), Patricia D. (Venta de Cosméticos), Bianca M. (Venta de Cosméticos), María Guillermina T. (Bordado de Servilletas), Dora Nelly C. (Venta de Zapatos), Eugenia Graciela (Costura de Ropa), Arturo B. (Herrería), Jorge Alberto A. (Tienda Artesanal), Patricia Esmeralda T. (Venta de Antojitos), Irene R. (Bordado de Manteles),  Marisela Adriana M. (Venta de Manualidades), Dayana C.  (Venta de Comida) y Juan Javier S. (Bisutería).

Guillermina T. es integrante del grupo, tiene 47 años de edad, su familia esta conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijas las cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Ella se dedica a la venta de Servilletas Bordadas desde hace diez años, ya que se vio en la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos de su hogar y así tener un mayor ingreso, Guillermina asiste a tomar algunas clases para aprender diferentes bordados e ir innovando su mercancía para tener una mayor venta, día de las madres y en temporada navideña es cuando más vende, y durante el año la gente que ya la conoce va hasta su hogar y hace sus pedidos. También ha iniciado con la venta de cosméticos por catalogo y espera tener buenos resultados de sus dos actividades y seguir trabajando. Con el crédito que le ha sido brindado, comprara material como: hilos, agujas, manteles, servilletas, estambre, etc. Sus planes de Guillermina es poder poner una recaudería y también aprovecharía para exhibir bien sus manteles y servilletas para incrementar sus ganancias.

Chimalpain está muy contento de ser parte de Kiva ya que eso les beneficia mucho.
texts.en:
This is the 'Chimalpain' group.  Its members chose this name because it is the name of the community where they all live, on the outskirts of San Miguel Xico.  The group has thirteen members who work hard every day to get ahead in life and provide a better future for their families.  The members are: Minerva V. (bag embroidery), Patricia D. (cosmetics sales), Bianca M. (cosmetics sales), María Guillermina T. (napkin embroidery), Dora Nelly C. (shoe sales), Eugenia Graciela (dressmaking), Arturo B. (blacksmith), Jorge Alberto A. (handicrafts store), Patricia Esmeralda T. ('antojitos' sales – traditional Mexican snacks), Irene R. (tablecloth embroidery), Marisela Adriana M. (handicrafts sales), Dayana C. (food sales) and Juan Javier S. (jewelry sales).

Guillermina T. is a member of the group.  She is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two school-age daughters.  Guillermina sells embroidered napkins.  She has been doing this for ten years and started her business because she needed to help with her household expenses and have more income.  Guillermina takes classes to learn different embroideries so that she can keep being innovative in the designs of her goods and thereby make more sales.  She sells a lot of her products on Mothers' Day and over the Christmas period.  During the year, people who already know her go to her house and make their orders.  Guillermina has also started selling cosmetics through a catalog.  She hopes to be successful in her two business activities and to continue working.

Guillermina will use her loan to buy materials such as threads, needles, tablecloths, napkins, worsted yarn, etc.  Her plans are to set up a fruit and veg store and also take advantage to display her tablecloths and napkins well so that she can increase her profits.

Chimalpain are very happy to be part of Kiva since it will benefit them greatly.

loans.use: To buy napkins, threads, needles, hoops, cosmetics, etc.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice C. is married to a security man. She takes care of six dependents. 

Beatrice sells food items at Takoradi. She has been in this business for four years. Beatrice uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. 

Beatrice will use the loan to purchase more food items for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to save in order to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for sale

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe DANAYA sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à OUAYERMA I  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts précédents ont été  bien soldés. Elles excellent essentiellement dans les activités de teinture  tel  AWA F.. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter, 10 pièces de bazin, 20 kg de teinture.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso. Elle vend  ses habits teints à Sikasso dans son atelier et à domicile, au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes .
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group named Danaya are married women who are on average 32 years old and they each have 2 children. They majority of them live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, a quarter in the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

In order to meet client demand they have requested their ninth group loan with the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner).  The previous loans were all successfully repaid. They excel in the business of dying fabric with Awa F..

With the new loan she plans on purchasing 10 pieces of bazin fabric, and 20 kg of fabric dye. She acquires her goods in the market in Sikasso. She resells the dyed garments in Sikasso from the workshop she has in her home. She completes her sales in cash and her clientele is made up of both men and women. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 70.500 FCFA and a portion of this profit will be put away in savings and some will be used to fill the family's needs.  The remaining portion will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to dye fabric.

loans.name: Togoo

texts.en:
Togoo is 48 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger districts of the city. Her husband is a driver and he drives a taxi. Her daughter is an assistant singer at a local theater. Togoo thinks her daughter will be a good singer in the future.  

Togoo supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia.  

 In 1997, her family moved to Ulaanbaatar from the countryside. At this time, when she began her business, she sold her handmade coats to Narantuul market’s retailers, because she didn’t have her own clothing retail stall. 

In 1999, she bought her stall with 1 million MNT from her business earnings. From this, her business has grown because she can sell directly to customers. Then, in 2007, her family bought land with 2.5 million MNT and in 2009, her family bought a car with 6 million MNT with her business earnings.  

Now, her working capital is about 2 million MNT. Togoo sells her handmade kid’s outfits and other clothes in her stall at Narantuul. In winter, she usually sews children's outfits and coats. With this loan, she will purchase materials for her handmade coats and outfits.

Her goal is to grow her business with this loan and be able to buy her own sewing factory and build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her hand made coats and outfits

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and buying and selling dry goods. She lives in Puerto Princesa City, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and buying and selling dry goods, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,200. Merlina is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase more stock for her general store.

This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Merlina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of more items for the store.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia Y. is from the village of Laturan, Libona, Bukidnon. She is 62 years old. Porferia is separated from spouse and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Porferia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as canned goods, snacks, breads & candies in the local community. She is also planting and harvesting flowers in the season. Porferia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Porferia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Porferia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Porferia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits and beverages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Porferia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene, age 27, owns a small business where he sells various products such as beans, Irish potatoes, and charcoal. He has three years of experience in his business. The hours of his shop are from 9 a.m. until 4 p.m. every day. He and his wife have two small children, ages two and three.

Jean has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more new products to offer for sale. Increasing his products will allow him to more adequately cater to all the customers living near his business. In this way, Jean Damascene will be able to earn more profits and be better able to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more new products to offer for sale

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian S. is aged 49 and married with six children between 28 and 11 years old, with three still in school. 

She has been engaged in mixed farming for over 10 years in her hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya. She solely relies on farming for her family's needs. She sells her produce of vegetables, maize and beans locally.

Lilian has requested this loan amounting to 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow with this being her first loan request. She says the dairy cow will improve the family income through milk produce and make the education of the children a possibility.

Lilian's challenges are animal diseases and food shortage. She is full of compliments to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia C. is from the village of Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Concordia is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Concordia plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Concordia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. 

Concordia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
This is Mylene E., 37, a resident of Tala, Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Leo E., 37, who is also her business partner.  Mylene is a high school graduate and decided to manage a variety store while her children were small.

Mylene operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippines pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail piece rates. Along with her variety store, she also sells viands (cooked dishes) to her neighbors. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her businesses, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan.  She plans to use this loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages so as to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mylene hopes that her business will continue to grow and be able to send her children all the way through college. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.
 
*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 42 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 años que posee un negocio, en donde vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad, pero esta actividad lo realiza en un pequeño espacio en la feria comercial de su localidad, a veces es eventual este trabajo, por que no tiene un local fijo para vender. Sus hijos la apoyan los domingos, que son los días donde hay mas afluencia de gente. Le agrada realizar este trabajo porque sus ganancias lo ve en el mismo día de su trabajo y aunque muchas veces suele ser sacrificado cuando hay temporadas de lluvia, o cuando tiene que cargar todos los días sus pesados productos para guardarlos hasta el día siguiente. Sus planes a futuro es le de tener una tienda en una zona muy comercial, por lo cual esta trabajando muy duro. Es su crédito numero 2 que tiene con MFP,  y tiene un buen concepto de los créditos grupales porque para ella es una experiencia exitosa a pesar de las dificultades que existieron en su banco comunal, además de que esta agradecido por las oportunidades que ha recibido y se compromete una vez mas a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, estará destinado a la  compra de mercadería en abarrotes como arroz, azúcar y menestras que le servirán para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Mery is 42 years old and lives with her three children in her own home.  She has had a business for more than five years.  She sells a variety of products from a small stall at the local market in her community.  This job does not have steady hours becaues she does not have a fixed place from which to sell.  Her children help her on Sundays, the days with the greatest amount of customers.  She likes this job because she can have her earnings the same day she works, even though many times her job is difficult when it is the rainy season or when she has to carry all her heavy products every day to store them until the following day.  Her future plans are to have a store in a commercial zone, and she is working very hard toward this end.  This is the second loan she has had with MFP and she has a good impression of group loans because it has been a successful experience for her, in spite of the struggles that exist in a communal bank.  She is also thankful for the opportunities she has received and promises once again to be punctual in her payments.  The loan she has requested will be used to buy groceries like rice, sugar, and mixed vegetables to increase her working capital.

loans.use: buy bags of rice, sugar, and mixed vegetables

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela is 56 years old and widowed with six adult children. She is from the village of Villa Felipa, Gingoog City. To make a living, Romela owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from buying and selling seafood products including fish such as milkfish and sardines in the local community. Romela has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Romela joined HSPFI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Romela is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional fish such as sardines and mackerel. This will be the second loan taken out by Romela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to expand and improve her business.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish such as sardines and mackerel to sell

location.town: Villa Felipa, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy, tiene 41 años, es feriante, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, huevo, harina, entre otros.
Rosa viaja la feria de San pedro de Cachi, donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras y frutas, ahí compra cereales y los vende en la Feria del Mercado las Americas los días domingos. Compra queso y panes chapla y los lleva a Lima cada 15 días y le va muy bien. 
Le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal en FINCA Perú, por la facilidad de los préstamos y  les enseñan a ahorrar. Con sus ahorros puedo comprarse un mototaxi, ahora está ahorrando para comprarse otro mototaxi para su hijo.
texts.en:
Rosa, 41, is a member of the “Tarpuy” communal bank.  She’s a vendor.  She is asking for the loan to buy groceries like: rice, sugar, noodles, eggs and flour, among others.

Rosa goes to the farmers marked in San Pedro de Cachi to sell groceries in general, fruit and vegetables.  She buys cereals there which she then sells at the Sunday Las Americas Farmers Market.  She buys cheese and “chapla” (artisanal bread baked with eucalyptus) bread that she takes to Lima every two weeks to sell; she does very well.

She enjoys the communal bank meetings in FINCA Perú because of the ease of the loans and because they teach her how to save.  She was able to use her savings to buy a mototaxi and she’s saving to buy another one for her son.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs and flour, among others.

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nelly desde hace 6 años trabaja como ventera ambulante, ella vende tinto, mecato, confites y jugos, ella vive de su negocio y con el consigue el sustento diario para su  familia, sin embargo con sus problemas de salud hay días en que no puede trabajar sino unas pocas horas en el día.

Ella necesita tener su negocio con más surtido para que cuando no se sienta enferma pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y pueda recuperar los días en que no trabaja.
texts.en:
For 6 years, Nelly has been working as a street vender.  She sells black coffee, packed lunches, sweets and juices.  Nelly supports herself through her business and with it, she earns enough to provide for her family.  However, with her health problems, there are days in which she can only work for a few hours.

Nelly needs to have her business more well-stocked so that when she isn't feeling sick, she can offer a greater variety of products for sale and make up for the days that she can't work.

loans.use: to purchase consumables.

loans.name: Darling Maria

texts.es: Darling Maria tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Inicio poco a poco ahorro y de esta manera, hoy en día gracias a todo el esfuerzo que realiza diario es que sigue con este negocio. Su fuerza luchadora que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para convertirse en una mujer empresaria. Ahora ha ganando experiencia, confianza y ya es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes. Con este crédito comprará diferentes tipos de productos como leche, carnes, golosinas, avena en paquetes,  utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal.
texts.en:
Darling Maria has a small grocery store business. She started off saving little by little and now, thanks to all of that day to day effort, she is able to carry on with this business. 

The fighting strength that has always characterized her and the desire to get ahead by her own means has been important to her transition into becoming a businesswoman. Now she has gained experience, confidence and is well known and loved by her customers. 

With this loan she will buy a variety of products like milk, meat, sweets, oatmeal packets, cleaning supplies for the home and personal hygiene products.

loans.use: to buy milk, meat, sweets, oatmeal packets, cleaning supplies for the home and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: 10 Dien Bien Group

texts.en:
Thu is the group leader of the 10 Dien Bien solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She is 49 years old and married with 2 children. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. 

Thu has a laundry business. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. In 2009,Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. Thu is requesting a loan to purchase devices to maintain her laundry shop.

With her business profits, Thu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: To purchase devices to maintain her laundry business.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Rachel is a 25-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur. She is single and for the past two years has owned a restaurant.  This successful business has helped her support herself and her extended family, especially her mother.  

She will use this loan to purchase more foodstuffs that will supply her restaurant. She plans to continue to run her restaurant and earn enough profits that will allow her to accumulate savings.

loans.use: to buy more foodstufffs to supply her restaurant

loans.name: Nasukhidin

texts.ru:
Насухидин активный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Насухидин старается быть хорошим отцом, чтобы он мог всегда обеспечить все потребности своих детей и обучит их  в престижную школу и университетах.  Для этого он выбрал транспортные услуги и более 5 лет занимается этим. Этот бизнес приносят ему стабильный доход, который он тратят их на содержание своей семьи. Насухидин хотел бы получит кредит в размере 1500$ США на приобретение запчастей и ремонт автомашины, который позволить ему расширить свой бизнес и получит желаемый прибыль.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Nasukhidin is an active and hardworking man. He is married and has four children. Nasukhidin tries to be a good father so that he can always provide for all the needs of his children and will be able to send them to prestigious schools and universities. To this end, he chose transport services and has been engaged in this work for more than five years. This business provides him a stable income, that he spends on supporting his family. Nasukhidin would like to receive a loan in the sum of US $1,500 for spare parts and repairs for his vehicle, which allows him to expand his business and get the desired profit.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to acquire spare parts and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “TESORITO ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Elizabeth tiene 29 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 2 hijos, la socia trabaja vendiendo productos naturales esotéricos en un local en tres cruces de oro, la socia trabaja desde hace 20 años con este tipo de negocio y le va muy bien, ala socia desea invertir en la compra de mercadería referente a la esoteria, ella implementara su negocio para compra mayor número de clientes. La socia también se dedica a cuidar a sus menores hijos y a la casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería referente a la esoteria. Y de este modo implementar su tienda y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Tesorito” (Little Treasure) which is located in the District of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 29 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children. Elizabeth sells natural esoteric products from a shop in Tres Cruces de Oro. She has worked in this type of business since she was 20 years old and has done very well. Elizabeth wants to invest in the purchase of esoteric merchandise so that she can keep her business in operation and entice more customers to buy. She also spends time taking care of her young children and her home. Elizabeth is requesting this loan so that she can buy esoteric products in order to keep her store running and improve her quality of life.

She is grateful for the support that has been provided and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy natural esoteric products.

loans.name: Melkisedek

texts.en:
Melkisedek is 37 years old, married to Maria, 29. They are living in a modest house with two children, who are: Fernandus, 8, in the third grade of elementary school and Angela, 1 year old. 

Melkisedek used to work as a public minivan driver. Since the income earned from that job was insufficient for his family needs, he then decided to resign and initiated a kiosk business. 

He plans to complete the stock in his kiosk by adding rice, kerosene, milk, sugar, coffee, snacks, mineral water, etc. Melkisedek is seeking a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. Through this loan Melkisedek hopes that he can improve his business. He is expecting that TLM will provide a loan for his business improvement.

loans.use: To purchase more stock such as rice, kerosene, milk, sugar, coffee, snacks, mineral water, etc.

loans.name: Lilian Giselh

texts.es:
Lilian es una microempresaria que se dedica a la venta de carnes, embutidos y mariscos, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, y junto a su esposo reside en la Colonia Lempira en el municipio de Juticalpa.

Lilian nació en una familia muy trabajadora que desde hace muchos se han dedicado a la venta de frutas y verduras. Y como familia escaza de recursos economicos no podian pagar empleados asi que Lilian estuvo muy involucrada en el negocio familiar. Luego los años fueron pasando y en Marzo de 2011 Lilian se casó y junto a su esposo decidió instalar en un local alquilado una venta de carnes, embutidos y mariscos. Su esposo la apoya con su negocio realizando ventas de forma ambulante, mientras ella atiende la carniceria en un horario de 6:00 am hasta las 3:00 pm.   

Lilian necesita el prestamo para la compra de diversos tipos de carnes como costilla y tajo de res, de cerdo, embutidos como ser hot dogs, chorizos, mortadela, jamon, y comprar mariscos como camarones, jailas, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su negocio estará mejor surtido y sus clientes tendran muchas opciones para comprar.   

Su sueño es procrear dos hijos, tener su propia casa y un local para no pagar alquiler. Tiene dos ciclos de trabajar en FAMA y ha sido una clienta puntual con sus pagos y eso le ha ayudado a mantener activo su negocio.
texts.en:
Lilian is a micro-entrepreneur who sells meats, sausage, and shellfish.  She is 30 years old and married, and lives with her husband in the Lempira neighborhood in the town of Juticalpa.

Lilian was born into a very hard-working family that has sold fruit and vegetables for many years.  As a family of limited economic means, they weren't able to pay employees, so Lilian was very involved in the family business.  Then the years went by and in March 2011 Lilian got married, and with her husband decided to open a meat, sausage, and shellfish stall in a rented place.  Her husband supports her business by selling on foot while she tends the butcher shop from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.

Lilian needs the loan to buy various types of meats such as ribs and slices of beef and pork, sausage as to make hot dogs, chorizo, mortadella, and ham, and to buy shellfish like shrimp, crab, and others.  Her business will be better stocked with the support of this loan, and her customers will have many options.

Her dream is to have two children, her own house, and her own place where she won't have to pay rent.  She has worked for two cycles with FAMA and has been punctual with her payments, which has helped her keep her business active.

loans.use: to buy beef, pork, sausage, and shellfish.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George, 28, is a hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with two children. For over two years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He also raises cattle to boost his income.  In the next five years, he wants to become successful in his business. His dream is to buy a van for transport business. With the 20,000 Kenya shillings, he will buy a calf.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Madzimai Group

texts.en:
Teekla is 38 years old, married with four children.   Three of her children go to school.  She lives in Mucheke, Masvingo, with her husband, children and also has two other dependents. 

Her husband is formally employed with the local government.  Teekla buys and sells clothes and kapenta (small, dried fish) and has been in the business for more than 2 years.  The business faces financial challenges, she will use the loan to buy clothes and kapenta for resale. The loan will improve her family's life, enabling her to buy food and clothes. 

Over the next five years, Teekla wishes to open a boutique in town.

loans.use: To buy clothes and kapenta

loans.name: Dana Kerti Group

texts.en:
The group received Rp 15,000,000 for the loan and each member will receive Rp 1,500,000.

Jro Ayu is using the loan to purchase two superior piglets and feed. Each of the superior piglets now is Rp 450,000. She will maintain the piglets for six months for fattening. She hopes the business will run well and she can earn enough profit at the end.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Lorena Patricia

texts.es:
Lorena Patricia,  tiene 23caños de edad es soltera y estudia la universidad, vive con sus padres en un barrio pequeño y tiene dos hermanos.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ropas para luego venderlo en su local que tiene rentado, en donde lleva trabajando hace cinco años  en la que comenzó apoyando a su mama y decidió independizarse  y comenta que le va bien.

   Quien lo inspiro en esta actividad fue su mama quien es la que le surte para que su negocio este siempre surtido y sus clientes encuentre lo que desean comprar.

    Esta contenta y agradecida con el préstamo ya que con ello podrá incrementar más su negocio que es con lo que se apoya para tener y pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lorena Patricia, 23, is single and studies in the university.  She lives with her parents in a small neighborhood and has two siblings.

She requested the loan to invest in buying clothing to later sell in her place, which she rents.  She has been doing this work for five years.  She began helping her mother and decided to work independently, and she comments that it's going well for her.

What inspired her in this work was her mother, who is the one who supplies her so her business is always supplied and her customers find what they want to buy.

She is happy and grateful for the loan, since with it she will be able to increase her business, with which she supports herself and pays for her studies.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hynoon

texts.en:
Hynoon is married and a very responsible father who provides for the needs of his family. 

Hynoon is requesting a loan of P 10,000 to buy materials that he needs in his auto shop, to better serve his clients.

Hynoon dreams that someday he will give his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials to use for her auto shop business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen, 48 years old, is married and has four children ranging from 11 to 22 years old. He describes himself as optimistic. He runs a retail store where he renders the service of repairing televisions and radios. The business is faced with the problem of inadequate funds to maintain it. He will be using the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to expand his repair store.

loans.use: To extend the store for electronics repair.

loans.name: Rhubie

texts.en:
Rhubie is from the village of Clarin. She is 39 years old. Rhubie is married. To make a living, Rhubie owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rhubie has been engaged in her business for over 8 year and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month from these activities.


In 2004, Rhubie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rhubie has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Rhubie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more stocks to sell. This loan will be the 26th loan taken out by Rhubie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Grace Wairimu

texts.en: Grace, 39 years old, is a married woman. She has 2 children, a son and a daughter, at 6 and 23 years. She describes herself as a determined, honest and open-minded woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 17 years. Her primary customers are frequent and new. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the loan to add to her stock of potatoes. Her business goal is to be supplying potatoes within 5 years to retailers.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
This is Aurora, 59, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arnulfo, a farmer, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Aurora grows pineapples and some bananas on her farm located in Cavite.  Her farm is in the highlands, where it is suitable to grow pineapple and bananas. She regularly sells her products to markets and fruit stores, as well as to the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 6,000 each month.

To help continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will also go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Aurora dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets each week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her business.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Due to hardships of life, Emelinda helps her husband in managing their rice farming business to ensure a fruitful harvest. She is now 41 years old and has three school-age children. They planned to educate their children so that they will be having a bright future. Despite the hardships they encountered in farming, they have the patience and determination to work out their plans.

They aimed to expand their rice plantation to ensure a high production, due to insufficient capital, Emelinda is asking for an additional of P13,000 to buy breeding seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost incurred in planting rice. They believe that their patience and hard work will bear a good fruits and hoping that they will become financial stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy breeding seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost incurred in planting rice

loans.name: Gyulnara

texts.en: In Kapan city of Syunik region lives Gyulnara with her retired husband. Gyulnara has two daughters and a son. All of them are already married and they live with their families. Gyulnara has vocational education and a specialty of accountant. Many years she worked at the bank as an accountant now she also works of her profession at the school this time. Gyulnara is the employed in her family since her husband is a pensioner. This loan of 300.000 Armenian drams she needs for the purchase of computer since she would like also to manage some part of her work at her house also since working only at the school she does not manage to finish her daily accountancy work properly.

loans.use: for the purchase of computer since she would like also to manage some part of her work at her house

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a widow aged 50 years with 6 children. Single handedly, she has been able to educate her children where one is in secondary school while three are in college and two have finished college but not yet employed.

She is an active member of Anglican Church of Kenya where she is a choir member. Also she is a member of Kabuta Ladies in Action a community based organization whose activities aim at uplifting and promoting income generating activities at house hold level.

Joyce is a farmer and grows maize, beans, coffee, Potatoes and Vegetables both for sale and home consumption. More so, she sells milk which gives her about USD 10 per month.

loans.use: Joyce wants to pay school fees for her children because her business’s cash flow is low but can raise the money in three months.

loans.name: Roseline Amojong

texts.en: Rose is married	with three children who are all in primary school. She has not undergone any training. She started her business in 2002 and through her business she provides for her family. Her business involves buying cereals from the local farmers and selling them at the nearest market. With a loan from PEMCI, she intends to increase her stock to be able to meet the demands of her customers which she has been unable to due to lack of enough capital. Through her business she has inspired many community women to enroll together and start up small scale businesses that enable them to raise their social status and provide basic necessities.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business.

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 38 years old, and her husband is 43. They have one son, 15 years old and one daughter 17 yrs old, both at school. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper center of Vietnam.  Together with her husband, she raises frogs and eels and sells them from her house.  She wants a loan so that she can offer her frogs and eels to 8 restaurants in the area. This means that she has to invest more in her business to provide for these restaurants' needs.

loans.use: To buy more eels and frogs for trading

loans.name: Ibrahim Sorie

texts.en: Ibrahim Sorie B. is a petty trader.  He owns a shop at the Fadugu main market in Sierra Leone. Ibrahim is forty years old and married with four children.  His business is the only source of income for the family.  He also takes care of seven other members of his extended family.  Before his first loan, Ibrahim had a small table shop.  His previous loans enabled him to expand his business and build the small store from the profits.  He will complete his repayments at the end of August, and would like another loan of $350 to further expand his business.  Ibrahim said the only bright future for the children under his responsibility is to provide them with an education.  His main expenses are the school fees and requirements.

loans.use: Petty trader

loans.name: Claudia Marlene

texts.es:
Miss Claudia is a diligent and noble mother even though she has faced adversity and has suffered a lot. She learned to overcome those adversities thanks to her integrity and the strength that she has for the well being of her little children. Unfortunately, four years ago she lost her husband and since then she started her own business selling second hand clothes to the towns near by Juliaca, the city she lives in. This business is allowing her to offer her familily with fianancial security and education. Claudia wants to buy more used clothes to increase her stock of clothing and to be able to do this she needs a $400 dollar loan to make her wishes come true.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Claudia, es una diligente y noble madre de familia que pese a las adversidades y sufrimientos que tuvo que pasar en su vida, aprendió a sobrellevarlas gracias a la entereza y fuerza que la caracteriza para bienestar de sus pequeños niños. Hace cuatro años desafortunadamente perdió a su esposo y desde entonces decidió incursionar en el negocio de venta de ropas de segundo uso en los pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad en la que vive, Juliaca, este negocio le está permitiendo brindar educación y estabilidad económica a su familia.Anhela comprar más fardos de ropa usada, para aumentar el stock de sus prendas de vestir y para esto esta solicitando un préstamo de 400 dólares, dinero con el que podrá hacer realidad sus deseos.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Sifaheri

texts.en: Sifaheri is a prospecting young entrepreneur and a resident of the Lumo area in Dar es Salaam. She runs a ladies' salon and a small grocery store. She spends more time in the salon because it pays more than the grocery. She has employed one person in the grocery and one in her salon. She is in need of more resources to help her expand her salon, buy the latest cosmetics and buy more equipment to cater to more customers. She needs $375 to help achieve this.

loans.use: To expand her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fill her store with more products

loans.name: Tânia Nhelete

texts.pt:
Tânia Nhelete M. resides in the Mahotas district. She is married and is the mother of 3 children. She is now entering the program and asking for $225.00US for 5 months. She has a shack in her house where she sells necessary products like rice, sugar, and more. With the loan she will purchase more products.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Tânia Nhelete M. portadora do BI nº 110692609A residente no bairro das Mahotas mãe de 3 filhgos vivendo maritalmente esta e entrar no programa vai tomar o valor de 5000 mt para pagar em 5 meses tem uma barraca em sua casa vende produtos de 1º nececidade tais como arroz açucar e mais com o valor vais aumentar alguns produtos.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa T. V. belongs to the "Women in Action" Banco Comunal in Picota. She lives in the San Martín region of the Picota province in the district of Picota. Her business is loacted at 236 Jr. Bolognesi and she makes and sells bread and other staple products.

She started this business in order to earn more income and to improve her family's quality of life.

With this loan of 2000 soles, which she will repay over 6 months she will buy sacks of flour, butter, milk, sugar and other ingredients to make bread and thus meet the needs of the members of her community.

Rosa is 36 years old, lives with her husband and has 4 children. Two of her children live with her and two are pursuing higher education in the country's capital.

Her dream is to have a large bakery where she will offer the widest variety of breads and pastries to her distinguished clientèle.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa T. V., pertenece al B.C. “Mujeres en Acción” de Picota, vive en la región de San Martín provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi 236 y se dedica a la producción/venta de pan y otros productos de primera necesidad.

Ella emprendió este negocio con la finalidad de tener mayores ingresos, para brindarle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.

Con el crédito de S/.2000.00, que devolverá en un plazo de 6 meses, comprara sacos de harina,, mantecas, leches, azúcar y demás insumos para la elaboración de pan y de esa manera satisfacer las necesidades de los pobladores de la localidad.

La señora ROSA tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 viven con ella, y 2 están realizando sus estudios superiores en la capital del país.

Su sueño es tener una gran panadería donde oferte la más grande variedad de panes y postres a su distinguida clientela.

loans.use: With the loan she would like to buy ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 51 years old, married and has 6 children. She sells oranges and has been in business since 1990. Esther needs a loan of $525 to purchase more oranges for sale.

loans.use: To buy more oranges for sale.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina is a 43-year-old mother of seven children, all of whom are currently in school. She sells various food products like frozen fish, frozen beef, frozen chicken thighs, and garden eggs, as well charcoal, which is the main source of fire for cooking in the majority of Ghanaian homes.

She would like to provide her children with a high-quality education, so she is seeking a loan to buy more bags of charcoal, crates, frozen food products, and the like in order to generate additional income.

She is member of the group called “Eye Yehowa” (meaning, "it is God"). Group members happily guarantee each other as social collateral to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To generate additional income so that she can provide her children with a high-quality education by purchasing additional food products (e.g., frozen fish and meats, garden eggs, crates of tomatoes, and cartons of tin fish) and charcoal

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng N., age 56, is a widow and works as a weaver in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. People in Cambodia, especially women, like wearing silk dresses made by hand. A silk dress is very expensive, and people wear these dresses when they attend weddings or big ceremonies related to Khmer traditions. Depending on how good the decoration and silk is, a dress can cost more than $50 . Some weavers spend up to 10 days completing one dress. Heng has has one younger sister who is also a widow, and one daughter who is married and works as a garment worker earning $80 a month.

To make more money to support the family, Heng is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a wooden boat so she can fish in the rainy season. She will also purchase piglets to raise for sell. This extra income will be very beneficial to her family well-being.

loans.use: To purchase a wooden boat for fishing and piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Gertrudis Alexandra

texts.es:
Gertrudis is 44 years old, she lives in the 3-80 neighborhood, is married, has two children ages 6 and 16. Her husband works in a company as an operator and contributes to the home expenses.

The business of Gertrudis is the sale of clothing and cosmetics, she has 16 years of experience and started with her own efforts. With the loan requested she will buy construction materials to build a room for her children to be more comfortable.

She hopes in the future to start a general store from her house and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Gertrudis tiene 44 años de edad, habita en el barrio 3-80, es casada, con dos niños de 6 y 16 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose como aoperario y aporta con los gastos del hogar.

El negocio de doña Gertrudis es la venta de ropa y cosméticos, tiene 16 años de experiencia, ella inició con esfuerzos propios. Con el préstamo solcitado comprará materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto de habitación para así darle más comodidad a sus hijos.

Espera en un futuro poner una pulpería en su casa para así mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish building a room.

loans.name: Margarita Marcelina

texts.es:
Sra. C., 45, is single and has one daughter who is now in her first year at a local university. She's received five loans from our institution. She began as a street vendor, selling cosmetics. With the loans, she has set up a small kiosk where she sells photocopying services along with cold drinks and snacks. She still operates the cosmetics business, as well. She started as a way out of unemployment and the businesses have served to support her and to support her daughter's studies for 10 years.

With the loan, Sra. C. plans to continue investing in the business and improving her house, itself a product of her earnings. She lives in her own house. She can't depend on relatives for financial help and her business is her sole source of income.

Sra. C.' greatest dream is to have a place of her own because the one she has now is small and rented. She would like to offer other products such as Internet services and eventually, with the Lord's blessing and your support, to have the opportunity to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora C., tiene 45 años, es soltera tiene una hija menor de edad actualmente cursa el primer año de la universidad, no tiene esposo, ha trabajado cinco creditos con nuestra institución, inicio ofertando cosmeticos de forma ambulante, con los creditos ha instalado un pequeño kiosko donde ofrece servicios de fotocopiado, vende frescos naturales y respoteria manteniendo siempre su actividad inicial como es la venta de cosmeticos. Su negocio surge como una alternativa al desempleo con el cual ha podido ir saliendo adelante sin dejar de apoyar a su hija en sus estudios, teniendo 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.

Con el financiamiento pretende seguirle invirtiendo al negocio, e ir mejorando poco a poco su casa producto de las ganancias, vive en casa propia, no tiene ayuda economica de familiares, depende de su negocio en su totalidad.
