Su mayor sueño, es tener un lugar propio, ya que donde esta es pequeño y alquila, y ofertar mercadería así como brindar el servicio de Internet., que poco a poco con la bendicion de Dios y el apoyo nuestro tendrá la oportunidad de ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Guljamol

texts.ru:
Гулджамол родилась 21 марта  1969 года. После развода с мужем осталась с двумя  детьми. Чтобы прокормить семью она решила заняться предпринимательской деятельностью. Так, как она раньше работала в Райпотребсоюзе, имела опыт продавца. Она арендовала торговую точку в Центральном рынке города Вахдат для продажи парфюмерий. Наращивая свой опыт предпринимателя Гулджамол на вырученные деньги с бизнеса пускала в оборот увеличивая ассортимент товаров. В ее ассортименте добавились детские игрушки, постельное белье, женские косынки и приборы бытового обслуживания. 
Свои товары она закупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. Для расширения ассортимента, покупка разновидностей постельного белья и бытовых приборов хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони сроком на 11 месяцев.
texts.en:
Guljamol was born on March 21st, 1969. After divorcing her husband, she was left with two children. She decided to become an entrepreneur to support her family. Since she had already worked in the regional Consumer's Association, she had experience in sales. She rented a booth in the central market in the town of Vahdat to sell perfume. Gaining experience as an entrepreneur, Guljamol used the money she earned to expand her line of products. The assortment of items she sold came to include toys, bed linen, scarves, and household items. She buys her merchandise at the whole-sale market Korvon in Dushanbe. She wants to take out a loan for 4100 somoni in order to expand her line of linen and household items. The loan will be repaid in full within 11 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of household items

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Tran Thi A. joined TYM in 2004. Since then she has borrowed several loans and invested most of them in animal-raising. Nowadays, in addition to this business, Mrs. A. weaves bamboo baskets while her husband works for other people to generate more income. With an income of VND 2.5 million/month, her family's living standard has been improving gradually. Now she wants to borrow VND 9 million to buy breeding animals and cattle-feed.

loans.use: to buy breeding animals and cattle-feed.

loans.name: Ndiaya

texts.fr: Ndiaya F., 26 ans, célibataire sans enfant avec 02 personnes à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Ndoucoura depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de restauration (vente de plats de poulet, de soupe, sandwich, café et autres). Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.<b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Ndiaya F., age 26, is unmarried and has no children, though she has two people in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Ndoucoura for six years. She wants to bolster her catering business (selling chicken dishes, soup, sandwiches, coffee, and so on). Her income enables her to help cover the day-to-day expenses of her family. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food service

loans.name: Maria Tarcila

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Gracias Morenita Village Bank. 

She is 38 years old and married with six children.  Maria buys junk cars, which she then sends to repair, fix dents, paint and resell.  Her husband has a bodywork and paint shop where the couple works fixing up cars.  Maria also works as a seamstress from a small workshop in her home. 

Maria needs a loan of 1000 soles to help her buy junk cars. 

Maria’s dreams are to expand her workshop, launch a clothing manufacturing business, and guarantee a good future for her children.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Maria Es socia del Banco Comunal Gracias Morenita.
Maria es casada, tiene 38 años y 6 hijos, Maria se dedica a la compra de carros chatarra que luego hace reparar, planchar, pintar, luego los comercializa. Su esposo tiene un taller de Planchado y Pintura con el cual trabajan para los arreglos de los carros. Además Maria tiene un pequeño taller de confección de prendas de vestir en su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la como parte de pago de carros.
Los sueños de Maria son ampliar su taller, implementar una fabrica de ropa y estabilizar el futuro de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy junk cars

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben S., 26, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. This couple has one child who does not attend school yet. She works with her husband selling roast beef and pork and other foodstuffs with beers and wines from their house.  They make $12 a day. She is asking a loan of $1000 to increase capacity and sales volume. (Ben took pictured with her husband)

loans.use: To purchase beer and wine.

loans.name: Margaret Shu

texts.en:
Born on 24th June 1967, Margaret is married to John Shu  and they have four children; she lives in Ngomgham, within the urban township of Bamenda, Cameroon.  With this loan, Margaret plans to invest in her provisions store.  More specifically, she will add off-licence to the provisions store, purchase two phones for her callbox (telephone booth) business, firewood and raw foodstuffs.  
 
This is Margaret's fifth loan; she has been a member of GHAPE since September 21st, 2004. She has a great deal of experience in her provisions store business; added to that, she will be selling wholesale as well as retailing.  Over the years, her customers have increased on a regular basis. She also feels that she has an excellent site for her business. 

Last year Margaret was emotionally disturbed when her house was scattered by the council, and she had to carry her family to beg a house and sleep inside. Finally, Margaret was seriously attacked by thieves and carried everything in her provision store from which she struggled to recover.

She plans to repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

The profit from this loan will be used to pay her children's school fees.  She will also invest much of her profit back into her business.  The rest will be used to clothe her children well, provide medical assistance for her family, and feed her family.  
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, beans, groundnuts, oil, and firewood, call centre

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La señora Felicia tiene 57 años de edad, es casada, tiene hijos ya mayores de edad, vive en el barrio muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Itá. 

Se dedica a la compra – venta de aparatos celulares, los cuales adquiere de Buenos Aires (Argentina), hace más de 5 años. Sus ventas las realiza en la ciudad de Itá, Itaugua y alrededores.

La señora Felicia opera con la la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2006 en forma excelente.

Solicita el préstamo para cubrir la buena demanda de mercaderías que tiene, ya que sus clientes realizan sus compras al por mayor.
texts.en:
Felicia is 57 years old, married, and has adult children. She lives in a neighbourhood very close to downtown Itá. She buys and sells cell phones which she acquires in Buenos Aires, Argentina. She has been in this business for more than five years. She sells in the city of Itá and surrounding areas. Felicia has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2006; she is an excellent client. She is asking for this loan to satisfy the demand for her goods as her customers are buying from her in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cell phones for resale.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora Rosa L. con gran dedicación se desempeña en su actividad de venta de ropa comercializada todos los días con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Es de suma importancia destacar que hoy en día ella con mucha esperanza acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la ropa para comercializarla y por esto espera ser aprobada para continuar de esta manera con su actividad en el mercado
texts.en:
In the wholesale market of the city of Managua, Rosa L. sells clothing with great dedication and the purpose to bring money home. It is very important to indicate that she was very hopeful when she approached Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase clothes for sale and hopes to be approved for the loan and this way continue with her activity at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his fields and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mrs. Mary Jane T. is a 33-year-old married mother of two children, and lives at Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. For Mary, though raising children is an uphill task, it makes the parents’ struggle worth it. Since Mary was skilled and experienced in manicure/pedicure, she turned it into her business to earn a living. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in October 2008 to avail its loan facilities and benefits. In order to help her husband, who is a motor-cab driver, she started a new business of selling ready-to-wear (RTW) garments, aside from her manicure/pedicure service. She applies for PHP 10,000 to buy additional RTW garments and nail polish of various colors. Through this economic activity, she will be able to address the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional RTW clothes and nail polish

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma S. owns a small piggery. She raises pigs to help her husband earn a little income to support the growing needs of her family. She is 42 years old and has four children. Someday, she will have a bigger piggery so that she will be able to send all her children to college.

She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy pig feed. And because she also manages a small rice farm, she will use some of her loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. CEVI gives all its clients not just credit assistance, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and four sacks of rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar es socia del Bancomunal Juan Pablo II
Pilar es conviviente tiene 45 años, tiene un hijo de un año.
Pilar trabajaba en el bazar del ejército, sufrió un accidente y dejo de trabajar, después de un tiempo alquilo un puesto y puso un  bazar en el mercado y por las tardes vende salchi-papas. 
Pilar necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles, para la alhajas de oro de catorce por el día de la madre
Desde que está en Finca aprendió ahorrar, ser responsable, su económica ha mejorado tiene más capital para invertir.
El sueño de Pilar es comprarse un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Pilar is a member of the Juan Pablo II cooperative bank. Pilar is married, 45 years old, and has a one-year-old son. Pilar worked at the military store, but suffered an accident and had to stop working. After some time, she rented a stall in the market and sold salchi-papas (pan fried sausage mixed with French fries) in the afternoons. Pilar needs a loan of 2800 soles to buy 14k gold jewelry for Mother’s Day. Since starting with Finca, she has learned how to save, be responsible, and her financial situation has improved as she has more capital to invest. Pilar’s dream is to buy her own stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pilar needs a loan of 2800 soles, to buy 14k gold jewelry for Mother's Day.

loans.name: Abdumutalib

texts.ru: У Абдумуталиба необычная профессия – он точильщик ножей. Каждый день с утра до вечера работает на рынке – точит ножи, ножницы и другие инструменты. Доход небольшой но другого занятия у Абдумуталиба нет. Кроме этого он и его отец откармливают скотину дома. Недавно семья Абдумуталиба решила женить его младшего сына и поэтому понадобилась небольшая сумма денег. Абдумуталиб решил обратиться за ними в МикроИнвест и оформил заявку на займ. Данный займ собирается погасить в течении 3 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdumutalib has an unusual profession – he sharpens knives. Every day from morning until evening he works at the market – sharpens knives, scissors and other tools. The income is not big, but Abdumutalib does have another occupation. In addition, he and his father fatten livestock at home. Recently, Abdumutalib’s family decided to marry off his younger son and this is why he needed a small sum of money. Abdumutalib decided to turn to MicroInvest for it and filled out a loan application. He plans to pay back the loan quickly.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wedding

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
This young man received his first loan from Kiva in 2007 and improved his business. He works in currency exchange and he did not change his business. Azer says, "I like my business. This business is very interesting." 

He now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy equipment necessary for improving his business. He says, "Hi Kiva lenders. Thank you very much for the loan."

loans.use: To buy the necessary equipment for improving his business.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is forty years old, married, and has given birth to two children, both of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Faustina works to support her husband so as to be able to provide for the family. She sells ladies’ wear such as ready-made clothes, footwear, etc. She hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell her goods and also treks to other towns to sell.

Faustina has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock. She aspires to sponsor her children in school to the higher levels.

loans.use: To buy more ladies’ wear in bulk to increase her stock

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is from the village of Mitacas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Helen is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from "Habal-Habal" business, transporting folks from town center to their residence. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used maintenance for their motorcycle and repair. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: maintenance and repair of their motor cycle

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Forty years old, Susana D. is a rice grower from Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has two children, both in school. Her husband, Emelito D. is very supportive of her and helps her manage their small rice field. Currently, they are tilling a 3-hectare farm. The harvest that the couple gets from farming rice has gone far in paying their daily family costs.

Knowing the wide services of Community Economic Ventures in their location, Susana never hesitates to apply for a loan, hoping that this will help improve the size of her harvest. The loan that she will soon be accessing will help a lot in buying fertilizers and herbicides. She also aspires of venturing into another business to help supplement their income.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is 28 years old. She is married and lives with her two children. She was not available at the time, so her husband is shown in the photograph instead.

Dalal is a very hard worker and exerts herself as a cattle-raiser. Each day her livestock increases and her animals are highly valued at the markets.

Now, Dalal wants to increase the number of livestock she keeps. In order to do this she is requesting a loan of $1000. Be an important part of the growth of Dalal’s business!

loans.use: To purchase more sheep to expand her business

loans.name: María Leonor

texts.es: María Leonor P. D. C.  D. 59 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango municipio del gran San Salvador. María vive su esposo y su única hija, Gabriela D. 19 años D. edad estudiante D. bachillerato. María posee su negocio desD. su casa, donD. su principal herramienta D. trabajo, es la maquina coser, María confecciona variedad D. ropa a la medida, el crédito que solita es para comprar tela y así poder fabricar camisas para ser vendidas con sus clientes, María ya ha manejado créditos los cuales ha pagado siendo muy puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
María Leonor P. D. C., 59, lives in the Soyapango municipality of the great San Salvador. María lives with her husband and their only daughter, Gabriela. Gabriela is 19, and she is studying for her bachelor’s degree. María has a business, which she runs from home. Her main work tool is her sewing machine. She makes a variety of custom maD. clothes. The loan she is asking for is to buy fabric in order to be able to make shirts to sell to her customers. María has managed loans. She has paid them back, and she was very punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Noon

texts.en: K., 47, has been a farmer for years. In addition, she operates a loom out of her home, which she uses to operate a silk-weaving business. She is married to San Rom, 52, who is currently planting a variety of vegetables to earn a living. This couple has five single children, one of whom is employed. K. is aware that her weaving business is very profitable because she has earned significant income from it.  She also has a lot of customers who recognize the high quality of the silk she braids. K. will use her loan to purchase a new loom to better satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase an extra loom to better satisfy the needs of her customers

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 30 year old, married woman with three children. Her children are between the ages of 3 and 10 years. All of her children go to school. The family resides and rents a one room house; five people live in the house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. In addition to her children, Harriet also takes care of additional family members. Harriet's monthly expenses include feeding and housing her family and paying for medication.

To earn a living, Harriet runs a ladies salon in Busega Kiribedda. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. Her expenses include transportation costs to and from the salon and shopping for goods. She buys her cosmetics from a shop in Kampala City. On average, Harriet receives 10 customers a day at her salon. She has been in this business five years. Her business challenges include transportation and rainy season, which hinders her customers who travel to come to her.

She has been with MCDT four years and she is servicing her eighth loan, working with the same group of women. Harriet wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of relaxers and cosmetics. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and she would like to start buying directly from manufactures.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream and relaxers

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando P. reside en el departamento de Usulután. Rolando tiene 49 años de edad, es soltero y actualmente vive con su madre doña Esperanza. Rolando es muy conocido por su experiencia en las ventas, desde hace muchos años él se dedica a comercializar cualquier tipo de mercadería, ahora tiene un puesto ubicado en el centro de Usulután donde vende y repara relojes, también ofrece bolsones y otro tipo de joyas, el crédito que el solicita es para suministrar su negocio de variedad de artículos y así seguir ampliando sus ventas al igual que sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rolando P. is a resident of the department of Usulután. He is 49 years old, single, and currently lives with his mother Doña Esperanza. Rolando is well-known for his sales experience and has been dedicated to marketing any type of product. He now has a vending location in central Usulután where he sells and repairs watches. Rolando also offers handbags and other types of jewelry.

He is requesting a loan to restock his business with a variety of products so that he can continue increasing his sales as well as his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Nicasio Antonio

texts.es: Nicasio Antonio tiene la edad de 65 años, tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. El se dedica a la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio ofreciendo la venta de productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y frijoles. Por lo que el principal negocio de Nicasio es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ofreciéndoles lo que ellos solicitan. Es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 ya que por medio ella las organizaciones amigas dan el apoyo necesario y solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, bisutería y leche en bolsa. Su deseo es convertir su negocio en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Nicasio Antonio is 65 years old and has 3 children, all of whom work independently. He devotes his time to running a small shop, which he has done for 5 years. Initially, he offered basic products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and beans. Since Nicasio's main business is to satisfy the needs of his customers, he offers the items they request. This is why he has turned to Fundación León 2000, since through these organizations friends give each other needed support. He is requesting financing for working capital to purchase basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, sodas, trinkets and powdered milk. He hopes to convert his business and become a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel R. M. de 27 años de edad, reside en Colón en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas menores de edad. Víctor es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se ha esforzado por tener su propio negocio, lo cual en muchas ocasiones es muy difícil de sostenerlo a flote. El posee una tienda en la cual comercializa todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, los cuales son fundamentales en todo hogar. Es por ello que Victor solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir la tienda con más productos tales como embutidos, pan, detergentes, entre otros más. Esto lo hace con el fin de poder mejorar su negocio y así mismo las ventas de este. Víctor se ha esforzado mucho por tener lo que hasta ahora ha obtenido, lo cual lo llena de satisfacción al verlo reflejado en el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel R. M. is 27 years old. He lives in Colón, in the department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife and their two young daughters. Victor is a hard-working person and has strived to have his own business, which is often difficult to keep afloat. He has a store that sells products for general needs that are necessary in every home. Victor is requesting a loan so that he can stock his store with more products such as cold meats, bread, and detergents, amongst others, in the hopes of improving his business and its sales. Victor has strived hard to have what he now has. It fills him with satisfaction to see it reflecting in the wellbeing of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general store supplies

loans.name: Amparo Noemí

texts.es: Amparo Noemí  M. A. de 43 años de edad, reside en Jayaque, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual deja muy buenas ganancias, ya que es la única tienda que se encuentra en el lugar. Es por esto que Amparo desea poder comprar más productos, ya que ella sabe que su tienda cuenta con muy buena demanda y al surtirla más, mayores serán sus ganancias. Amparo solicita un préstamo a través de cual pueda comprar productos como granos básicos, embutidos, leche en polvo, café y otras cosas más. Para ella es de mucha importancia mejorar las ganancias ya que esto le permitirá darle una mejor vida a sus hijos y así mismo le permitirá pagarle los estudios universitarios, ya que uno de los mayores sueños para ella y su esposo es ver a sus hijos como profesionales con posibilidades de un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Amparo Noemí M. A. is 43 years old and lives in Jayaque in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and their two children, who are both studying. She has a store where she sells perishable goods, which gives her a very good income as it is the only store in the area. Amparo would like to buy more products because she knows her store has strong demand, and if she expands, her income will grow. Amparo is seeking a loan so she can buy goods like grains, sausages, powdered milk, coffee, and other things. It is very important to her to increase her income as it allows her to provide a better life for her children and will also allow her to pay for their university studies. One of her and her husband's big dreams is to see their children grow up to be professionals with opportunities for a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities

loans.name: Carla Lilian

texts.es:
La Sra. Carla vive en la zona de San  Pedro de nuestra ciudad, en la calle Julio Sanches, ella trabaja como cajera de una entidad financiera y aprovecha su contacto con las personas para dedicarse a su segunda actividad que es el comercio de ropa. Ella es madre soltera de tres hijas mujeres y trata de salir adelante por ellas, es una persona que esta activa y esta siempre con las ganas de hacer todo tipo de negocio con ropa de temporada y de muy buena calidad. esta muy contenta de poder incrementar su capital de trabajo comprando mercaderia.						
						
La Sra. Carla esta agradecida con Emprender y  Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Carla lives in the San Pedro area of our city, on Julio Sanches Street. She works as a teller at a financial services institution. Contact with people in this job allows her to engage in another business, specifically, clothing sales. She is a single mother, with three daughters, for whose sake she would like to be successful. She is active, always looking for business with seasonal, high-quality clothing. She is happy at the prospect of increasing her working capital by purchasing merchandise. Carla is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their faith in her, shown by granting her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 53 years old and has a 15-year-old child. Alfredo started farming several years ago and, although he has been in this business for quite a long time now, he still experiences failure when it comes to harvest. But he treats this as a normal part of farming.

Alfredo is determined to double his harvest so he is able to provide for his family’s needs. He requested a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI which will be used to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies needed on his farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito M. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. He is 56 years old. Benito is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Benito raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Benito has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP during harvest season.

In 2008, Benito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 37,000 PHP from ASKI. Benito is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Benito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. `

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick O. is a businessman who lives and does business in Manyole village, Nambale, Busia District. He is 42 years old, married, and has seven children.
Erick started his dairy farming business back in June 2008, after trying a series of other businesses such as brick making and running a retail shop. These were all to no success as his profit margin was too low. However, since starting his dairy, things have been working out nicely with his stock of both pure and upgraded dairy cows. He buys supplies such as feed and drugs daily, since his products are also sold daily.
Due to the current demand for his products, Erick wants to add more cows to his herd. He wants to be able to expand his business to reach more customers, and therefore increase his profit margin in the long term. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES.

loans.use: To buy more cows

loans.name: Gerbacio

texts.es:
Gerbacio es viudo y trabaja como albañil, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la mantención de su familia; tiene 4  hijos con las edades de 4, 6,8 y 12 años. Tiene su domicilio en la  Zona de Villa Ingenio de la  ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción (arena, cemento, ladrillo, estuco) para la construcción de su casa.
 
Es su quinto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Gerbacio is a widower and works as a bricklayeer; this is his main source of income to support his family of four children, who are 4, 6, 8 and 12 years of age. He lives in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto. He will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies (sand, cement, bricks, stucco) to build his house. This is his 5th loan with Impro; his good repayment behavior qualifies him to seek another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional commodities for her business.

loans.name: Osita

texts.en:
Our featured entrepreneur is an active Barangay official from Silangit, Tangub City. Mrs.Osita R. is a Barangay Councilor, 53 years of age, married and blessed with 4 children, 2 young adults and 2 teenagers. Her husband earns an income as a “jabal-jabal” (single motor vehicle for hire) driver. Although he earns an average income of 150 PHP a day, it is not enough to support the family and that is why Mrs. R. undoubtedly engaged in business. She opened up a little sari-sari store and for 2 years she has been able to sustain her business. She is now earning an average net income of 1,500 PHP a month. With good luck, she was also elected as a Barangay Councilor and earns an average honorarium of 3,000 PHP a month, which is so helpful.

With her good reputation in Barangay and her good credit repayment record, Mrs. R. was given the privilege to obtain a first loan of 5,000 PHP. She is now applying for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to add to her capital for her sari-sari store. The future income from this loan will be used to meet the family's daily needs, for loan repayment and for savings. Mrs. R. is hoping that someday her children will finish their studies right up to college, for their good future.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris A. is a 47-year-old farmer who breeds cattle in a small village in the Saatli region of Azerbaijan. He is married and has two sons.

Idris breeds calves and then sells them to the local butchers for meat production. He spends all day grazing cattle in the open and this job needs a lot of effort.

Idris applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Séna Akouété

texts.en:
Monsieur Séna D. sells construction materials in the Nukafu quarter of Lomé, Togo. He is 37 years old and married to a school teacher. They have one child.

Séna sells paint, tools, and other construction materials. He is taking his first microloan from WAGES of 300,000 CFA to reinforce his sales.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es:
Jonathan es un emprendedor joven de 25 años de edad, el vive en la casa de sus padres con sus hermanos. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a vender soporte de motores para carros, pues tiene un pequeño taller en el cual labora durante todo el día. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le permite brindarle bienestar a su familia, por otro lado esta labor requiere de esfuerzo físico y por ello debe ponerle mucho empeño y ganas. En un futuro desea instalar un negocio propio, pero aún tiene tiempo para saber cual le será rentable. Jonathan sabe que con la ayuda de su familia podrá salir adelante. 

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP siendo muy puntual y responsable con los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará algunas herramientas que le son necesarias para la refacción de los motores.
texts.en:
Jonathan is an enterprising young 25-year-old who lives in his parents' house along with his siblings. For more than three years, he has sold car motors, and has his own shop where he works full time. He really enjoys his work, since it allows him to provide for his family's wellbeing. It's also a job that requires a lot of physical exertion, so he has to work hard with lots of enthusiasm. In the future he would like to open his own business, but he still has time to figure out what would be most profitable. Jonathan knows that with his family's help, he will get ahead in life. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he has always been very punctual and responsible in making his payments. With the requested loan, he will buy some tools for motor repair.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Comprar herramientas para arreglar motores.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia L. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 and married with two adult children. To make a living, Letecia provides mechanical services including motor repair. Letecia is just starting this business and earns 5000 a month.

In 2006, Letecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be the third loan taken out by Letecia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
This is Carolyn B., 33, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Almario B., a businessman. She is the mother of two children, both of whom are still in elementary school. Carolyn hopes that, with the grace of God, she will be able to support her children's education until they reach their college years. It is a dream for most Filipino parents like Carolyn as she herself is a college undergraduate and believes that this is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Carolyn operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines and, while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic and paper. They sell these to junk shops like Carolyn’s for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her to continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as the business expands. 
 
Carolyn dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through her hard work in her business. She also hopes to expand her business so that it will be a stable and income generating legacy for her children and her family.

loans.use: to add to her cash reserves used to buy trash from collectors

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold G.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is 40 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Bayabo East. Arnold has been in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Arnold joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. Arnold is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his seventh loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua N. is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver and Akosua uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She has received junior high education.

Akosua sells soft drinks and also prepares tea with fried eggs for sale at Takoradi. She sells the tea to those who would like to take their breakfast outside the home. Akosua will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks and ingredients to prepare breakfast for her customers.

With the new revenue from her extended business, Akosua plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks and ingredients to prepare breakfast for her customers

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras con Esperanza del barrio San Carlos, se formo hace mas tres años, gracias a que la encargada de limpieza de la oficina de la ciudad de Luque de la Fundación invito a sus vecinas a formar un grupo para que de esa forma tengan la posibilidad de incrementar sus mercaderías para ir creciendo laboralmente. 
Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el décimo quinto ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está conformado por 17 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.

La señora Norma A. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de ropas varias como remeras, camisas. Pantalones, camperas,  para la venta de los mismos.
Ella vende sus mercaderías en forma ambulante por la calle, todos los días viaja en distintas zonas para colocar su puesto y exponer sus mercaderías  y de esa forma ofrece sus prendas de vestir.
Es una actividad muy sacrificada pero es la oportunidad que ella tiene para ayudar a su familia comenta la señora Norma.
Ella desea mucho contar con un local en un lugar para vender sus mercaderías ya de la forma como trabaja  actualmente es muy inestables.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras con Esperanza” (Hopeful Enterprising Women) committee was established over three years ago when the cleaning lady of the Fundación’s Luque office invited her neighbors to form a group in order to have the possibility of increasing their merchandise and expanding their work. Currently, the group is in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women Committee Program’s 10th cycle with 17 members who are involved in a variety of activities. Mrs. Norma A. sells clothes. She used the money to buy clothes like: t-shirts, shirts, pants and jackets to resell. She is an itinerant merchant that travels to various neighborhoods daily to set up her stand and display her merchandise; this is how she offers her clothes for sale. Norma tells us that this is very demanding work but it’s the opportunity she has to help her family. She very much would like to have a locale to sell her merchandise because the way she currently works is very unstable.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, pants, sweatshirts, shirts, jackets, etc.

loans.name: Jyparkan's Group

texts.en:
Work is an essential part of life for all human beings. Most people work to make their living so they can afford food, housing, and education for their children. People need some physical and mental exercise for healthy living. The essential fact is that your style of life depends on your work.

Jyparkan A., the leader of the group, is 34, married, and has one daughter. Eight years ago, in order to use an inheritance profitably, she started her own business. Since then, the family has worked hard with a well-deserved result: 4 cows, 8 sheep, and 35 goats. Jyparkan and her family now need a loan to clean a slaughter and prepare a coal supply for winter. Her most important goal is to increase the size of her cattle stock.

Mirgul B. is the treasurer of the group. Although a very young married woman, she already has two small daughters. The main family income derives from the supply and resale of coal. The loan's purpose is to buy a car.

Askat M., 24 and married to a school teacher, has a baby son. Askat makes his living by coal supplying and its further resale. Making plans for the future, he intends to expand his business.

Azamat K., a 24-year-old bachelor, raises money by coal supplying and its resale in a neighboring region. The loan's purpose is to buy more coal for resale in the winter when it is most in demand. Next year, Azamat is planning to obtain a new house and get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase coal for winter

loans.name: San Miguel Arcangel Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Irma González  integrante del comité Torype Oñondivepa   domiciliada en el Barrio San Miguel de  _C.D.E. 
Ella Contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El comité se Denomina “San Miguel Arcángel”  están  en el   Decimo Cuarto ciclo, con 4 años de antigüedad con el comité  son 16  integrantes, y es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables, ellas tienen actividades diferentes.
La señora Esperanza quien también es integrante de la comité se está muy contenta con el grupo ya que trabaja en forma integrada por el bienestar de todas.
Así ella se dedica a la venta de ropas desde su casa sonde ofrece todo tipo de prendas de vestir de temporada. 
Ella pudo mejorar mucho después  integrar el comité su actividad ya constantemente hay intercambio de ideas y capacitaciones sobre cómo mejorar las actividades del grupo. 
En esta ocasión como ya entro la temporada de primavera desea contar con mercaderías nuevas y para ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de polleras, blusas, vestidos y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma González, member of the Torype Oñondivepa committee located in the San Miguel de C.D.E. neighborhood, started this committee. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form a committee in the area. The committee is called “San Miguel Arcángel” (St. Michael the Archangel) and they are in their tenth cycle and fourth year of operation. There are 16 group members. It is notable in the neighborhood for being very united, mutually supportive and responsible. Each has her own type of activity. Esperanza who is also a member of the committee is very happy with the group because it works in an integrated way for the benefit of all. She sells used clothes at home where she has all kinds of seasonal clothing items available. After joining the group she was able to improve considerably since there is a constant exchange of ideas and training over ways to improve group activities. Since the spring season has begun she wants to have new items available so she is asking for a loan to buy t-shirts, blouses, dresses and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes at wholesale for subsequent resale at retail.

loans.name: Joseph  Maara

texts.en:
Joseph is a tomato vendor. He has operated his business for five years and earns a good income. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by an existing member of the group and is now applying for his third loan in the amount of Kshs. 34,000 after paying his previous loans in a timely manner. With this loan, he intends to add a larger stock of tomatoes to offer for wholesale distribution.

Joseph is married and has grown-up children. With the profits from his improved business, he plans to renovate his rental houses so as to get maximum profits. Joseph intends eventually to make his living as a landlord and be able to provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase a larger stock of tomatoes to offer for wholesale distribution

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, de 42 años, vive en casa de su madre al lado de ella, sus hermanas, sus sobrinos y de sus 3 hijos de los cuales solo el último es menor de edad y juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 1 año, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado; pero trabaja con la modalidad de pedido. Es decir sus clientes le piden algún modelo en especial de ropa o calzado y ella se los trae, luego les cobra a crédito con un interés, de esta manera obtiene regulares ganancias que le ayudan en los gastos del hogar. Además paralelamente a su negocio de comercialización, también se dedica a lavar ropa para sus conocidos que le pagan por prenda, así transcurren los días de Dora que busca crearse con frecuencia recursos para brindarles una buena educación  a sus hijos. Y como siempre piensa en el futuro ya tiene planeado instalar un puesto de venta de ropa y calzado en el mercado de su zona, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias y continuar progresando. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y promete cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando para alcanzar el progreso. Dora tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de variedad de mercadería de ropa para la temporada de verano, pues quiere abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Dora, age 42, lives in her mother’s house with her sisters, nieces and nephews, and her three children.  Only one of her children, the last one, is a minor.  Together, they try hard every day to get ahead.

This enterprising woman started selling clothes and footwear one year ago.  She works by orders.  That is to say that her customers ask for a particular style of clothes or footwear, and Dora gets them.  Then, she charges her customers on credit and with interest.  That way she gets regular income, which helps with the household expenses.

In addition to her business of selling clothes and footwear she washes clothes for people she knows.  They pay by the garment.  That is how Dora spends her days.  She looks to establish continual resources in order to give her children a good education.  As she is always thinking of the future, she has plans to establish a stand to sell clothes and footwear in the area market.  This way she hopes to improve her income and to continue to make progress.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She pledges to make her payments on time because she does not want to disappoint the people who make this loan possible.  The loan will allow her to keep working to make progress.  Dora plans to use the requested loan to buy a variety of clothes for the summer season.  She wants to stock up and fill the pending orders that she has.

loans.use: To stock up on merchandise in order to fill the pending orders that she has

loans.name: Demecio

texts.es: El Sr.  Demecio es un cliente nuevo que se dedica al transporte publico en una empresa de radio taxi de la zona sur actividad con la que mantiene a su familia compuesta por la esposa y un hijo pequeño , la esposa solo se dedica a cuidar al hijo ya que tiene 2 añitos de edad lo que le impide trabajar y ayudar al esposo, el cliente vive el la casa del Papa juntamente con el hermano los mismos que viven modestamente por lo que se decidió darle la tasa kiva, Con el dinero del crédito pagara un saldo de la compra de un terreno, ya que su sueño es construir su casita, es muy trabajador y responsable y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Demecio is a new client that works in public transportation in a radio taxi company in the southern zone. With this activity, he supports his family that consists of his wife and young son. His wife dedicates herself to raising their son, since he is only 2 years old. This impedes her from working and helping her husband. Demecio lives in his father’s home with his brother.  They live modestly, which is why it was decided to give them the Kiva rate. With the money from the loan, he will make a payment on a plot of land, since his dream is to build his house. He is a hard worker, responsible and thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: Maritza Del Socorro tiene 47 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio, el propósito es apoyar en los gastos del hogar. Es una persona muy responsable siempre le ha gustado trabajar todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano ya que tiene que salir a vender sus productos de manera ambulante pues también en su domicilio ofrece ciertos productos. Sus clientes en su mayoría son personas que viven cerca de su vivienda, familiares, vecinos y amigos. Este crédito es para la compra de toallas, sabanas, ropa, calzado y cosméticos por lo que se acerca un buena temporada y quiere aprovechar para ofrecer de todo.
texts.en: Maritza Del Socorro, 47, sells general merchandise.  She has had this business for more than 20 years, and its purpose is to help with the household expenses.  She is a very responsible person who has always enjoyed working.  She gets up early every day, since she has to sell her products door-to-door, and she also offers certain products for sale from her home.  Most of her customers are people who live close to her home: relatives, neighbors and friends.  This loan is to buy towels, bed sheets, clothing, shoes and cosmetics, because the good sales season is approaching and she wants to take advantage of it by having a lot of goods to sell.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Jeanine's Group

texts.en:
Jeanine owns a business that sells tailored clothes.   She is 38 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of five and nineteen.  Her husband is a garden cleaner.  Jeanine is a group leader of the borrowing group called Icyizere in Kinyarwanda, The Hope in English. 

Jeanine has been selling tailored clothes for 18 years.  Her loan will be used to buy more threads and cloths. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an automated sewing machine. In the future, she would like to have more than one sewing machine.  In the picture, Jeanine is in the middle holding a blue note book.

loans.use: To buy more threads and cloths

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha Q. sells provisions at Takoradi. She is married to a driver and together they live with their four children. Martha has been selling provisions for ten years and uses her income to assist her husband in paying for the education her children.

Martha hopes this loan will enable her to expand her grocery business. If she is able to increase her income as a result of this loan, she plans save money in order to buy land.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a grocery business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old married man. He is from Lebanon, living with his wife and one child. He is the only income provider in the family. He has been working as a furniture carpenter and painter for 18 years. In 2002, he opened his own furniture store and started to do his own designs and paintings. He obtained his first Kiva loan and it showed very good results. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his inventory of wood so he can produce more and therefore sell more as a result and increase his profits.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of wood

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie C. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Margie is widowed and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Margie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling ready to wear clothing & shoe products from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Margie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Margie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like cosmetics & blouses. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Margie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like cosmetics & blouses

loans.name: Lao's Group

texts.en:
There are four people are forming a group loan. Mrs. Lao P. was born in 1963, and she is a group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other member. They are living in Tnaot Nhi village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Lao P. is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow rice and vegetable. She is also earns her living by selling fish. In order to support her this business, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase more fish to enlarge her business currently. Her husband, Mr. Choem Vorn, was born in 1954, works as house builder who is able to earns a small income to support his family. 

This couple has five children: one is fish seller, one is worker in a Korean company, and the other three are students.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Josephine has operated a business selling charcoal for the past four years, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Josephine faces the major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She hopes to become a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the future.

Josephine want to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase ten bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase ten bags of charcoal

loans.name: Kev

texts.en:
Kev A. is a widow and a homemaker with many household duties. She spends much of her time cooking meals and maintaining the property inside and around her house. She no longer has a life partner because her husband died of senility four years ago. She has five children, three of whom are married. 

She now lives with one of her married children who works as a sewing worker and whose husband is a Tuk Tuk (motor taxi driver). Her daughter and her son-in-law always share their earnings with Kev A. to use toward the family expenses. As his motorbike is getting old, it needs to be repaired very often. Kev A. wants to help her son-in-law to buy a new one, but she doesn’t have the money to do so. Therefore, Kev A. is requesting a loA. in order to purchase a new motorcycle for her son-in-law's business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for her son-in-law, who is a motor taxi driver whose current vehicle is inoperable

loans.name: Hourn

texts.en: Hourn S. resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. is a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about $3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $18 on food and $40 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase car spare parts to sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be Say's first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase car spare parts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy nets for traditional, small-scale fishing

loans.name: Fatheyya

texts.en:
Fatheyya is a mother of two daughters and four sons. She started up a business at her house; she started purchasing clothes and selling them to neighbors and relatives out of her home.

Fatheyya took out a loan from FATEN to purchase more clothes for the summer season and increase her profit. Fatheyya's son, who appears in the picture as she is a conservative woman, is a construction worker and helps her support the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell at home.

loans.name: Mujeres De Chuinajtajuyub Group

texts.es:
Doña Jacinta Esperanza T. I. D. S., es casada, tiene 29 años D. edad, cursó los estudios D. educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 1 D. los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a oficios domésticos y a la crianza D. gallinas ponedoras, lleva 5 años D. experincia en este negocio, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

DeciD. organizar un grupo con el fin D. solicitar un préstamo a ASDIR que le servirá para ampliar su capital D. trabajo, esta vez va utilizar para comprar gallinas ponedoras. Las demas integrantes D. banco comunal, se dedican a diversas actividades como: crianza D. animales, venta D. artículos D. comsumo diario en una tienda, y a la venta D. verduras. En el futuro espera tener un negocio mejor y con mas gallinas, ya que esperan mejorar sus ingresos D. ganancias y sobre todo su condición D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Jacinta Esperanza T. I. D. S. is married and is 29 years old. She finished her primary education. She has 3 children, 1 of whom is studying. She is a homemaker and also raises egg-laying chickens. She has 5 years of experience in this business. She can count on her husband’s support; he works in sales.

She decided to organize a group in order to request a loan from ASDIR, which will help her to increase her working capital. She will use it to buy egg-laying hens. The other members of the communal bank work in a variety of businesses, such as: raising livestock, selling basic items in a store, and selling vegetables. In the future she hopes to have a better business with more chickens, because she hopes to improve her income and especially her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is 35 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.   Norlita works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 3 years and also earns income from pig fattening and fishing.  She has requested a loan for PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Norlita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Henry Ely

texts.es:
Henry, es soltero, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, vive con sus padres, el trabajo agrícola le fue inducido por su padre y trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano desde hace 10 años.
Actualmente solicita un  préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de abono y tratamiento para plagas, estos materiales son muy necesarios para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, ya que si no se le da un tratamiento adecuado se corre el riesgo de que se dañe el cultivo.
Su sueño es hacer su propia casa y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos económicos del hogar, trabajando cada día con mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Henry is single and lives with his parents.  He is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He learned how to farm from his father and he works every day from very early in the morning.  He has been doing this for ten years.

Henry is currently requesting a loan which he will invest in buying fertilizers and pest treatments.  He really needs these materials for his corn and bean crops since, if he doesn't provide them with proper treatment, he runs the risk of his crops being ruined.

Henry's dream is to build his own home and to support his parents with their household expenses.  He will work hard every day in order to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pest treatments

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 38 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y humilde, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Segundo de 47 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El puesto de Rocío esta ubicado en el mercado Bellavista (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Pucallpa), ella se dedica a la venta de frutas como, plátanos, manzanas, naranjas, y verduras. Su puesto es muy surtido y concurrido por sus clientes, motivo por el cual su mercadería se vende muy rápido. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, por que lo no puede dedicarle a su familia. Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda mas grande donde pueda vender sus frutas con más comodidad. Este será su décimo segundo crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida por sus socias debido a la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más verduras, ya que desea implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Rocío, 38, is a very simple and humble woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Segundo, who is 47, and their 3 beloved children, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.  

Rocío's stall is located in the Bellavista market (an important market in the city of Pucallpa).  She sells fruit such as bananas, apples and oranges, and vegetables. Her stall is well-stocked and popular with customers, which is why her merchandise sells very quickly.  What she likes best about her job is being able to talk with the neighboring vendors.  She has spent 3 years doing this activity and believes that the hardest part is having to stay all day at her stall, so she cannot spend the time with her family.  For the future, she hopes to have a larger store where she can sell her fruit in more comfort. 

This will be her twelfth loan with MFP and she expects to be very punctual in paying her dues.  In her community bank, she is very dear to the members because of the joy she brings to the group. With the 1500 new soles requested, she will buy more vegetables, because she wishes to improve her sales position.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to grow her business.

loans.name: Giselle Maria

texts.es:
Doña Giselle es una mujer de 49 años de edad una señora muy trabajadora, luchadora, con grandes deseos de tener su empresa, desde hace 8 años se dedica hacer confites pasteleros, y trabajar la porcelana, también la señora da clases en el canal  de televisión 13 el programa ¨ mujeres del 2000¨. Ella vive con su esposo y su hijo.

Es la primera vez que nos solicita crédito en la fundación, Con este crédito piensa invertir en la compra de materia prima para hacer sus productos 

La señora tiene una pequeña empresa de confites de pastelería, poco a poco y con la ayuda de su esposo ha podido hacerse sus utensilios de trabajo y con ahorros de ambos pudieron comprar el horno con el cual ella trabaja.

Doña Giselle tiene desde hace 8 años una empresa de confites de pastelería, también con la misma técnica hace lo que es la porcelana y da clases en el canal 13, ella nos solicita crédito para la compra de materia prima para seguir trabajando ya que la porcelana es muy cara, en el hogar de ella, en su cocina instalo un  horno para hacer sus trabajos, la señora está capacitada en manipulación de alimentos y otros cursos.       
Con este crédito la señora podrá trabajar mejor ya que cuenta con el capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Doña Giselle is 49 years old.  She is a very hard-working and striving woman with a great desire to have her own business.  For the last 8 years, she has been working making confectionery and doing porcelain work.  The señora also teaches on television's Channel 13 on the program "Mujeres del 2000" ("Women of 2000").  She lives with her husband and her child.

This is the first time that she is requesting a loan through the foundation.  With this loan, she plans to invest in the purchase of raw materials for making her products.  The Señora has a small confectionery business; little by little and with the help of her husband, she has been able to obtain her working utensils, and with both their savings, they were able to buy the oven with which she works.  

Doña Giselle has had her confectionery business for 8 years. With the same techniques, she makes porcelain and gives classes on Channel 13.  She is asking us for the loan for the purchase of raw materials to continue working, as porcelain is very expensive.  In the kitchen in her home she has installed an oven for doing her work. The Señora has taken training in handling food and other courses.

With this loan, the Señora will be able to work better as she will be able to count on working capital.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials for her business, such as cold porcelain.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, provincia de mesmo nome, sul de Mocambique casada e mãe de 4 filhos de 9 a 25 anos de idade todos vão a Escola. Fez a 7ªclasse e parou devido a falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua sogra que vive com ela.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, apenas foi visitar o marido na Republica da Africa do sul onde trabalha. É  negociante ambulante ha 6 anos e vende roupa diversa e sapatos onde tem um rendimento mensal de 5.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu Hluvuku atravez de irmãos que tambem são clientes e este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (camisolas, sapatos, meias, e outros ) para aumentar a sua mercadoria e responder a demanda.
Sonha em ampliar o seu negocio e construir o seu proprio estabelecimento, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Gloria was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique.  She is married and has 4 children, ages 9 to 25, all of whom attend school.   Goria attended school through the 7th grade but dropped out due to financial circumstances.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her mother-in-law, who lives with her.  

She has never left Maputo, except to visit her husband in South Africa, where he works.  She is a traveling salesperson and for the past 6 years she has sold clothing and shoes.  She has monthly earnings of 5.000.00mt which she uses for household expenses and savings in her bank account (BIM).  She has never had a loan in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through her siblings who are also clients.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt.  She will use it to purchase products (camisoles, shoes, socks, etc.) to increase her stock and meet customer demand.

Gloria dreams of expanding her business and building her own shop, and intends to request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale (camisoles, shoes, socks, etc.).

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Maribel es  una persona  trabajadora   y  muy  responsable  que se preocupa  para  sacar  adelante  a   su  familia  día  con  día,  en este  momento  ella  esta solicitando su crédito para comprar  mas mercancía ya que  ella se dedica a vender ropa semi-nueva y D.  este  manera  obtiene  ingresos  para   sacar  adelante  a    sus   cuatro  hijos,  agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  por  la  institución para  la realización D.  su  proyecto.
texts.en:
Maribel is a hard-working and very responsible person who is determined, day after day, to advance her family. At present, she is soliciting a loan to buy more merchandise. 

Maribel sells semi-new clothing and in this way, obtains income to improve conditions for her four children. She is grateful for the help offered by this institution for the realization of her project.

loans.use: to buy semi-new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tubula

texts.en:
Tubula is 33 years old, married and a father of three school-going children. He has been farming for the last 15 years.

He learned about KADET through a registered client. This is his first loan. He is planning to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer. He hopes to use the anticipated profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

His dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Aurelia  Elvira

texts.es: Aurelia Elvira. de 39 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de wuaipe desde hace varios años nos cuenta que es una actividad que le gusta mucho porque le da tiempo de atender a sus hijos, ella esta contenta porque gracias a Dios la venta de su wuaipe a mejorado porque han aumentdo sus ventas, ahora ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas tela de recicle para sequir luchando y darles lo mejor a sus hijos en el estudio para que en un futuro sean unos profecionales.
texts.en: Aurelia Elvira. de 39 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de wuaipe desde hace varios años nos cuenta que es una actividad que le gusta mucho porque le da tiempo de atender a sus hijos, ella esta contenta porque gracias a Dios la venta de su wuaipe a mejorado porque han aumentdo sus ventas, ahora ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas tela de recicle para sequir luchando y darles lo mejor a sus hijos en el estudio para que en un futuro sean unos profecionales.

loans.use: Compra de tela de recicle para hacer wuaipe.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Semly

texts.en:
Semly, 33, is married to Denci, 28. They are blessed with two children: Dony, 8, who is studying in the second grade of elementary school, and Natasya, 5, who is at kindergarten.
Semly is a fishmonger and this business has been supporting him in generating income for his family since 1997. With a small amount of capital, he set up this business by selling fish from door to door. After several years he decided to operate the business in the market. 
Currently, Semly is planning to purchase more fish such as belang kuning fish (yellow mottled fish) since most of his customers prefer such fish. Therefore, Semly is seeking a loan of 5,000,000 IDR from Kiva partner, TLM, to buy fish in large quantities. Semly is hoping TLM will approve his loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase more fish such as belang kuning fish (yellow mottled fish).

loans.name: Luis Guillermo

texts.es:
Luis es un señor de 21 años de edad, quien vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada San Francisco de la Palmera, localizada en San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta comunidad rural presenta mucho potencial de desarrollo, ya que a través de las actividades agrícolas es que ha logrado desarrollar actividades conexas y de servicios en la comunidad, tales como el ganado de engorde y la oportunidad de pequeños comercios y microempresas entre otros.

Hace poco Luis tuvo que detener la construcción de su vivienda, ya que no tenía suficiente dinero para seguir. 
Actualmente Luis está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢600,000 (seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de más madera y materiales para finalizar la construcción de su hogar, habitar en la misma y poder tener una vida digna y tranquila.

Con esta inversión espera que su familia viva estable. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y así poder seguir adelante y superarse como familia.

Luis es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Francisco de la Palmera, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
