texts.en:
Luis is a 21-year-old gentleman who lives with his family in a community called San Francisco de La Palma, which is located in San Carlos in Alajuela Province. This rural community has great potential for development since there are already existing businesses tied to agriculture, such as raising cattle, and available community services. There is also opportunity for small retailers, microenterprises, and other ventures.

Luis recently had to delay the construction of his home because he does not have enough money to continue. At the moment, he is requesting a microloan in the amount of 600,000 CRC in order to buy more wood and materials to finish the construction of his house so that he can live in it and have a decent and peaceful life.

With this investment, he hopes that his family will have stability. All of this assistance will improve his living conditions so that Luis and his loved ones can move forward and grow as a family.

Luis is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of San Francisco de La Palma, one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing on a personal and financial level. In addition, he will be an active participant in his local credit organization.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for finishing his house.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 44 years old and married to Williams. They are blessed with six children who are going to school. Violet sells charcoal. She sells second hand clothes as a secondary business.

She has a good flow of customers. She has been in this business for the last three years and gets an income of KES 16,000 per month. She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to use the whole amount to purchase charcoal to sell.

She will use the extra profit to plough back in the business. Violet hopes to grow both businesses and, in the future, to build a good house for her family. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more stock of  charcoal  to sell

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 08 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de 10 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Aissatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de sept enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle a pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
The Deggo solidarity group was created on the 8th of May, 2001. It is made up of 10 women who are all retailers and all live in the same area.

Aissatou, on the right of the picture with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 7 children. She is also responsible for 2 more children whom her parents have placed in her care.

Aissatou is an experienced retailer who has been selling vegetables for several years. This loan will increase her working capital and allow her to restock and develop her business activities. She will use the profits from her business to improve her family's living conditions by buying food and clothing, paying medical expenses, etc.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Evangeline is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional pigs to raise. 

She has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Evangeline hopes to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Nob

texts.en: Mrs. Nob is a loving mother of 2 school-aged children. She sells ice, biscuits, groceries and drinks from a general store next to her house. She typically earns around $4.00 each day from this business. She also gets an income from husband who provides motor-taxi service to the provincials. Nob wants her husband make more income by starting provide Tuk Tuk service instead of motor-taxi service. It’s better because he will be able to charge a higher price for this new service. Therefore, she decided to apply for a loan of $500 to buy a trailer that can be connected to the motorcycle to support her husband’s business. She will save money to expand her house if she is able to gain more income from the business.

loans.use: to buy a trailer.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom, 35, is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. Mom produces traditional cakes to sell, and her husband is a construction worker. Mom is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase two water buffaloes to help plow the rice fields. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy two water buffaloes .

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
This is Susana, 45, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, her business partner. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Susana operates a rolling store. Her rolling store is basically a small housewares store, which retails plastic containers, dippers, pails, plastic flowers and basins to the local neighborhood. Her husband drives the rolling store within the local community to sell the products. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP700 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy pails, plastic ware, hangers, clothes pins, plastic flowers and rags to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Susana dreams to be able to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of plastic wares she needs in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items like cassava flour, Irish onions, and many others items.

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her livestock business. With the loan investment, she will purchase buffalo that will allow her to get a larger quantity of milk and increase her milk sales and profits. Milk selling is Ameeran’s family business, and she took over this business after the death of her husband few years ago.

She is a very efficient and active lady. She has a great business sense and deals with her clients in a very professional manner. Due to the good quality milk she provides, she has a good number of clients who purchase milk from her everyday. She is very experienced and confident that a loan investment will be a productive one for her.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ameeran.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her business.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María, de nuevo solicita otro préstamo, el cual le ayudara mucho porque comprara los ingredientes para la comida ya que este fin de año le hacen muchos pedidos y comprara: pollo, carne, arroz, cebollas, tomates y otros ingredientes necesarios.
Para Maria su experiencia con los préstamos anteriores ha sido buena, ya que le ayudaron porque le permitió tener una mejor atencion a la clientela y su familia está mejor económicamente.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan that will be of great help for her: she will buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her meals, as in this year-end season she is receiving many requests. She will buy chicken, meat, rice, onions, tomatoes and other necessary ingredients.
Maria’s experience with her previous loans has been a good one: they have helped her improving the way she tends to her customers and thanks to them her family’s economic standard has improved.

loans.use: To buy chicken, meat, rice, onions, tomatoes and other ingredients.

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.en:
Eleazar is 63 years old and lives in Estrella,Sinacaban. She is married and has five children.
 
Eleazar has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for three years. 

Eleazar requested a loan of 3,500 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.
 
Eleazar has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Eleazar hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Mra Narantsetseg is 39 years old, lives with her husband and 4 children in ger in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her husband, Namgurajaw, is 39 years old. He is keeper in a Hospital. Her older daughter, Ariuntsatsaral, is 17 years old. She is a collage student. Her two sons, Bazarragchaa and Delgersaihan, aged 16 and 14. They are join a second school. Her younger daughter, Saruuljargal, is 13 years old. She is a second school student. She started  a clothes retail business on rental counter in 2011. Now that her income is stable, she wants to expand her range of products.  She is a responsible person, their family is sociability and hardworking people. She is asking 2 000 000 MNT to buy more goods to offer for her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to offer for her business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Ten years ago 47-year-old Flordeliza started raising hogs to earn an income. Together with her husband who is a carpenter, this livelihood help provide the needs of their four children who are still attending school. She is asking a loan so she can expand her business and buy more piglets and sacks of feed to be ready until she can sell her hogs. Flordeliza hopes to build her business and manage it well so she can generate better revenue for her school-aged children.

loans.use: to buy feed piglets and sacks of feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of used clothes.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Catherine is married with 3 children. She started her shop in 2000 after selling some farm produce. Initially she ran a small eating-place but later opted for a shop. The shop supplements what she gets from her farm. Catherine is confident that with additional funds from PEMCI’s loan of US$ 150 she will be able to stock her shop and improve her profits. The shop serves the local community in her area. Community members don’t have to commute long distances to buy their basic requirements such as oil, sugar, salt etc...

loans.use: Stock for Shop

loans.name: Fiaaluai

texts.en: Fiaaluai V. is from the village of Lotofaga Safata. She is 35-years old.  Fiaaluai runs a sewing business.  Fiaaluai is very vocal about being grateful for the sewing talent that she has and that she is able to leverage this talent to provide for her family.  By working hard, Fiaaluai is able to sew more than twenty clothing items a day to fulfill the orders that locals place.  Local villagers appreciate Fiaaluai’s talents as a tailor and come to her for clothing for special occasions like birthdays, weddings and church events.  Fiaaluai is confident that by continuing to work hard and invest in upgrading her sewing supplies and materials, she can ensure her customers remain happy with her product and keep returning for more.

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine needles, fabric and for upgrading sewing supplies

texts.en: Mrs. N. is 59 years old, and her husband is 61. They have 6 children; 2 are abroad and the others are already married. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper center of VietN.. Mrs. N. has a grocery shop and her husband is a fisherman. They want to buy a new fishing boat together with 2 other families. They each have to invest $ 500. In the future she also wants to invest more in her shop.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Aminata Tico

texts.en:
Aminata Tico is married with four children. She is forty-eight years old and was born in Malongbo village of Magburak in Northern Sierra Leone. Aminata's husband is a watch repairman whose income is irregular. Aminata owns a market stall, selling essential commodities such as salt, rice, palm oil, etc.

A previous loan allowed Aminata to increase her inventory and her profit to the point where she was able to meet some of the family’s expenses. “It is a relief to me to see my wife’s success and know that she is able to meet our children’s school fee requirements,” said Aminata’s husband. With a loan of $175 this year, Aminata thinks she can further improve her business.

loans.use: Increase the stocks of food items for her market stall

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
Latofat is 42 years old. She is married, has 3 children, and has a college education. She has been selling women’s coats for 6 years. Her husband is also a trader and their eldest son helps them in trading. Latofat started her business by selling women’s jackets. After several loans she transitioned to selling women’s coats. Her assets have doubled. Latofat plans on using this loan to transition to wholesale sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Атохочаева Латофат-42лет. Замужем, мать троих детей, образование высшее. Занимается торговлей женскими пальто, вот уже 6лет. Муж занимается торговлей, старший сын помогает в торговли. Начала свою деятельность с продажи женских пиджаков. После неоднократного получения займа она перешла на продажу женских пальто. Сейчас её активы возросли в два раза, в дальнейшем она планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: to transition to wholesale sales

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour U. is 34 years old, she is a married woman, and she lives in Benin City of Edo State. She sells newspapers, drinks and snacks and she needs a loan of $325 to buy more newspapers, drinks and snacks for sale. She has been in this business since 2006.

loans.use: To buy newspapers, drinks and snacks for sale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Mrs. Sabina dedicates herself to the sale of household commodities. She founded this business two years ago. She sells from door to door in various sectors of the city. One of her sisters helps her with the sales and recently her sales have increased. She wants to use her loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise now that her customers have made various requests for the holiday season and the new year. She does not have sufficient funds right now to satisfy her clients. Mrs. Sabina is 26 years old and has two children. Her house is made of reeds and her ultimate goal is to increase her sales so that one day she can situate her business right in her home. Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora Sabina se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar , ella inicio este negocio hace dos años sus ventas lo realiza de forma ambulante en varios sectores de la ciudad, en sus ventas le ayuda una de sus hermanas y últimamente sus ventas han crecido.

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere usar su crédito para invertir en la compra de mercadería ya que sus clientes están realizando varios pedidos para la temporada y ella no tiene el suficiente capital para poder tener satisfechos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, su vivienda es de caña y su meta es crecer en sus ventas para un día poder instalar este negocio en su propia casa.

loans.use: To invest in more merchandise at better prices

loans.name: Sumiati

texts.en: Sumiati, 40, is a mother of 3 children. She makes and sells flavoured ice at her house, earning $1 a day. Her husband, J., is in the steel trading business and earns $3 a day. She is a member of MBK and asks for a loan of $75 to add to her business capital. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add business capital

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Kình - Tiên Trà - Trung Nghĩa Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Kình is 52. She is a state employee. She also works on her rice field, raises livestock, makes rice cakes to sells. She is married and has 2 children. Her family income is 12.50 USD a day. She needs a loan to expand her business.
Mrs Thuỷ is a farmer, she raises poultry and sells grocery. She needs a loan to buy chicken feed.
Mrs Hường is a farmer, she raises livestock and sells grocery. She applies for a loan because she likes SEDA's the loan condition.
Mrs Thêu is a farmer. She also works as a laborer for hire. She applies for a loan because SEDA makes it simple to borrow.
Mrs Đang is a farmer. She raises livestock and sells grocery. She likes the idea of making weekly payment.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Kình, 52 tuổi là cán bộ phụ nữ thôn, ngoài làm ruộng, chăn nuôi chị còn làm các loại bánh tẻ, bánh chưng để bán.Chị đã có chồng và hai con.Thu nhập bình quân của nhà chị là 200 000 - 300 000 đồng/tuần. Chị muốn vay để tăng vốn cho chăn nuôi và làm bánh. Chị Thuỷ làm ruộng, nuôi gà để bán, và đi chợ đồng nát. Chị muốn vay vốn để mua thức ăn cho gà. Chị Hường làm ruộng, chăn nuôi và đi chợ đồng nát. Chị muốn vay vốn vì rất thích hình thức trả góp của chương trình. Chị Thêu làm ruộng và đi làm thêm. Chị vay vốn vì thích thủ tục thuận tiện nên tham gia chương trình. Chị Đang làm ruộng, chăn nuôi và đi chợ. Chị thích được trả góp nên tham gia chương trình.

loans.use: buy chicken feed, pig mash, merchandise

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
Isha K. owns a grocery shop in Makeni town, Sierra Leone. She has been running the business since 2002 when the civil war ended. Isha used to get most of her stock on credit, which is very expensive, but now she is trying to build her own capital. She is therefore requesting for a loan so that she can purchase her goods with cash. This way, she can begin to save her earnings instead of using them to pay off her suppliers.

Isha is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She said that she would like to earn more income and save for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah M. prepares food for sale. She is married and has 7 dependents. Demand for her food has increased, and she wants to increase production.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more food supplies for her food production.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more food supplies for her food production

loans.name: Varziyar

texts.en:
Varziyar I. has been in the livestock  business for ten years. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region in Kurdmahmudlu village. 
Varziyar is 45 years old and married with three children. Now she needs a loan of $975 to buy six sheep.

loans.use: to buy 6 sheep

loans.name: Eulalie

texts.fr:
Born on February 12, 1958 in Porto-novo, the political capital of Benin, Mrs. Eulalie H. is married to Mr. Machould Boco, a master-welder by trade, and is the mother of 5 children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She sells firewood and various kinds of fruit. Her sales point is located in the Midombo neighborhood. She purchases her inventory in the Pahou market and has it transported by pickup truck. She ardently desires to use a truck as transportation so as to minimize her transport costs. Thus, she is requesting this loan so that she can make her dream come true and satisfy her clientele at the same time.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née à Porto-novo, la capitale politique du BENIN le 12 Février 1958, dame H. Eulalie est mariée à monsieur BOCO Machould, maître soudeur, et est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commercialise le bois de chauffage et divers fruits. Son lieu d’activité se trouve au quartier Midombo. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Pahou et le transport est assuré par des véhicules 405 bâchés. Son désir ardent est de faire assuere le transport par un camion pour minimiser les charges de transport. Elle sollicite donc ce crédit pour réaliser son désir et pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle en temps réel.

loans.use:
purchase of a truckload of firewood

Achat d'un camion de bois de chauffage.

loans.name: Maria

texts.id:
Maria (45 year old) and her husband, Max, have a daughter Mita. Mita is in Junior High school at the moment. They live in their own house in Baturiti area.

Maria sells snack and fruits at Baturiti market, 30 km north of Denpasar, Bali. She opens her stall from the morning to the evening together with her husband. She can get in average of IDR 75 thousand to IDR 100 thousand (approximately of USD 8-12/ day) as profit on daily basis. She uses this profit as working capital and also to finance Mita's schooling.

She hopes she can expand her business with the loan money.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang dijalani oleh Maria (45) saat ini adalah sebagai penjual kue dn buah-buahan. Lokasi usahanya terletak di Pasar Baturiti, 30 km sebelah utara kota Denpasar. Sehari-harinya, mulai dari pagi hari sampai sore, Maria menjajakan kue buatannya di pasar dengan ditemani suaminya Max. Tempat usahanya yang strategis didalam Pasar membuat usahanya lancar. Meskipun banyak usaha yang sama, tetapi sampai saat ini dia bisa menjaga kestabilan jumlah penjualannya setiap hari. Keuntungan yang didapat perhari rata-rata 75.000 – 100.000. Keuntungan ini, selain untuk dijadikan modal lagi, juga untung tabungan untuk pendidikan anaknya. Dia berharap, kali ini diberi pinjaman yang nantinya akan dipakai untuk mengembangkan usaha ini. Saat ini maria memiliki seorang anak, Mita dan sedang bersekolah di SMP. Bersama keluarganya, Maria tinggal di Baturiti dengan menempati rumah sendiri.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Luwayo Women's Group

texts.en:
Mary N. is the chairperson of Luwayo women's group. She is married with 7 children, with no one else to cater for; her children are enough on her shoulders since her husband has resorted to drinking alcohol and is no support for his children. Fortunately, 4 of them are out of school managing their own businesses.

Mary has a retail shop in Luwayo trading center away from Lugazi town. Usually she does her shopping at the wholesale shops in Lugazi and so far her shop is prospering. With her previous loans, she has been able to pay her children's school fees using her savings and the support from her farm. Mary was a farmer long before she opened the shop but opted for the shop because it brings in quick money compared to farm products, and above all, she was able to get access to loans using her business. She has a dream of including the sale of cold drinks in her shop after getting electricity just from a pole at her neighbor's residence, but she still lacks the capital necessary for accomplishing the task. She now wants to restock her shop, buying sugar, washing soap, Vaseline, and bathing soap for more profits using the loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to restock her shop

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs.Duk S. has taken out a loan to improve her business. She is a farmer in Prey Melong Cheng Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. S. is 49 years old and the mother of four children; two are employed in a garment factory and two are attending the local school.

In her plantation, she now cannot grow rice because she does not have enough animals to plow and cultivate. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to deal with this problem. Mrs. S. would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her crop. Her husband, Mr. Chen Then, helps her in plantation. He is pictured on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen.

loans.name: Yana

texts.en:
Yana is single and she lives and runs her business in Mukachevo where she sells food items in the local training school for teachers. She stays busy and almost never has a free minute at her workplace as the demand is really high. Yana has been in this business for one year and currently has about $2400 in merchandise. Her gross income is about $1200.

Yana is a quick learner. She likes aquiring new skills and applying them in her work. These characteristics make her a bright example of an aspiring entrepreneur with great potential for development. This time Yana is requesting a 5000 Grivna loan, $975, to increase the assortment of merchandise she offers for sale at her stand and give her customers a nice selection of snacks to choose from. Yana is hoping to use a portion of the profits generated to help her parents financially.

loans.use: increase assorted inventory

loans.name: Jose Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario JOSE  esta conformado de  4 integrantes que viven en el Km. 35 carretera a granada mas o menos a unos 10 Km. de la sucursal, pero sus negocios están ubicados en el  mercado municipal de masaya.
Son de procedencia humilde, no tuvieron la oportunidad de asistir al colegio, aprendieron primeramente las actividades  del campo como, la agricultura y la crianza de animales caseros.
 Doña Reina inició su negocio de venta de verduras hace 5 años en su casa, de lo que cosechaba lo vendía ella vio que si obtenía un préstamo de ADIM,  invertiría mas en su negocio por tal motivo    formo el g/s José y obtuvo un crédito el cual le permitió  ubicarse en una acera del mercado municipal de masaya y así de esta manera obtener mayores ingresos,  comenzó con un capital de C$1,500.00  en la actualidad maneja 2 crédito uno de capital de trabajo y otro de auto estima. 
 Junto con el crédito ADIM al g/s lo han capacitados  lo que les ha servido para superar sus temores e inseguridades y a sentirse capaz de enfrentar la vida. 
Reina cuenta en un futuro  con ampliar su  negocio y de poseer su propio local con mayor seguridad. Para alcanzar su sueño se propone continuar cumpliendo con sus cuotas y tratar de ahorrar  de sus ganancias para ir mejorando su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
The solidarity group JOSE is made up of 4 members who live by the km. 35 highway in Granada, which is more or less 10km away from the group’s office. However, their businesses are located in the main market of Masaya. They are from a humble background. They were not given the opportunity to attend school and they first learnt how to carry out rural activities, such as agriculture and the rearing of domestic animals. 5 years ago, Mrs Reina started her business selling vegetables from home, selling what she grew. She then realised that by obtaining a loan from ADIM, she could invest more money into her business. As a result, she formed the solidarity group JOSE and obtained a loan, which allowed her to set up a pitch in the main market of Masaya and which therefore enabled her to increase her profits. She began with a capital of $1,500.00 and now she manages 2 loans. One is a working capital loan and the other relates to her self-esteem. Both the loan from ADIM and the solidarity group JOSE have together helped Mrs Reina to overcome her fears and insecurities and have helped her to feel capable of confronting life. Her vision for the future is to expand her business and to obtain her own premises with better security. With the aim of fulfilling her dream, she proposes to continue repaying her instalments and intends to try and save money, so that she can improve her house and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital loan; To improve the conditions of her business and increase product variety

loans.name: Relindis Bi

texts.en:
Relindis is married to Martine Ngo-ah and they have three children, all under 15. Being a very hard-working lady, she has been able to help her husband take good care of the family. Because of all this hard work, she has come across so many challenges in life such as being unable to feed the family, being a school dropout, and having inadequate funds to educate her children. Because of all these, she recognized GHAPE as a source of relief in the year 2007 and had her first loan of 40,000 FRS and the repayments were made correctly.

Given another loan, she plans to buy second-hand clothes for 100,000 FRS and traditional wear for 50,000 FRS. Her repayments will start from the date of disbursement. Because of the experience she has had in the business, she is sure the business will succeed. Her community will benefit from the business she is doing by having clothes at their disposal to buy, and she will improve the economic standard in her community.

Relindis plans to use the profit from her business to pay her children's school fees and improve the standard of living of her family. She prefers to borrow through GHAPE because of the trust she has in GHAPE, and the method of repayment is convenient.

loans.use: selling of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Alianza ("Alliance") Village Bank. She is 44 years old and married with five children, four of whom are still in school. Carmen and her family have a business making woven blankets in a workshop in their home. She has been in this business for the past 23 years.

Carmen is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (USD$325) to buy yarn and dye to make more blankets. One hundred kilos of yarn will cost 700 soles, and the remaining 300 soles will buy six units of dye.

Her goal for the future is to build a larger home. She owns the small adobe house she currently lives in, but would like to build something larger and more comfortable.

loans.use: Buy yarn and dye

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Union Fait La Force) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est un regroupement de sept femmes du premier quartier de la ville de Koutiala. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants chacune. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles polygames et traditionnelles. 
Elles se connaissent depuis des années à force de collaborer ensemble. Elles mènent differentes activités (la vente de produits cosmetiques,  des poissons fumés et la teinture etc..).
Dans leur souci d’augmenter la taille des activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis bientôt cinq ans. Après avoir correctement tous les neuf précédents prêts, elles sont à leurs dixième prêt qu’elles comptent utiliser pour acheter une quantité importante de produits cosmetiques, des poissons fumés importés de korientzé (la préfecture de Mopti), une quantité importante d’ingrédients pour la teinture.Très expérimentées dans leur domaine respectif, les produits des femmes du groupe Benkadi sont vendus dans la ville de Koutiala et les marchés voisins à une clientèle généralement constituée de femmes. 
Ainsi avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 140 000 CFA. de bénéfice. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux charges courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi is composed of seven women of the first district of the city of Koutiala who average 37 years of age and are married mothers with at least five children each. They all live in polygamous and traditional families and have known one another for years through collaborating together. They do different work (selling cosmetics, smoked fish, dyes, etc.)

Concerned about expanding their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program almost five years ago. After having correctly repaid all nine preceding loans, they are on their tenth loan, which they plan to use to buy a sizable quantity of cosmetic products, smoked fish imported from Korientzé (Mopti prefecture), and a sizable quantity of ingredients for making dyes. The women are very experienced in their respective fields. Their merchandise is sold in the city of Koutiala and neighboring marketplaces to customers generally composed of women.

Thus, with this new loan, they intend to realize an average profit of 140,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan interest and to cope with common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Florinda Petrona

texts.es: doña Florinda Petrona  es originaria de la comunidad de chiyax del departamento de Totonicapan ella esta trabajando dedes 12 años con una persona que se deica a la venta de productos de ceramica y lozas ella fue aprendiendo ha como lo vende con quien lo vende y donde se compra, sus patrones le digieron en una oportunidad que inicie su propio negocio pero no se decidio de realizar pasaron los meses y le conto a  sus amigas de lo queria realizar y le dieron animo para inicir su propio negocio, hablo con sus patrones y le comento que iniciava su negocio  hoy necesita un capital para hacer realidad su sueño necesita de la colaboracion de ASDIR para Compra sus productos y crecer poco a poco en su nueva experiencia de vidad de ser duena de su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Florinda Petrona is originally from the community of Chiyax in the department of Totonicapan. Shee has been working for 12 years with someone who sells ceramics and china. She has been learning how to sell these products, who to sell them to and where to buy them. Her employers had given her an opportunity to open her own business but she did not make the decision to do so. Many months went by and she told her friends about her plans and they encouraged her to open her own business. She spoke with her employers and told them she was started her business. She now needs capital to turn her dream into a reality; she needs ASDIR's help to buy her products and grow little by little in this new life experience of being in charge of her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Janak Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Janak Maiya M. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives in a single-family home. There are five members including herself in her family. Her husband, Mr. Bhim Bahadur M., is a laborer in the housing construction business. Her older daughter works in an office. Her remaining two daughters are students in grades eight and seven, respectively.

Mrs. Janak Maiya M. makes traditional bangles from bronze metals. She gets orders from the dealers. All of her daughters also help her in this work.

Now Mrs. Janak Maiya M. is requesting her first loan of Rs. 10000.00 to buy raw materials such as bronze metals, a jigsaw and a cutting machine used in making the traditional bangles.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf femmes du groupe Danaya de l’association Benkadi sont toutes mariées. Leur moyenne d’âge  se situe autour de 31 ans  et elles ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Les membres du groupe Danaya vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Dalan de la ville de San (région de Ségou, république du Mali).
 Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens  de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent presque la même activité d’achat et de vente  de friperie et de poissons fumés. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité.
 Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Danaya a  eu une solution à ses problèmes en intégrant  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des balles de friperie à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali), des cartons  de poissons fumés à Mopti et à San. Le poisson est vendu au comptant et en détail à la maison et dans les marchés environnants de San. Quant à la friperie, elle est vendue  au marché de San, à la maison et en ambulant au comptant et à crédit.
 Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 60 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The nine women in the Danaya group from the Benkadi association are all married. Their average age is about 31 and they have an average of five children each. The Danaya group members live in traditional large extended families in the Dalan neighborhood of San (a town in the Ségou region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through neighborhood and family connections. They all perform the same business activity: buying and selling used clothing and smoked fish. They are very much in demand in this business. In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-increasing clientele, the Danaya group found a solution to their problems by joining the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution with whom they are requesting their first group loan. They intend to use this loan to buy bales of used clothing in Bamako (the capital on the Republic of Mali), and cartons of smoked fish in Mopti and San. The fish are sold separately for cash from home and in the markets around San. As for the used clothing, it is sold at the San market, from home and door-to-door for cash or credit. During this loan cycle, each member of the group expects to make an average profit of 60,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan interest, provide for the needs of the extended family and the remainder will be invested in the business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing and smoked fish

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru: Марифат занимается продажей тканей на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. Она продает только национальные ткани. Марифат закупает товар на оптовых рынках "Атуш-базар" и "Сомон-базар". Она кредитуется у нас уже 2 года. За этот период времени Марифат увеличила свой ассортимент. У нее очень красивый и дорогой товар, который пользуется очень большим спросом между молодых девушек и женщин. Но теперь Марифат хотела-бы завезти партию европейской ткани. Но для этого ей потребуется большая сумма денег. Марифат накопила определенную сумму, но ей не хватило еще немного. Этот займ она потратит на закупку первой партии европейской ткани.
texts.en:
Marifat sells fabric at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand. She only sells traditional fabrics. Marifat purchases her wares at the Atush and Somon Bazaar wholesale markets. For the past two years she has been a client of MicroInvest. During that time, Marifat has increased the range of goods she sells. She has very beautiful and expensive goods, which are in high demand amongst young girls and women. Now Marifat would like to import a selection of European fabrics; however, she needs a large sum of money to do so. Marifat has saved a certain amount, but she does not have quite enough. She would spend this loan on the purchase of her first lot of European fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of fabric

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly  es socia del Bancomunal Las Gitanas.
Nelly  es conviviente tiene 56 años un hijo que es mayor y es casado, ella trabajó como   secretaria en una empresa por veinte años hasta que la empresa quebró, puso un negocio de video juegos que funciono por un tiempo, lo cerro  por que se mudo de casa. Nelly   por las mañanas se dedica a la venta de menú y por las tardes trabaja en la agencia de una amiga como vendedora libre de pasajes aéreos y terrestres 
Nelly  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de  pasajes para venderlos. 
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a ser puntual en todo sentido y el respeto mutuo.
El sueño de Nelly es llegar a tener una agencia de viajes.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of Bancomunal Las Gitanas. She is 56, lives with her husband, and has one grown son who is married. She worked as a secretary in one firm for 20 years, and when the business failed, she had a video game business that lasted for a time but closed when she moved to another house. Nelly sells meals in the morning, and in the afternoon she works in a friend's agency as an independent seller of air and land tickets. Nelly needs a loan of $350 to buy the tickets so she can sell them. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to be precise in every way and in mutual respect. Nelly's dream is to have her own travel agency.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tickets for resale

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie L. owns and operates a business growing and selling flowering plants. She is from the village of Talisay, Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 adult children. Emelie has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Emelie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Emelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Emelie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to buy flowering plants. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for her children's education.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy flowers

loans.name: Animata's Group

texts.en:
This is Animata L., Lucy C. and Elizabeth J.. They are local entrepreneurs in Waterloo small-town. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. 

However, they had received previous loans from FAWE (Forum for African Women Education). Those loans have created significant impacts into the lives of these women. Aminata for example was able to pay her child’s college fee because of those loans.  Now, with the introduction of SMT, a Partner of Shine On Sierra Leone in Waterloo and the closure of the FAWE micro-loan scheme, these women have come to SMT/Shine On Sierra Leone for a loan of Le 500,000 for each to enabled them expand their businesses. 

Animata L. (right) is the leader of this group. Animata is 55 years of age. She was born in Songo village, about 32 miles from Freetown. She is a widow with five children. Three of her children are already grown-ups and two are still in the university. Animata sells cold water and cooked rice within the neighborhood. Animata has been a businesswoman for four years now. With this loan, she will be able to enlarge her business by buying cooking ingredients at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients at wholesale

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
A. is 28 years old, married, and is the father of two children. He is very hardworking and dedicated to his work. He is in the carpentry business, a business through which he makes a living.

A. has been in the carpentry field for the past eight years now. Carpentry has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his upkeep. He owns a carpentry shop where he manufactures all kinds of things pertaining to furniture work. He manufactures things like chairs, wardrobes, beds, etc.

A. says that for lack of adequate working capital, he is not able to pre-finance most of the orders from his customers. This, he said, slows down his work because he necessarily has to wait for funds from his customers before any work can begin, which delays him most often. He requests the loan to enable him to procure useful working tools and finishing materials like polish, glue, sandpaper, wooden board, etc., to improve on his efficiency. He believes this will improve his income status to ensure a good living.

It has been A.’s dream to build his own bedroom house to accommodate him and the family.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and furniture materials like polish, glue, sandpaper, etc.

loans.name: El Malinche Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Sandra María Dávila R., María Inés López Pavón y Alba Luz Sánchez.

El grupo solidario El Malinche está conformado por  mujeres trabajadoras, originarias de la comarca Las Flores, ubicada en el departamento de Masaya, sus condiciones de vida son humildes, trabajan con Adim porque les gusta que confían en ellas, expresaron..

Doña Sandra María Dávila, soltera, madre de cuatro hijos de las edades 9, 5, 3 y 2 años. se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas de frutas, las cuales las va ha vender en el mercado de Masaya. Ella sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casita, puesto que actualmente vive con su suegra, hacer que crezca su negocio, y darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
Con los créditos obtenidos ella expresa que ha podido capitalizarse y ha incrementado sus ventas.

Doña María Inés López , se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa variada para todas las edades, como por ejemplo faldas, blusas, uniformes de estudiantes, etc. Es conocida por su actividad, ella vende en el mercado de Masaya y Granada donde tiene clientes fijos. Sueña con terminar la casa que están construyendo en terreno propio y muy pronto trasladarse a vivir ahí.
Tiene cuatro dependientes , se propone hacer crecer el negocio para salir adelante.

Doña Alba Luz Sánchez es la coordinadora del grupo, ella es persona reponsable y muy conocida en su comunidad por tener su negocio ubicado en el colegio de la comunidad por muchos años. Es casada, madre de tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en una radio local y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Este grupo está comprometido a pagar puntual y así seguir obteniendo créditos con Adim, están seguras que con el crédito saldrán adelante porque incrementan sus ventas y así sus ingresos.

Este grupo abona los días Lunes porque, se considera que es el mejor día para abonar, esto porque las ventas del fin de semana son las mejores.
texts.en:
Pictured left to right: Sandra María Dávila R., María Inés López Pavón, and Alba Luz Sánchez. El Malinche Group is comprised of hardworking women from Las Flores in Masaya. Their living conditions are humble, and they work with Kiva partner ADIM because they like that the organization trust them, they said. Sandra María Dávila is the single mother of four children who are nine, five, three, and two years old. She buys and sells fruit in the Masaya market. She dreams of buying some land for building her own house. Currently, she lives with her mother-in-law so that she can grow her business and give her children a good education. With the loans that she has gotten in the past, she says that she has been able to invest in her business and increase sales. María Inés López makes and sells various types of clothes for all ages, for example, skirts, blouses, student uniforms, etc. She is known for her business, and she sells in the Masaya and Granada markets where she has regular customers. She dreams of finishing the home that she is building on her own land and moving in soon after. She has for dependents, and she wants to grow her business to succeed. Alba Luz Sánchez is the group leader. She is very responsible and very well known in her community because her business has been located near the community school for many years. She is married and the mother of three. Her husband works for the local radio and helps her with household expenses. This group has promised to make their payments on time so that they can continue receiving loans from Kiva partner ADIM. They are sure that with this loan they will succeed because they will increase their sales, thereby increasing their income. This group will make payments on Mondays because they think Monday is the best day for making payments since weekend sales are best.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. manages a general store. She is fifty-four years old and married to Marcelo L. Sr., who is a furniture worker in their rural village of Aguinaldo Cordon, Isabela. All her children are already married and no longer living at home. Josefina has managed her store for almost five years, and she is ready to take the chance to further develop her business into a more progressive one. 

She wants a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP10,000 for additional business capital. She is selling lots of bread, biscuits, and different commodities like coffee, sugar and salt. Also, she sells candies, canned and bottled goods and soft drinks. Josefina hopes that someday, with the support of Kiva lenders, her business will become ever more successful.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is the mother of two and married to Ben C., who is 38 years old and working as a farmer. Their two children are Oliver Jr., 14 years old, and Bertsel, 12 years old. They are currently residing in the rural village of San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela. 

Olivia is a rice seller in their village and also a hog farmer. According to Olivia, her small businesses are very helpful because when there is an urgent financial need, she can just sell any of her full grown hogs to comply with their needs. 

She wants to improve her rice selling business and she is hoping to obtain a loan of PHP 6,000.00.  She knows that rice is very in demand since it is included in every meal of Filipinos.

loans.use: To improve her rice selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing and stocking condiments

loans.name: Yudaya

texts.en: Yudaya Nanka is a 50 year married woman with eight children between 15 and 38 years of age. Two of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. Yudaya  owns a five room house where she is staying with twelve people. There is electricity and piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area  in the outskirts of Kampala  and works seven days a week.  Yudaya owns a retail shop in her home and receives at least 20 customers a day   She buys her merchandise from Kikuubo and uses public transport to and from shopping. She sells both retail and wholesale to all categories of people. Yudaya has been with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her retail shop

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en: Kuch C., 49, is a widow and resides with three of her children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who is able to make less than US$1 every day. Besides this business, she also sells chickens at the local market to have an additional income to raise the standard of living. She is also aided by her children who are garment factories workers. Kuch C. is asking for a loan of US$550 she needs to purchase more chickens to sell at the market.

loans.use: Sell chickens.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 45 años, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa en sus labores, además es madre de 4 hijos jóvenes.

Sus deseos de progresar y de buscar la forma de ganar dinero la motivaron a formar parte de un grupo de consultoras de belleza. Es así que desde hace 5 años viene trabajando en la venta de cosméticos, lo cual disfruta mucho pues recorre diversos lugares de su ciudad, aunque lo difícil y cansado sean los viajes debido a las largas horas de trayecto. 
Ella considera que la rentabilidad de su actividad está en la compra de productos al por mayor, pues los adquiere a precios bajos con la facilidad de pagarlos en cuotas pequeñas, lo que le da la posibilidad de vender mayor cantidad de productos de manera rápida, sin tener que esperar la llegada de los pedidos por el catálogo.
Sus planes a futuro son de seguir una línea de carrera dentro de la venta de cosméticos, así como trabajar con diversas muchachas que agilicen su trabajo distribuyéndolas en diversos lugares de la ciudad. 

Este es su noveno préstamo (individual) con Microfinanzas PRISMA, desde que comenzaron sus créditos siempre se mostró cumplida con sus pagos, al igual que sus compañeras de grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita aprovechará las ofertas de los catálogos para incrementar su stock de productos y venderlos en la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Sonia is 45 years old. She is hard-working and determined, and is also the mother of 4 young children. Her desire to get ahead and make money motivated her to join a group of beauty consultants. For 5 years, she has worked selling cosmetics. She enjoys this work as it takes her to various parts of the city, although the long hours of travel make it difficult.

Sonia believes the best profit in her business comes from buying wholesale at low prices, with the option of repaying in small payments. This gives her possibility of selling a quantity of products rapidly without having to wait for them to arrive from a catalog order. Her future plans are to continue this career path, working with other women in the group. This will increase sales by distributing products in many parts of the city.

This is Sonia’s ninth individual loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Since she began she has demonstrated that she is prompt in her payments, as are the other group members. With this loan, Sonia will take advantage of sales in the catalogs, building up her inventory in preparation for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Blanca Vilma

texts.es: Blanca Vilma M. D. H. resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad con su esposo y sus tres hijos. En el negocio D. Blanca se involucra toda su familia, sus hijos después D. estudiar le ayudan en los procesos D. producción, el negocio D. Blanca es una panadería con ocho años D. existir, la distribución del pan es al por mayor a diversas tiendas D. la colonia y otros lugares cercanos. El crédito que solicita Blanca y su familia, es para poder seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra D. una mayor cantidad D. insumos necesarios para la producción D. pan.
texts.en:
Blanca Vilma M. D. H. lives in the La Libertad department with her husband and three children. In her business she involves all of her family; her kids after studying help her prepare her products. Blanca has a bakery which she has had for eight years, and distributes bread wholesale to different stores in the neighborhood and other nearby places. The loan that Blanca and her family needs will be used to keep enlarging her business by buying a greater quantity of ingredients to produce the bread.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Georgina Denise

texts.fr: A. Georgina Denise est née en 1972 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est depuis près de 16 ans que Georgina Denise vit à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou. Mariée à TCHIAKPE Victorin, Georgina Denise est mère de quatre enfants. Un autre enfant est à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Georgina Denise vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Georgina Denise a fait seulement le cours primaire à l’école. Depuis près de 15 ans, Georgina Denise fait des jus, du yaourt, du Dèguè (yaourt fait à base du mil, sucre, lait, etc.) et les vend à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Georgina Denise s’approvisionne. Georgina Denise est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. C’est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que Georgina Denise sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Georgina Denise was born in 1972 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For sixteen years, she has been living in Cadjèhoun in Cotonou. Married to TCHIAKPE Victorin, she is the mother of four children. And she supports another child. The children are all in school. She lives with her children and husband. Georgina Denise has gone to primary school only. For fifteen years, she has been making juices, yoghurt, and Dèguè (yoghurt made with millet, sugar, milk, etc.) She sells them out of her home. Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she gets her supplies. She is a previous ALIDé client who has already obtained two loans from the micro-finance institution, and they have been repaid. To augment her working capital and to satisfy her customers more, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boxes of sugar, powdered milk, and baggies

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana L. is from the village of Oraan West Manaoag, Pangasinan. She is 56 years old. Feliciana is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Feliciana owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Feliciana has been apart of her business for over a year.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fiavaai

texts.en:
Fiavaai E. is 35 and married with 2 children (ages 8-months and 8).  She works in her 's business, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Fiavaai has 4 years of experience in this business.  Fiavaai needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Fiavaai joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Fiavaai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Fiavaai E. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena E. de 59 años de edad vive en el Barrio Medardo Andino, es modista desde mucho tiempo atrás, hace poco tiempo tuvo la mala fortuna de haber perdido a su madre, este deceso  le ha  traído a su vida la decisión de terminar con las remodelaciones en su vivienda y que le pueda brinde la seguridad y la comodidad necesaria para vivir en  un mejor porvenir, con este crédito comprara materiales de construcción para continuar con la reconstrucción de su hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Elena E. is 59 years old and lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood, and she has been a dressmaker for a while. She recently had the misfortune of losing her mother, this has brought her to take the decision to finish with the remodeling of her home so that she has the security and comfort to live better. With this loan she will purchase construction materials to keep rebuilding her home.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to remodel her home

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley, a 48-year-old married woman, farms for a living. She is from Agusan Del Sur and she has seven children. Her oldest is now 26 years old. She grows rice crops. She wants to sell quality rice to other people, so she and her husband make sure the farm is able to grow healthy crops. She says that she currently needs additional funding for their farm. She applied to CEVI for a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will go for seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies Shirley needs to provide for her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Richel Mae Dolera Group

texts.en:
Richel Mae D. is from the village of Mialen in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Richel Mae is the leader of a 2-member loan group sponsored by PMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Richel Mae is single. To make a living, Richel Mae raises and sells pigs. Richel Mae has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 4,600 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Richel Mae joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richel Mae has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to buy piglets to raise and sell in the future. Richel Mae is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Richel Mae's fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en: Matanat (her son is pictured), born in 1965, is married and has two children. Atakishiyev's family lives in the Absheron region and has been in the consulting business for two years. They are now requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to buy a new computer to improve their business.

loans.use: To buy a new computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling fish and vegetables

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a resident of Mahabang Parang, Binangonan, Rizal. She is 38 years old and married. She is seen as strong and determined to improve their standard of living. She is a caring mother of eight children, all of whom need her moral and financial support.

Currently, Christina and her husband are busy with a poultry raising business just to earn the means of living every day. When she received a small amount of capital from ASHI, she managed to put it all into her business. For her, business is an important factor, and she does not want to be a problem for her group mates or for the center in terms of paying back of loans weekly.

She applied for a new loan amounting PHP 14,000 to have additional working capital for her poultry-raising business. Specifically, the loan fund will be used to pay for chicks, vitamins, feed for the chicks, and other materials for poultry-raising. Christina performs well in her business; when she has enough capital, she expands her business in order to gain more income. 

Along with the business success she is dreaming about, is the hope to see the graduation of their children from college and to see them find a good job. She is also dreaming of constructing a home made of concrete for comfortable living.

loans.use: The loan fund will be use of paying for chicks, vitamins, feed for chicks, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is from the village of Rogongon, Iligan City. She is 32 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Josephine runs a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily use products. She has been engaged in the business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower from Lebanon is a 63-year-old single woman who is living with one parent. She is the main income provider for the household. She owns a linen store in Lebanon. She has owned this store for the past thirty years. It is important to note that Lebanon has faced political conflict and turmoil for most of the past thirty years as well, which has certainly caused greater challenges to the country’s entrepreneurs. This loan will be her first loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. With her loan of US $1200, she plans to purchase more linen to increase her inventory. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

loans.use: To purchase more linen to increase her inventory

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra en pleno desarrollo de las capacitaciones  y trabajando cada una en sus actividades dentro del 2° ciclo del programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya.
Ellas comentan que tienen mucha esperanza en que con el trabajo y buen manejo del crédito lograran salir adelante de la mejor manera posible brindando cada una a sus hijos todas las comodidades y con una buena educación.  
Una de las integrantes es la  señora Estela Cáceres quien se dedica a la realización y venta de zapatillas bordadas y de zapatos.
Ella compra las zapatillas y los accesorios para bordar como, lentejuelas, canutillos, y hilos de colores.
La zapatillas son bordadas de acuerdo a los pedidos que ella recibe ya tiene en cuenta que el color y los diseños que desean los clientes.
El crédito solicitado por ella es para la compra de zapatillas y zapato para vender y accesorios.
texts.en:
This group is in the midst of a training program that is in full swing, and is working on each of their activities within their 2nd loan cycle with the "Committee of Enterprising Women" of the Fundación Paraguaya. They comment that they are very hopeful that with work and sound credit management, they will manage to get ahead in the best way possible, providing each of their children with all of the creature comforts and a good education. One of the members is Señora Estela Cáceres, who makes and sells embroidered slippers and shoes. She buys the slippers and the accessories to embroider with, such as: sequins, beads, and colored threads. The slippers are embroidered according to the orders that she gets, since she takes into account the color and designs that the customers want. The loan requested for her is to buy slippers and shoes to sell, and accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy slippers, shoes, sequins, colored thread and other accessories to embroider

loans.name: Santa

texts.es: Santa, de 24 años, es una joven madre que  vive con su esposo Juan,  y sus 2 pequeños hijos en su casa, que es propia.La labor cotidiana de Santa, es el cuidado de su hogar  y de sus hijos. Durante  todos los días lleva el almuerzo a su esposo, que trabaja como  albañil. En sus inicios no tenían casi nada, pero luego de un tiempo  se propusieron construir  su casa, de acuerdo a sus posibilidades.  Cuando su esposo; no tenia trabajo, Santa y él construían las vigas y  paredes de su casa. En la actualidad se sienten feliz, ya que los 5 años de dedicación y  sacrificio le da cierta comodidad, aunque lo más difícil para ella; es no contar con un espacio apropiado, para su cocina. Su mayor anhelo es mandar a terminar de construir su casa.Este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y sabe que le será muy beneficioso para continuar con la construcción de su casa, es por esta razón que  se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas oportunamente.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de tablas machambradas (especiales para construcción)  para cercar el perímetro de su casa, además quiere realizar el muro de contención, con piedras   para evitar que ceda la arena que colinda con su casa.
texts.en:
Santa, 24, is a young mother who lives with her husband Juan and her two small children in her own home. Santa’s daily labor is the care of her home and children. Every day she carries lunch to her husband who works as a bricklayer. When they were first starting out they had almost nothing, but after some time they decided to build themselves a house as best they could. Whenever her husband didn’t have work he and Santa would put up the beams and walls of their house. Right now they are happy because the five years of dedication and sacrifice have given them a certain level of comfort, although the most difficult thing for her is not having an adequate space for her kitchen. Her greatest wish is to have the construction of her home finished. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows it will be highly beneficial for her to continue building her house. Therefore she commits to making all the payments promptly. She plans to invest the requested money in the purchase of tongue-and-groove boards (special boards used in construction) to enclose the perimeter of her house. In addition she would like to build a retaining wall with stones to prevent the erosion of the sand that borders her house.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Fe Briones Group

texts.en:
Fe B. is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 and the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Fe B. Group.

Fe is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Fe has a business planting and harvesting corn. Fe has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support family members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jose Enrique

texts.es:
Jose Enrique R. S. tiene 23 años.  Es casado y vive con su esposa e hijo, Tonio (4), en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Jose es un socio de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Jose trabaja en la albañilería y la agricultura, cultivando papas, trigo, cebada y habas. Tiene también animales, como cuyes y cerdos, que utilizan por el consumo propio. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para el cultivo de papas: comprar insumos, fertilizantes y semillas. Quisiera tener más terreno para cultivar otros productos. Dice que faltan medios de transportes para poder vender los productos (no hay bus por aquí y la gente no tiene carros). 

Le gusta jugar fútbol y fiestas de noviembre donde realizan comidas típicas y bailes
texts.en:
Jose Enrique R. S. is 23 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and child, Tonio (4), Guaranda canton in the province of Bolivar. Jose is a member of the rural bank Patrón San Juan, which is located a half an hour from Guaranda. It has 16 members in total, most of whom grow potatoes and corn. This is the first loan that they have taken out with the Cooperativa San José. Jose works in masonry and agriculture, growing potatoes, wheat, barley and beans. He also has animals such as guinea pigs and pigs, which he uses for his own consumption. He buys and sells in Guaranda. He is asking for the loan for growing potatoes: to buy materials, fertilizers and seeds. He would like to have more land to grow other products. He says that he lacks transportation to be able to sell the products (there is no bus nearby and people don't have cars). He likes to play soccer and he likes the festivals in November when they have traditional food and dances.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For growing potatoes: to buy materials, fertilzer and seeds.

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.en: Policarpio V. is from the village of Bagong Sikat, Alicia, Isabela. He is 33 years old. Policarpio is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Policarpio sells branded and generic medicines. The main source of income for the business comes from selling manufactured medicines to local businesses and community members. Policarpio has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Policarpio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Policarpio is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Policarpio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adonai Group

texts.es:
El comité Adonai nace mediante el deseo de las señoras de formar un grupo solidario con el objetivo de trabajar todas juntas para ayudarse entre ellas y al mismo tiempo a sus familias, buscando siempre en bienestar de la misma.
Una de las integrantes del comité es la señora Hilda quien se dedica  a la venta de comidas.
Ella hace los comestibles y los frece en su casa y los fines de semana sale con sus preparados hacia lugares concurridos para ofrecer su productos.
Es una mujer muy trabajadora ya con su trabajo ayuda para mantener de la mejor manera a su familia, y quiere seguir trabajando con sus compañeras ya que el crédito les facilita el trabajo.
En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingrediente de los comestibles que ella prepara especialmente para la carne ya que el precio del mismo es elevado.
texts.en:
The Adonai group was born through the desire of the women to form a solidarity group with the goal of working together to help themselves and their families, as they are always seeking to provide for the welfare of their families. One of the members of the group is Hilda, who sells food. She makes food and offers it from her house, and during the weekends she goes out with her dishes to busy areas to offer her products. She is a very hardworking woman whose work helps to support her family in the best way. She wants to continue to work with her fellow group members, since the loans facilitate her work. On this occasion she requests a loan to buy ingredients for the food she prepares, especially to buy meat, since the price of meat is high.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer
