loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, condiments, cooking oil and meat

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr:
Madame ROSE S. est une femme de 39 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis novembre 2004. Elle a 11 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et rembourse à toujours régulièrement son prêt.

Elle fait un commerce de tissus, de bijoux et de chaussures. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité en achetant 75 paires de chaussures, 5 rouleaux de tissus et des bijoux.

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille tout en augmentant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rose S. is 39 years old. She is single with no children. She has been a member of the Walidane “Banc Villageois” loan group since November 2004. She has been granted 11 loans in a row and has always repaid her loans on time. She has been a retailer of clothing fabric, jewelry and shoes for the past five years. Her new loan will enable her to bolster her business activity by buying 75 pairs of shoes, five bolts of cloth and jewelry. Her objective is to participate in improving her family’s living conditions while increasing her savings level.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jewelry, clothing fabric and shoes

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama O. is divorced and takes care of six dependents. She has been through senior high school.  Ama operates a 'fufu' and 'Twozaafi' (thick corn porridge) T.z. joint at Elmina. Ama uses her income in feeding, clothing and educating her dependents.  Ama will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to cook for sale. With the new revenue from her expanded business, Ama plans on ploughing her profit back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to cook for sale

loans.name: Tolcayuca In Action Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Tolcayuca en acción”, el nombre se escogió  por ser un grupo D. mujeres emprendedoras y por el lugar D. ubicación del grupo,  El municipio se caracteriza por que L. mayoría D. los establecimientos son atendidos por mujeres jóvenes con una gran capacidad D. lucha por mejorar el nivel D. vida D. sus hijos, y familiares. Con L. idea D. que las mujeres del municipio tengan que se encuentran en L. localidad tengan un trabajo seguro. Y poder aportar al desarrollo del municipio. Las integrantes que conforman este grupo pertenecen al Estado D. Hidalgo,  El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes.

L. foto fue tomada en L. casa D. L. señora María Natividad González V. es tesorera D. este grupo.  Se observa una gran armonía y compañerismo entre ellas. L. señora Natividad tiene 40años, estudió hasta secundaria. Es casada y tiene 3 hijos, 2 mujeres y  1 varón.  ElL. se dedica a L.  venta D. calzado por catalogo  que inició hace 1 año. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en  L. compra D. calzado y nuevos catálogos. Ya que su inquietud no es solo vender zapato si no también ropa y así poder vender más en poco tiempo. Sus clientes  comentan  que L. señora  Natividad es una persona muy amable y ofrece muy buen servicio, con un precio accesible ofreciendo facilidades D. pago semanales o D. contado D. acuerdo a sus posibilidades D. sus clientas.                                                                           
 Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se  siente contenta ya que podrá mejorar sus ventas y luchar por el sueño D. su hijo que es seguir preparándose en su deporte favorito el Béisbol, ya que actualmente el joven juega en una liga y por su empeño le han otorgado una beca para continuar sus estudios y su preparación  educativa.
texts.en:
The name of this group is "Tolcayuca in Action". The name was chosen for the enterprising women members and for the location of the group. The municipality is known for the businesses that are run mostly by young women, each with a tremendous will to improve the quality of life for their children and their family. The members' plan is to have the women on that municipality to have steady work, and to bring renewed development to the region. The members of the group all are originally from the State of Hidalgo. There are 11 members in the group. The photo was taken in the house Maria Natividad G. V.. She is the treasurer of the group. A great harmony and collegiality exists among them. Natividad is 40 years old and she graduated high school. She is married and she has 3 children, 2 boys and a girl. She sells shoes through a catalogue and she has had the business for the past year. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of shoes and new catalogues. Her wish is to not only sell shoes but also clothing to make more sales in less time. Her clients comment that Natividad is a very kind person and she provides great customer service. She sells her products at an accessible price and offers flexibility in payment methods, in cash or in credit with weekly payments, depending on the clients' situation. When she applied for the loan she was very happy to have the opportunity to improve her sales and to strive towards her dream of supporting her son as he readies for a career in Baseball. He currently plays in a league and his hard work has granted him a scholarship. He will continue his studies and his scholastic endeavors,

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to improve their business.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a young woman from Jenin who is married and has no children. Salma’s husband works in the across the border (in Israel) and also owns a small grocery store. he wants to have a decent job and more returns out of the store, therefore his wife Salma came to FATEN ask for this help purchasing goods and basic items to sell in the store.

Salma will be running the store till it prospers and her husband would be able to quit his job across the border (in Israel).

The store is located in a rural area where they have more chances to attract a good number of clients.
Salma appears in the picture above in FATEN’s office.

loans.use: Purchase grocery store goods

loans.name: Carlos Augusto

texts.es:
Carlos de 32 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres. 

Con una parte del dinero de una liquidación que le dieron el compro víveres y alquilo un local para ubicar una pequeña tienda, la otra parte se la robaron pero continuo trabajando para tener su propio local. Poco a poco pudo comprar mas víveres y ubicar la tienda en la casa de su suegra. Vende todo tipo de productos como azúcar, arroz, lácteos etc. Desde muy temprano abre la tienda hasta el anochecer.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como aceite, arroz, enlatados, bebidas para surtir mas la tienda y dar una mejor vida a su esposa y dos hijos de 13 y 10 años. En el futuro quiere construir su propia casa y incrementar el negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos is 32-years-old. He lives along the Perimetral highway in Guayaquil (in a suburban area surrounded by a salt marsh). He has a small general store.

With part of the money from a liquidation sale he bought supplies and rented a shop to start his business. Some of the money was stolen but he continued working in order to have his own store. Little by little he was able to buy more supplies and locate the store in in his mother-in-law's house. He sells all types of products, such as sugar, rice, dairy products, etc. He opens very early and closes at nightfall.

With this loan he wants to buy more merchandise such as oil, rice, canned goods, and drinks to stock the store and provide a higher quality of life for his wife and two children of 13 and 10-years-old. In the future he wants to build his own home and grow his business.

loans.use: Purchase of oil, rice, and canned goods

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: El señor Juan de la Cruz C. P., tiene la edad de 62 años habita en la comunidad de los Ríos con su pareja de vida y sus 8 hijos, todos mayores de edad, los cuales son casados y laboran independientemente, ella es agricultora desde hace mas de 30 años, y la falta del vital liquido a afectado su vida, ella comenzó su negocio de siembra gracias a la reforma agrarias de los año 80s,  solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, insumos vegetativos que le  brinden un mantenimiento Fitosanitario a sus cosechas, una producción adecuada y el aumento de las ventas, que a futuro admitan una remodelación de la infraestructura de su hogar a beneficio de las familias de sus hijos.
texts.en: Juan de la Cruz C. P. is 62 years old.  He lives in the community of Los Ríos with his life partner and his 8 grown-up children who are all married and work independently.  Juan has been a farmer for more than 30 years and the lack of vital liquid assets has affected his life.  He began his crop growing business thanks to the 1980s agrarian reform in his country.  He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, fungicides and vegetative supplies which will help keep his harvests healthy, keep his production working well and increase his sales.  In the future he would like to remodel the infrastructure of his home to benefit his children's families.

loans.use: To maintain plant health

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus de 34 años es habitante de la comarca Caño Blanco, integra su núcleo familiar, la esposa y dos niños, Maria Dolores de 13 años estudiando 5to grado de primaria y Jose Manuel de 3 añitos de edad, Don Jesus se dedica a la actividad de comercializacion de productos lácteos, ademas al cuido de ganado, apoyandolo en estas actividades toda la familia. 

Esta solicitando su 4to crédito para invertirlo en compra de ternero de desarrollo, para engordarlo y posteriormente venderlo a un buen precio que le permita obtener utilidades que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Cuenta con lo necesario para esta actividad, pues su finca presenta buenas condiciones técnicas para el desarrollo de hato ganadero, con pasto mejorado, tambien realiza actividades de saniamiento y nutrición animal, en su comunidad es conocido como un lider emuy querido y responsable.
texts.en:
Jesus, 34 years old, lives in the Caño Blanco region.  His immediate family is comprised of his wife and two children, Maria Dolores, who is 13 years old and studying in fifth grade elementary, and Jose Manuel, who is just three years old.  Don Jesus works in the commercial dairy industry, in addition to raising cattle.  The whole family supports him in this work.

He is asking for his fourth loan in order to invest it in the purchase of calves to raise, to fatten up and later sell for a good price that will allow him to make a profit to help in improving the living conditions of his family.  He has what is necessary to carry out this activity, as the conditions on his farm are technically well-suited for raising a cattle herd, with improved grazing pastures.  He also performs work involving sanitation and nutritution for his animals.  In his community, he is known as a well-liked and responsible leader.

loans.use: Purchase of calves

loans.name: Galud Hirasema

texts.es:
Galud de  30 años, hace cortes de cabellos, tratamientos capilares, peinados en su casa para poder mantener a sus dos hijos de 8 y 1 año ya que está separada de su esposo. Vive en una casa que solo tiene servicio de luz ya que el agua la consigue por tanqueros que reparten pasando un dia. Vive en una zona periurbana con una ecología en disolución llamada Duran ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil (ciudad de abundante comercio del Ecuador).

Desde que era soltera ella trabajaba haciendo cortes de cabello y peinados para tener sus propio ingresos a domicilio. Pero tuvo a sus hijos y dejo de trabajar hasta ahora que se separo de su esposo por motivos personales y comenzó a hacer peinados y tratamientos con algunos productos que tenía en percha (en la foto sale con los tratamientos). Trabaja todos los días desde las 10h00am hasta las 16h00pm. 

Ella quiere darle una mejor vida a sus hijos por eso quiere mejorar su casa ya que ahora no esta muy bien construida con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, pinturas, relleno para su casa. En el futuro quiere ampliar el lugar donde atiende a la personas.
texts.en:
Galud is 30 years old.  She cuts hairs and provides hair treatments and hairdos in her home so that she can support her two children aged 8 and 1, since she is separated from her husband.  She lives in a house that only has light since the water is obtained from tankers that deliver every second day.  She lives in a peri-urban area with a deteriorating eco-system called Duran.  It is located on the outskirts of Guayaquil (a very busy commercial city).

Since she became single, Galud has worked cutting hair and doing hairdos so that she can provide financially for her household.  However, she also had her children and she stopped working up until the point that she separated from her husband for personal reasons.  She then started to do hairdos and hair treatments with some products that she had (in the photo she appears with her treatments).  Galud works every day from 10.00am to 4.00pm.

Galud would like to provide her children with a better life.  For this reason, she would like to improve her home since now it isn't very well built.  She will use her loan to buy cement, paint and insulation for her home.  In the future, she would like to extend the premises where she serves her customers.

loans.use: To buy cement and paint

loans.name: Kigarama Tukore Group

texts.en: T. Salvan is the leader of Kigarama Tukore group in Kihihi. He is 34 years old and married with four children. Three of them are in school, while the fourth is still a baby. For the past seven years, he has owned a business selling produce from Kigarama Ntungamo cell. He got into this business by selling his personal harvest as a farmer. He began buying produce from other farmers to sell and found that he could earn more. He is a patient man and very hard-working. This is his first loan from Pearl microfinance. He hopes to develop his business like others who he has seen borrowing from Pearl. He will use the loan to buy beans, cassava, and matooke for resale.

loans.use: To buy beans, cassava, and matooke

loans.name: Rhodah Onindo

texts.en:
Rhodah Onindo O. is a woman of twenty eight years, married to Benard Wanjala who is a businessman in Kitale and supports the family.  Rhodah owns a barber shop in Kibomet where she lives with her family. She has been in this business for three years now and gets a monthly income of four thousand shillings.

This will be Rhodah's first loan from KADET LTD, she plans to buy another shaving machine, and with the income she is going to get she wants to save and buy a photocopy machine so that she can diversify her business.

In future she wants to buy a plot and also educate her children and raise her family's standards of living.

loans.use: To buy shaving machine

loans.name: Semion

texts.en:
Semion C. is from the village of Maribucao, Gingoog City. He is 31 years old. Semion is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Semion owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing pedicab or taxicab services to local community members. He also buys and sells coconuts. Semion has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Semion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Semion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Semion is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Semion from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim M., 44, is a good mother who has been blessed with four children. Two are married and the others are single and in school. 

Sim M. earns a living by buying and selling used goods. She has an old motorbike that she uses to transport used goods that she buys door-to-door in her community. She stores her recycling before selling it and gaining a profit. Her husband also assists her in the same business. 

Sim M. has requested a loan to increase the financial capital of her used goods sales trade.

loans.use: To use as working capital

loans.name: Nisa

texts.en:
Nisa B. is from the village of Maloko, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old and married. Nisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, beverages and rice in the local community. Nisa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Nisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products, such as bread and beverages, to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Nisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary S.  is 39 years old and  married to a businessman. They have five children, one of whom goes to school. 

Mary is in the business of selling fish. She borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. 

In the future, she hopes to use her extra profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman who lives in Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a food vending business. Her husband Alfredo, who is 57 years old, works as a helper to earn his living. They have eight children who are between 13 and 39 years old. Susan joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Susan has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,500, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000 to purchase stock for her food vending business so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Susan is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 41 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemary is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins and feed for her pigs.

Rosemary has been raising pigs for 10 years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase vitamins and feed for pigs

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
This is Susana S., 44, a resident of C. Jose St., Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Cerilo S., a janitor, and is the mother of two children who are studying in college while the other one is already working. 

At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her youngest child all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Susana, as she herself is a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Susana operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP’s-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail piece rates. She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her variety store, she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages so as to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Susana hopes that her business will become bigger and she will be able to build a bigger commercial place. She also prays for having their own house and lot for her family. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.
 
*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Rosa Purificacion

texts.es:
Rosa tiene  52 años de edad.  Ella vive con sus dos hijos los cuales son independientes y además aportan económicamente para los gastos de su hogar. Su casa está ubicada en el distrito de Guadalupe  en la cuidad de Chepen.

Rosa se dedica a la venta de comida y bebidas. Ella se encarga de  preparar alimentos según como vallan cambiando las temporadas del año, ella se dedica a este negocio hace mas de 5 años y cuenta con clientela fija que diariamente acuden a su negocio.  

Rosa está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 700 nuevos soles para implementar su negocio con una nueva cocina y mesas. Con esta inversión, podrá atender a más personas y cocinar en grandes cantidades para abastecer a toda la demanda de clientes que actualmente tiene.

Rosa no cuenta con otras deudas y tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y amigos que observan diariamente su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 52, lives with her two children who are independent but provide economic help for household expenses.  Her house is located in the district of Guadalupe in the city of Chepen.

Rosa sells food and beverages, and prepares meals depending on the seasons of the year.  She's been in business for over five years and has a fixed customer base who go to her daily.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 700 PEN to add a new kitchen and tables to her business.  With this investment she will be able to attend to more customers and cook larger quantities in order to meet the current demand.

Rosa has no other debts and she has good references from her neighbors and friends who are familiar with her daily work.

loans.use: To buy a kitchen and tables for her business

loans.name: Zeboniso

texts.ru: Зебонисо жительница Дангаринского района. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем. У нее 5 детей. Ее дети учатся в средней школе. Сама Зебонисо имеет средне - специальное образование, медсестра. По специальности она работает уже три года. Кроме того она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. В основном она шьет платья для продажи. Год как занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Zeboniso lives in Dangara. She is 36 years old, married, and has five children. Her children study in high school. Zeboniso has a vocational education as a nurse. She has worked in her profession for three years. Additionally, she works sewing traditional dresses. Basically she sews dresses for sale. She has been doing this work for a year.  She is taking out a loan to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Lupita I Group

texts.es: ESTA FOTO FUE TOMADA EN L. CASA D. L. SEÑORA LUISA QUIEN ES UNA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO LUPITA I, QUE ESTA UBICADO EN VERAC., MÉXICO. LUISA TIENE UN NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. ROPA QUE INICIO HACE 7 AÑOS. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA  INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO Y ASI TENER MÁS VENTAS, SUS CLIENTAS L. CONSIDERAN UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y AGRADABLE, EN EL CUAL SE PUED. CONFIAR. AL MOMENTO D. SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE SATISFECHA POR PODER REINVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO. ELL. TIENE 32 AÑOS, ESTUDIO HASTA L. SECUNDARIA, ES CASADA Y TIENE 1 HIJO. L. SEÑORA QUIERE EL PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN ROPA PARA SU NEGOCIO Y ASÍ TENER MÁS VARIEDAD Y PARA TODOS LOS GUSTOS Y TALLAS YA QUE LE HACEN MUCHOS PEDIDOS, SUS CLIENTES COMENTAN QUE LES GUSTA COMPRAR CON ELL. POR QUE SI NO LO TIENE SE LOS CONSIGUE Y SIEMPRE TIENE ROPA D. TEMPORADA ADEMÁS D. SER MUY AMABLE. TAMBIEN ESPERA PODER AHORRA UNA PARTE CON LAS GANANCIAS QUE OBTENGA PARA CONTINUAR INVIRTIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO Y PARA L. EDUCACIÓN D. SU HIJO YA QUE ES SU MÁS GRAND. ORGULLO Y ANHEL. VERLO COMO UN PROFESIONISTA.
texts.en: This picture was taken at Luisa's home who is a member of the Lupita I group which is located in VeraC., Mexico.  Luisa has a business selling clothing which she initiated 7 years ago.  She is soliciting this loan to invest it in the business and this way have more sales.  Her clients consider her a responsible and pleasant person; one who can be trusted.  At the time of the loan request she felt very satisfied for being able to reinvest in her business.  She is 32 years and high school educated, she is also married with one child.  She would like this loan to invest it in the purchase of more clothing for her store, this way she can have a wider variety for all kinds of styles and sizes especially since she receives a lot of orders.  Her clients state that they like to shop with her because if she doesn't have it she will get it and she always has clothes that are in season, plus she is friendly.  She now hopes to save some of her earnings so she can continue reinvesting in the business and also for her child's education since he's her biggest source of priD. and she longs to see him as a professional.

loans.use: to invest in clothing for her business

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has four children. She sells millet porridge and doughnuts in Abura. Ekua's income generated from her sales is used to help her husband meet the financial needs of the home. The loan she is anxiously waiting for will be used to invest in the porridge business by buying more millet, sugar and other things to make for sale. Ekua plans to buy land from her additional profit.

loans.use: to invest in her porridge business by buying more millet, sugar and other things to make for sale.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 45 años de edad. Actualmente, Maritza vive en la misma hermosa ciudad donde nació Cusco (Perú) junto con su hijo.  Maritza es docente de profesión y trabaja en la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo cemento, hormigón, ladrillos y arena. Ya son varios que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Maritza requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo cemento y otras cosas más. La socia en el banco comunal es la tesorera y desempeña bien su cargo. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Juntas y Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Maritza is 45 years old and was born in the city of Cusco (Peru).  She currently lives in the beautiful city in which she was born (Cusco), together with her son.  Maritza is a teacher by profession and she also works selling building supplies such as cement, concrete, bricks and sand.  She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Maritza is requesting a loan to buy materials such as cement, etc.  Maritza is the treasurer of her community bank and she does well in her role.

Maritza is a responsible and hard-working person.  Owing to these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's 'Juntas y Unidas' community bank.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, etc.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Fallou est créé le 14 mai 2010, il est composé de vingt trois femmes qui sont unies par amitié et mènent comme activités principales le  petit commerce et la coiffure.


Madame Khayta la responsable est âgée de 47 ans, mariée elle est mère de cinq enfants; elle mène une activité de petit commerce et fait de la couture aussi. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite habillée en robe wax jaune.


Elle achéte ses produits ( chaussures,habits, parfums, pommades) dans la capitale et revend au niveau de son quartier et au marché.

Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son commerce afin de se faire un peu plus de revenus.



Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices renforcer son épargne et soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Fallou was created on May 14, 2010; it is composed of 23 women who are bound by friendship. They are mostly active in retail and hairdressing.

Mrs. Khayta, the group's leader, is 47 years old, married, and a mother of five. She manages a small retail business, and also does some sewing. She is standing to the right of the picture, dressed in a yellow dress of 'wax' fabric. She purchases her products (shoes, clothes, perfumes, lotions) in the capital city and resells them at the local level and at the market.

Her loan will make it possible for her to strengthen her trade to generate a slightly better income. With the profit, she wishes to increase her savings and to help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics intended for retail.

loans.name: Adeline Inès France

texts.fr:
Femme de 33ans, célibataire et mère de deux enfants scolarisé âgée de 6ans à 8ans. Elle débute son commerce de vente de tissages et mèches au marche en 2007 avec un capital de 70.000Frs. ses recettes journaliers sont de 20000 à 50000frs. 

Avec ce prêt elle va acheter des variétés de tissage tel que (tissage naturel noble, olive, x-pression, tissage synthétique), des mèches tel que pony, olive, anglaise, afro. Elle fait preuve d'une bonne gestion et réserve un bon accueil à ses clients. 

Elle aimerait effectuer des voyages en Afrique de l'ouest afin d'importer la marchandise. Elle aimerait aussi renforcer les conditions de vie de ses fils en leur offrant une bonne scolarisation et éducation. 

Elle est encouragée dans son entourage pour les efforts qu'elle fournit et sa motivation dans son commerce.
texts.en:
This woman is 33 years old, unmarried, and the mother of two children, aged 6 and 8, who are both in school. She started her business selling weaves and hair extensions at the market in 2007 with 70,000 francs in capital. Her daily receipts range from 20,000 to 50,000 francs. 

With this loan, she is going to buy a variety of weaves, such Noble Natural Weave, Olive, X-Pression, and synthetic weaves, and also hair extensions, such as Pony, Olive, English, and Afro. She demonstrates good management and accommodates her customers well. 

She would like to travel in western Africa to import merchandise. She would also like to improve conditions for her sons by providing good schooling and education. She is encouraged by those around her because of her efforts and motivation in her commerce.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Mamadou Gueye

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou  habite au sénégal. Il est âgé de 39 ans. Il est marié et père d’un enfant de 12ans. C’est un soutien de famille qui vit avec  sa mère et ses frères et sœurs. Il est professeur de collège. C’est une profession qu’il a choisi par vocation. Ce qui lui fait plaisir c’est le contact avec les enfants. Son  salaire mensuel étant insuffisant pour supporter toutes ses charges, il s’adonne parallèlement  a l’aviculture pour en faire une activité secondaire. Il est membre du guichet de la même zone  depuis  plusieurs  années. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poussins. Les profits tirés de son opération lui permettront de relever le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Monsieur Mamadou  lives in Senegal. He is 39, married and the father of one child aged 12. He provides for and lives with his extended family: his mother and brothers and sisters. He is a teacher in a secondary school, and he chose that profession as his calling. What gives him pleasure is being with the children. 

As his monthly salary was not sufficient to support his whole extended family, he also engages in poultry raising as a secondary occupation. He has been a member of the IMCEC branch in his area for several years. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs intended to be used to buy chicks. The profit he makes from this operation will allow him to raise the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise.

loans.name: Mencia

texts.es: Mencia a sus 38 años vive en  compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos en una casa alquilada. Siempre tuvo buena sazón y habilidad para la cocina por lo que vio la mejor opción de ingresos para su familia, mediante la venta de comida al paso. En ella vende platos típicos de su tierra, como el anticucho. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la esquina de su casa, actividad que lo realiza desde hace 4 años. Ella considera como una buena opción de desarrollo que la ayudó en tiempos de necesidad económica y que actualmente la ayuda a sostener  a sus hijos. Por ello espera comprar nuevos implementos que la ayudarán a vender con mayor  frecuencia  sus platillos. Es su tercera oportunidad  que tiene un crédito con MFP, en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos por lo que continua  realizando sus esfuerzos para continuar adelante. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos y productos para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en: At the age of 38, Mencia lives with her husband and 4 children in a rented home. She has always had a talent for cooking flavourful dishes, so she thought that this was the best option for making an income for her family: selling food to passersby. She sells typical dishes from her home, such as anticucho [grilled skewered meat, often marinated in vinegar and spices and with a boiled potato or bread on the end of the skewer]. Her business is located around the corner from her house, and she has had the business for four years. She thinks that it is a good option for development and it has helped her in times of economic need. It currently helps her to sustain her children. For this reason she wants to purchase new supplies to allow her to sell her dishes more frequently. This is her third loan with MFP, and throughout her time with MFP she has proven to be punctual with her payments because she continues to work hard to get ahead. With the money that she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of supplies and products for making her food.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and products for making food.

loans.name: And Liguéye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité AND liguéye a été créé le 16/06/2009.Il est composé de 10 femmes issues du même village.Leurs activités sont:l'agriculture et l'élevage. 

Madame Ndéye en position debout et à l'extreme droite sur la photo,est responsable du groupement.
Elle est âgée de 39 ans,est mariée et mére de 05 enfants.

Son activité consiste à faire de l'élevage de moutons.Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité.

Son pret lui permettra d'acheter des moutons.

Son objectif est de pouvoir faire l'élevage de bœufs et la production d'huile,afin de participer aux charges familiales et d'assurer une bonne scolarité à ses enfants.
texts.en:
The And Liguéye solidarity group was formed on June 16, 2009.  It’s made up of 10 women from the same village.  Their business is agriculture and livestock raising.

Ndéye, who is standing at far right in the picture, is the group leader. She is 39 years old, married and a mother of five children.

Her business is raising sheep.  She has a good deal of experience in this business.

Her loan will enable her to purchase more sheep.

Her goal is to be able to raise cattle and produce oil, so as to help cover the family’s expenses and ensure that her children can attend school.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Marie Georgette

texts.fr: Marie est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle vit dans une location dans la capitale économique du Bénin. Elle a pour activité la vente des produits cosmétiques et des pagnes qu'elle expose dans une boutique non loin de son domicile. Elle s'approvisionne à Cotonou et quelques fois au Nigeria. Ses clients se situent en majorité dans sa zone résidentielle et dans les zones environnantes. Marie mène son activité depuis plus de 5 ans et en a acquis une bonne maîtrise. Au terme du remboursement de son crédit à FINADEV, elle a sollicité et obtenu le renouvellement afin de renouveler son stock pour faire face aux exigences de ses clients. Elle compte tirer un revenu supplémentaires de son activité grâce à ce prêt et augmenter sa participation à la satisfaction des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Marie is married with one child. She rents a dwelling in the economic capital of Benin. She sells cosmetics and pagnes (colorful West African cloth) in a shop near her home. She buys her stock in Cotonou, sometimes also in Nigeria. Her customers are mostly from her own neighborhood and surrounding areas. 

Marie has been running her business for over 5 years and has a good command of her activity. 

Having reimbursed her loan with FINADEV, she obtained a renewal to replenish her stock in order to meet customer demand. She expects this funding to help her earn more from her activity, which would allow her to increase her contribution to the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy 20 boxes of hair extensions

loans.name: Sedjro Pk10 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEDJRO PK10 est composé de trois membres. La représentante de ce groupe, du nom de Jeanne est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Jeanne est âgée de 54 ans et vit au Bénin. Jeanne est mariée à un policier du nom de Alfred. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jeanne et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Jeanne n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Jeanne mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d'année,la vente de friperies dans son quartier. Jeanne s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et mieux satisfaire à la demande de leur clientèle, Jeanne et les autres membres du groupe SEDJRO PK10 sollicitent un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
SEDJRO PK10 Group is made up of three members. The group's representative, named Jeanne, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. In order to bolster their businesses and better meet customer demand, the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Jeanne is 54 years old and lives in Benin. She's married to a policeman named Alfred. The couple has four school-attending children, whom they have to support. Jeanne and her husband live together with their children.

Jeanne never attended school. In order to provide for herself and her children, she's been selling secondhand clothing in her neighborhood for approximately 15 years. She gets her supplies from one of Benin's market.

In order to bolster their businesses and better meet customer demand, Jeanne and the other members of the group are seeking their fourth loan from ALIDé. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl con 50 años de edad convive con su pareja cerca de 10 años, ambos tienen 7 hijos pero viven solo con 6 en una casa propia. Saúl es agricultor desde niño, esta actividad la inculca a sus hijos, quienes también ayudan en las labores del campo. Así también prepara “masato” (bebida tradicional de la selva preparada a base de yuca fermentada), para la venta a visitantes. De sus 5 parcelas de terreno solo produce media parcela en la que siembra: café, yuca, achiote y kión. “Tenemos el terreno, lo que nos falta es capital para producir en mayor cantidad”, señala como principal problema. Además agrega que, al obtener ganancias gracias a la explotación de todas sus tierras podrán alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida, materializada en una casa remodelada, un nuevo techo, comprar nuevos artefactos para su cocina, etc. Es la primera vez que trabaja con MFP y el banco comunal. Comenta que se siente a gusto y espera muchas buenas nuevas de esta estrategia de labores.  Con el dinero que piensa recibir, él ampliará sus sembríos con el cultivo de plátanos y yuca; así como continuar con el kión, café y achiote, para ello deberá pagar la mano de obra, que calcula serán 25 soles al día por trabajador.
texts.en:
Saúl, 50, has lived with his spouse for nearly ten years.  They have seven children but only six of them live with them in their own house.  Saúl’s been a farmer since childhood; he teaches this way of life to his children who help him with field chores.  He also makes “masato” (a traditional jungle beverage made from fermented manioc) to sell to visitors.  Of his five parcels of land he only produces on half a parcel; he grows coffee, manioc, annatto and ginger.  “We own land but we lack capital to produce in larger quantities,” he points out as his main problem.  He also adds that if he could exploit all of his land he’d earn higher profits and attain a better quality of life represented by a remodeled house, a new roof, new kitchen appliances, etc.

This is the first time he’s worked with MFP and in the communal bank.  He comments that he feels good and hopes that many new things will come from this new work strategy.  He will use the money he plans to receive to expand his banana and manioc crops as well as continue with the ginger, coffee and annatto.  To do so, he must pay labor costs which he figures will be 25 soles per day per worker.

loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a responsible and kind parent. She is 46 years old, married, and has two children. She is thankful because her husband is also supporting her in managing their business.  Josephine has been operating her retail shop at the public market of Santiago. She has been running her business for almost 15 years. With the help of her husband, they are able to increase their profit. She hopes that her vending activity will be more profitable, allowing her to support her children until they finish their studies. 

One major challenge to Josephine is that she suffers from a shortage of income nowadays due to the increase in the prices of basic commodities. Another challenge is paying the allowance of her children and the house rent. 

For these reasons, Josephine would like to ask for an additional capital amount of PHP25,000, allowing her to buy a stock of bananas and spices for her retailing business. She hopes that she will obtain the loan amount in order to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a stock of bananas and spices for her retailing business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 47 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child.
 
To earn a living, Evelyn has a business selling fruit salad. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Evelyn has requested a loan of 40,000 to purchase more fruit for her fruit salad business.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Evelyn would like to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 50 years old. She has eight children: five were able to finish the secondary level of education; her sixth child, Jaypee, is 15 years old and has stopped attending high school because of financial difficulties; while Corazon, 11 years old, and Michelle, 8 years old are both studying in the primary level. 

Corazon is a vendor of native cakes which she sells in the public market of their town of Naguillan, Isabela. She cooks and sells her native cakes and is doing her best to develop the business to be able to generate a higher income for the education of her two younger children. She is hoping that somehow, through her business, she can increase her standard of living.

Corazon is requesting a loan of P 7,000 as additional working capital in the production of her native snacks. She further said that “in every sacrifice, there is a prize.” She is hoping that her prize will be enough to support her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She is 29 years old, married with 3 children.

Marilyn work with her husband in their farm. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Marilyn works hard to improve their harvest and earnings. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Marilyn hopes to earn more and to be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 20-year-old single woman with no children. She has a business selling fish in Yambio, South Sudan for one year.
Agnes is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy operates a grocery shop and a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold). She has done this for eight years now. The items in her grocery shop are different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, and powdered milk. The food she serves in the chop bar are fufu, banku, and rice balls. She is married with five children. Mercy uses her income to support her husband and to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell and food stuffs for her chop bar. With the new profits, Mercy plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell and food stuffs for her chop bar.

loans.name: Tomas Geronimo

texts.es:
El señor Tomas Geronimo es casado, tiene 30 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica ala albañilería, lleva 13 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al tricotado de hilo.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de terreno, ya que se le presento la oportunidad de mejora su condición de vida y tener su propio terreno. El trabajo que realiza es productivo por no que tiene la seguridad de pagar su préstamo.
texts.en:
Tomas Geronimo is married.  He is 30 years old and never had the opportunity to go to school.  He has two children who are in school.  Tomas works in the building trade.  He has 13 years experience and has the support of his wife whose business is knitting.

Tomas is requesting a loan which he will use to buy a plot of land as he has been given the opportunity to improve his living conditions and have his own plot of land.  The work he carries out is profitable which means he is certain that he can repay his loan.

loans.use: to add to some money he already has and buy a plot of land

loans.name: Jesus Manuel

texts.es:
Jesus es un joven de 20 años, trabaja en el pequeño negocio de su padre, ya que el lo apoya con visitar a sus cliente ya que ofrecen el servicio de seguridad, actualmente se encuentra estudiando derecho en la universidad, principalmente estudia en las noches ya que por la mañana trabaja.

Jesus agradece el apoyo de los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá inscribirse en un diplomado de derecho y de esta manera poder adquirir un mejor conocimiento y podrá seguir estudiando y luchando para realizar su gran sueño:” Tener su propio estudio de abogados”.
texts.en: Jesus is a young man of 20 years. He works for his father's small business where he helps in customer service and offering security services. He is currently studying law at the university. He mainly studies at night since he works in the mornings. Jesus is thankful for the support of Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, he will be able to enroll in an law certificate program. That way, he can gain more knowledge, continue studying and fighting to realize his overall dream: "to have his own law practice."

loans.use: to enroll in a certificate program

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is engaged in a food selling business to earn a living. She is 33 years old, married, and has four children. Her oldest child is 15 years old while her youngest child is one-year-old. Her husband is also a food vendor. Aside from this, she and her husband also operate a rice farm. They have been doing these livelihoods for 19 years just when they started their married life. Aida wants to improve their business for them to have money for their children’s education. With this, she is requesting for a loan to buy food ingredients such as flour, sugar, fruits and cooking oil. She will also use the money for their farm. Possibly, they buy fertilizer and pay laborers. The family lives in Tubigon, Bohol

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as flour, sugar, fruits and cooking oil; use the money for their farm

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 48 yrs old a widow and has 5 children. Of these children, two are in secondary school; two in primary school while the other is working.

Lucy has been carrying out farming activities for 22 years, and this provides for her household necessities. Her coffee plantation is about three hectares and has another hectare where she grows fodder and seasonal crops. Due to low prices of coffee in the whole country, she has been concentrating on dairy farming. At least she earns about USD 70 per month.

loans.use: Lucy wants to buy a diary cow to supplement her income.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia has 20 years of experience in her business. She used to sell clothing, but had to leave that business after her sister died. Amalia took on her sister's expenses, leaving herself without the capital she needed for her business. She has recently taken up selling clothing and cosmetics again, from 10 am till 5 pm every day.

Amalia wants to the loan so that she can invest it in working capital for her business, and increase her earnings.

Amalia is a single mother. She has 2 children, both working. They help her quite a bit with the needs of the household. She dreams of fixing up her home and she knows that she will succeed in doing so with the earnings her business generates little by little, and with the help of her children, who look after her.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Amalia tiene una experiencia de 20 años en el comercio. Ella se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, negocio que tuvo que dejar por un tiempo por que una hermana falleció y ella asumió los gastos lo que hizo que se quede sin capital. Nuevamente a retomado el negocio de venta de cosméticos y ropa, en horario de 10 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. todos los días de la semana.

Amalia desea el crédito para invertir en capital de trabajo para su negocio y poder ir mejorando sus ingresos.

Amalia es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya trabajan y le ayudan bastante en las necesidades del hogar, ella desea arreglar su casita, y sabe que lo lograra con las ganancias que poco a poco le generara el negocio y también con la ayuda de sus hijos que están pendientes de ella.

loans.use: Invest in cosmetics

loans.name: Salu

texts.en: Salu is a 45-year old woman who lives by the seawith her husband and their seven children.  Her husband and all the children are working together to make Salu’s business a success.  The family has built small open huts called fales on the beach (in the style of traditional Samoan houses) and back-packers will rent these huts for picnics or to spend the night on the beach.  In one weekend, Salu had twenty people stay at the fales.  With this promising indication of demand, Salu and her family are anxious to invest further in their fales, building additional and renovating the current ones, in order to attract more tourists.   She is confident in her abilities to manage a growing enterprise and enthused at the prospect of being the owner of a thriving business.

loans.use: additional fales and upgrade current fales

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en: Taleh Y. is a newly started young businessman from Imishli. He is single and he is the only breadwinner in his family. He has a small food products shop. He rents the shop facility, and his own funds were sufficient to purchase commodities. But for the summer, he needs a cooling system in place. He would like to purchase a refrigerator with the loan of $900 USD he is requesting from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Mrs. Edith G. has a store where she sells products wholesale. She opened the store three years ago with money she received thanks to her husband who works for a charter bus company. In her store she currently sells rice, gas for domestic (home) usage, chicken and shrimp.

She would like to invest her loan in adapting and enlarging the area where she sell sher merchandise. In reality, the quantity she orders and the space she has is very small.

She is 36 years old and has a son. Her home is made of cement and her dream is to enlarge and widen her store to attract more attention from customers.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora Edith tiene una tienda donde vende productos al por mayor , ella empezó su negocio hace tres años con un capital gracias a la ayuda de su esposo que trabaja en una camioneta haciendo fletes, en el negocio actualmente le ayuda su esposo y sus clientes fuertes son las tiendas del sector, vende arroz, gas domestico, pollo y mariscos.

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere invertir su crédito en adecuar un local para su mercadería ya que en la actualidad por la cantidad de pedidos que aumentan y el espacio que tiene le es muy corto.

Información Personal

Tiene 36 años y un hijo, su vivienda es de cemento y su meta es crecer y ampliar su local para una mejor atención.

loans.use: Expand and widen her place of business

loans.name: Jorgete

texts.pt:
Jorgete is a married mother of 2. She entered the loan program in 2006. Before she began borrowing money, she sold tomatoes retail. Once she entered the program, she started selling on the wholesale level. As such, she provides boxes of tomatoes to resellers of Market 2000 in the town of Maxixe. She plans to use the profits to improve her home and save money for her children's future, for she has no one to help her support them.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorgete e mae solteira e tem 2 filhos. Ela entrou para o programa de credito em 2006.Antes de tomar dinheiro emprestado ela vendia tomate a retalho. mas assim que ela entrou para o programa ja vende o tomate a grosso. Portanto ela fornece tomate em caixas aos revendedores do mercado 2000 no Municipio da Maxixe.Com os rendimentos ela pretende melhorar a sua residencia e guardar dinheiro para garantir o futuro dos seus filhos, pois que ela nao tem quem a ajude a sustentar os filhos.

loans.use: Jorgete would like to use the loan funds to purchase more cases of tomatoes from producers

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mr. Mon S. married in 1973 and has six children, two sons and four daughters. He has been in the business of driving a "remork"(a motor taxi with a carriage at the back) since 1992. He carries people from village to village and transports goods from villages to the market. Before that he was a construction worker. He works very hard in order to support his family and he expects to send his children to do higher education because he wants them to have a better life than he has. His spouse stays at home and looks after the children.

Mr. S. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of US$ 200. He will use this loan to purchase a new carriage for his motor taxi.

loans.use: Purchasing a new carriage for his motor taxi

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary L. is requesting a loan to buy more items like vegetables, raw food, and tomatoes for her shop. With her increase in income, she hopes to be able to send her daughter to a boarding school.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase the stock of her business

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is one of Microinvest’s most active clients. Her first loan was $ 100,which she spent on an expansion of her business. She bought new modern clothes of high quality from Bishkek,Kirgizistan. The clothes from this country are in good demand in local market and Habiba can sell her batch in short time. Due to loans from Microinvest she increased her working capital and attracted more clients. Today her customers like doing business with her, because she is very friendly and has a nice selection of items for sale. Currently she has applied for a loan to increase the number of warm clothes available in her shop during the winter season

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Odil

texts.en:
B. Odil is 53 years old. He and his wife have raised 6 children, four living independently and two still at home.

Odil is a farmer, renting 2.0 hectares of  land and owning 0.18 hectares. The land is used to produce a variety of crops. As a rule, Odil purchases fertilizer and combustive lubricating materials required for processing the land. He also breeds cattle. Currently he has 8 head of cattle that he will soon sell. 

Odil requests a loan of $600.00 for the term of 9 months to be spent on the purchase of combustive-lubricating materials and fertilizer. He thanks all supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase combustive-lubricating materials and fertilizer.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David lives in Anticretico in Buenos Aires avenue in the Las Lomas district of the city of La Paz and he assembles and sells computers to fill orders. His business is runnign well but his income is not enough which is why he started a second business selling slacks. The loan that he requests is to purchase parts to assemble a computer for a client.

He does not have a past history with the financial institution but he qualifies for a loan given his will to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

David vive en anticretico en la Av Buenos Aires de la zona de Las Lomas de la Ciudad de La Paz y se dedica al ensamblado de computadoras las mismas que las vende a pedido; en este negocio le va bien pero sus ingresos son mínimos por lo cual inicio un negocio adicional que consiste en la venta de pantalones. El crédito que solicita es para compra de material para ensamblar una computadora para un cliente. No tiene antecedente con la Institución, pero califica para acceder a un crédito por su empeño en salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase parts to assemble a computer for his client.

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena is a father with four children and also a married man. Two of his children are currently in school. Brand new shoes are very expensive to buy in Ghana and therefore majority of Ghanaians prefer to buy second-hand (used) shoes. Kwabena is thirty-nine years old and he has been selling used shoes for the past twenty-two years in the Eastern Region.

He wants to use his new loan to buy more shoes to meet the high demand for them. He is a member of the group called “Gye Nyame” (meaning Only God). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes

loans.name: Bahrigul

texts.ru:
Bahrigul S. has been working in sales for 7 years. She sells cottonseed oil which she buys wholesale. She has a shop in the central market in Fayzabad. She has a big family. She is married and has 4 children. She wants to increase her sales volume since the goods she sells are in great demand. She has decided to take out a loan to deliver more goods. It will help Bahrigul to increase her income, which is very necessary for her family. She plans to pay off the debt in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer

Саидова Бахригул занимается торговлей уже 7 лет. Продает хлопковое масло , которое покупает у оптовых реализаторов. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке Файзабада. У нее большая семья. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Хочет увеличить товарооборот, так как продаваемая ею продукция пользуется большим спросом у населения. Она решила получить кредит и завозить болше товара . Это поможет Бахригуль увеличить доход , который очень необходим для ее семьи. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Olga Felicia

texts.es:
Mrs. Olga is a a 40-year-old widow whose secondary education was incomplete. She is the mother of five children, three of whom study at the high school level. She lives in Yunguyo. She dedicates herself to selling wholesale clothing for men, women, and children in the "15th of August" market in Yunguyo. She currently belongs to the San Juan Communal Bank in the community of San Juan of Totora. She decided to join the communal bank to increase her merchandise, and with her first loan of S/. 300 nuevos soles she purchased 6 dozen pairs of tights. With this loan for $125, which she will repay in four months, she will buy 6 dozen pairs of tights, 3 dozen overalls, and several men's jackets.

She is grateful that she has been able to expand her business and improve her economic situation. She has also learned to be responsible, punctual, and to share her experiences with her partners at their meetings. Because of this, she feels happy and content to be part of the communal bank. Her vision is to increase her cash on hand, expand her business, and become a designer/maker of clothing for retail sale as well as wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Olga es viuda, tiene 40 años de edad, su nivel de educación alcanzado es secundaria incompleta, es madre de 5 hijos y 3 de sus hijos estudian en el colegio. Vive en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo. Se dedica al negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para damas, niños y varones en el mercado 15 de Agosto en el puesto Nº 7 de la ciudad de Yunguyo Ella pertenece actualmente al Banco Comunal San Juan de la comunidad San Juan de Totora, decidió pertenecer al Banco Comunal para incrementar su mercadería, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró 6 docenas de medias. Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 6 docenas de medias, 3 docenas de buzos y unas cuantas casacas para varones. Ella esta agradecida ya que ha logrado ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, además ha aprendido a ser responsable, puntual y compartir experiencias con las compañeras en las reuniones que tienen. Así se siente feliz y contenta de ser parte del Banco Comunal. Su visión es capitalizarse, ampliar su negocio y convertirse en confeccionista de ropas para vender por mayor y menor.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale clothing to sell

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas C., 55, is a farmer growing crops on her farmland. She has been farming for fifteen years and earns around US$2 per day. Her husband, Mr. Theam Ven, pictured in the photo, works as a provider of rechargable batteries in the village, making around US$5 per day. The couple has seven children, two of whom are married, while the other five are single. One of their children works in a restaurant. The entire family lives in the Kork Morn Village, Siem Reap Province. Currently, the equipment that Ven uses for his business is experiencing technical problems and fails to run smoothly. C. is therefore asking for a loan of US$200 for her husband to repair the machine.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Repair of farming equipment

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 33 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 16,18, 9, and 2. She has been a shoe seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 90 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan to buy more shoes for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Witness B.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Witness S., who is married and has four children aged between 23 and 15. In 2005, Witness established her genge (see below) business. Working six days a week, 13-16 hours a day, and assisted by her husband, she earns about $40 every month from this business.

Witness is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, sugar, salt and cooking oil in bulk, and in the future plans to establish another business. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to in order to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don't have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, salt and cooking oil in bulk.

loans.name: Clavelitos De Padcaya Group

texts.es: LOS SOCIOS DEL GRUPO CLAVELITOS D. PADCAYA REPRESENTADOS POR LA SEÑORA MARIA ESTELA SE DEDICAN A SUS PROPIOS NEGOCIOS PEQUEÑOS COMO PENSION D. COMIDA, TIENDAS  D. BARRIO, LIBRERIA, PANADERIAS, VENTA D. COSMENTICOS POR CATALOGOS Y AL TRASPORTE PUBLICO, EL FINANCIAMIENTO ESTA DIRIGIDO AL INGREMENTO D. CAPITAL PARA AMPLIAR SUS NEGOCIOS. EXISTE UN PARENTESCO DENTTRO D. GRUPO QUE SON LA SEÑORA TERESA Y SU HIJA  RAQUEL AMBAS TIENEN INGRESOS INDEPENDIENTES POR LO NO EXSTEN PROBLEMAS DENTRO DEL GRUPO. D. LAS 12 PERSONAS QUE CONFORMAN EL GRUPO 9 CUENTAN CON ANTECEDENTES CREDITICIOS IMPECABLES EN OTRAS ENTIDADES FINACIERAS POR LO QUE ESTAN AVITUADAS A LOS PAGOS EN GRUPO.
texts.en:
The members of the "Clavelitos D. Padcaya" group, represented by María Estela, each have their own small businesses such as food sales, neighborhood stores, bookstores, bakeries, catalog sales of cosmetics and public transportation. The loan will be used for increasing working capital in order to expand their businesses. Within the group are members who are related, like Teresa and her daughter Raquel, who both have independent incomes. Of the 12 people who make up the group, 9 have impeccable prior credit records with other financial institutions. For this reason, they qualify for this loan as a group.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eva Beatriz

texts.es: La sra, Eva M. trabaja en esa actividad desde hace 16 años, es muy trabajadora y ello le ayudo para poder progresar, actualmente cuenta con negocio propio y considera que le va muy bien, para poder mantener a su familia cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien es transportista desde hace varios años y entre ambos mantienen a sus dos hijos pequeños. La señora es cliente de Emprender desde el año 2002, comenzó con un grupo solidario, pero ahora decidió independizarse para solicitar un crédito individual, actrualmente se encuentra en la 9na secuencia, demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Eva M. has been working for the past 16 years, she is very hard working and her work has been helping her advance. Currently she runs her own business and she feels that it's going very well, enough to be able to support hr family. She can also depend on the support of her husband who is a driver for many years, and together they support their two small children. She is a client of Emprender since 2002, starting out with a group loan. But since then she had decided to go on her own and seek a loan by herself. She is currenlty on the 9th cycle, having demonstrated to be responsible with her payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Juana Confesora's Group
loans.use: Purchase of tablecloths and window curtains to operate a small business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: Alex tiene 30 años y vive con sus padres. Es un joven que trabaja con su propia fuente de ingresos diarios, que es unas cabinas públicas de Internet y locutorio telefónico que ha instalado en la casa de sus padres, atiende todos los días, incluyendo los domingos, para garantizarse los ingresos necesarios. Como un buen administrador de su negocio realiza una adecuada distribución de los ingresos, para poder cubrir los gastos de servicios y su mercadería básica, que son algunas golosinas y tarjetas telefónicas, así como recargas virtuales y tarjetas prepago para celulares. Es la primera vez que Alex solicita un préstamo con MFP, fue invitado a ser parte de un banco comunal por ser un joven muy trabajador y responsable. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra, al por mayor, de recargas virtuales y tarjetas prepago de celulares, así como para el mantenimiento de una de sus computadoras.
texts.en:
Alex is thirty years old and lives with his parents. He is a youth who works with his own daily source of income from the public Internet cafés and telephone booths that have been installed in his parents house. He monitors them every day, including Sundays, to guarantee his necessary income. As a good administrator of his business, he directs the adequate distribution of the profits, in order to be able to cover the service charges and the basic merchandise, including sweets and phone cards, as well as virtual refills and prepaid cell phone cards. This is the first time that Alex has requested a loan with MFP, an affiliate of Kiva. Alex was invited to be part of a communal bank because he is a responsible and very industrious youth. With the money that he is requesting, he will invest in the wholesale purchase of virtual refills and prepaid cell phone cards, as well as the maintenance of one of his computers.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de tarjetas para celulares y el mantenimiento de una de sus computadoras

loans.name: Lissett Benita

texts.es:
La Joven de Nombre Lisset Benita Z. Z. tiene la edad de 28 años, su estado civil es soltera, La Joven Lisset no tiene hijos sus propósitos son de seguir trabajando ya que tiene mucha vida por delante y le gustaría generar mas ingresos para su familia ya que su Mama y sus hermanas están a su cargo  por lo que es ella quien es la encargada de la manutención de su familia sus deseos son de terminar sus estudios ya que sigue estudiando y trabajando por lo que no quiere dejar de estudiar ya que sus padres no le ofrecieron este tipo de oportunidad y ahora con sus propios esfuerzos lo esta logrando sus sueños son de ofrecer en un futuro a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar para que ellos puedan tener esta posibilidad es por eso que tiene que ahorra en un futuro además de establecerse de forma mas segura en su negocio para que este le siga propiciando los beneficios que ha obtenido hasta los momentos.


La actividad económica a la que Doña Lissett se dedica es una pulpería de ropa y cosméticos, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 6 años, Doña Lissett inicia este negocio por su familia ya que desde hace mucho tiempo este era el medio de trabajo pero debido a las circunstancias económicas tuvieron que renunciar este tipo de negocio y es así que nace la inspiración del la fuente de ingresos para su familia y decide reestablecer el negocio familiar por cuenta propia y decide comenzar con pocos productos como: ropa interior y dulces y lo hacia de forma ambulante en La Terminal por lo que sus deseos de superación eran mas fuertes por lo que no podía dejar este medio de trabajo ya que tenia que pagar las deudas contraídas y poco a poco fue adquiriendo el capital necesario para progresar con su negocio y no le fue nada fácil por que ella misma tenia que realizar la venta de los productos y a la misma ves encargarse de las compras y solo tiempo le ayudo a adaptarse para sobrevivir con este tipo de trabajo por lo que ahora solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar las compras de sus productos como: cosméticos, ropa y productos escolares ya que se acerca la temporada de la entrada a clases y además tiene que viajar a Managua y Chinandega por lo que en estos lugares compra de forma mas favorable.
texts.en:
Lisset Benita Z. Z. is 28 years old, single and has no children. Her intention is to keep working since she has a long time to make headway and she would like to generate more income for her family. She provides for her mother and sisters. Her wish is to finish her studies because it is an opportunity her parents never had, and thanks to her efforts she is fulfilling her dreams of being able to offer the same opportunity to her future children. It's for this reason she must save for the future as well as establish a more stable business.

Lissett makes a living selling clothing and cosmetics at an outdoor sales post, which she has been doing for six years. She started the business for her family because for a long time this had been their means of income but due to economic circumstances they were forced to give up the business. From this came the inspiration to decide to re-establish the family business on her own and regain their source of income. She chose to start out with just a few products, such as underwear and candy, and sold the products in The Terminal outdoor market. Her desires to make headway were ever stronger because she also had to repay the debts she took on to start it. Little by little she acquired the capital necessary to make progress with her business, and nothing came easy because she not only had to make the sales but also make the purchases. Only time helped her adapt to surviving in this line of work, to which she is now requesting a loan to purchase products such as cosmetics, clothing and school supplies since school season is nearing. She also needs to travel to Managua and Chinandega because those are the best areas to make these purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products such as cosmetics, clothing and school supplies

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: T. is 35 years old and runs a medium-size store out of her home, providing a service for buying and selling used-goods. She can earn an income of $5 per day from her investment, and has been in this business since early 2007. She is married and has given birth to one child who is teenager and attends school. Her husband's name is Ra, 39, who is a Cambodia military policeman. T. needs the capital to manage her financial investment; thus, she is applying for a $500 loan in order to increase inventory in her store. The family lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. (T.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To increase inventory in her store.

loans.name: Balikyewunya Group

texts.en:
