Florence M. is an experienced businesswoman who runs a decorating business. She speaks at length about how to meet the needs of her various customers, explaining, for example, that if there is a celebration for someone who is Catholic, the colors will be different than if there is a celebration for someone who is Protestant. For each event that she decorates, she makes 40,000 to 50,000 Uganda shillings in profit.

Florence has been running her decorating business since 1988. When she was in school, she realized that she really enjoyed working with flowers and other decorations. After graduating from high school, she worked in various jobs before meeting some women who were doing decorating. She joined with them to learn the trade and has now been working in her florist shop in the city of Kampala for over 20 years. Florence has four employees who help her decorate at the various functions for which she is hired. They help her arrange all the materials.

She works with many media. She says that depending on the function, she might use dry, artificial, or real flowers. Besides flowers, she has many beautiful stands and papers that she uses to make everything look beautiful.

Florence says that loans are what makes her business possible, because she finds that while each customer wants individual decorations, they do not pay ahead of time; therefore, loans allow her to do her work at the high level of quality she expects of herself.

Florence has five children of her own that are still in school and five grandchildren that she supports. Although her husband is also working, paying school fees for 10 children is a difficult task. Florence is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ush to purchase artificial flowers and some large flower vases for upcoming events. Florence also keeps some pigs in her compound would like to use part of her loan to renovate the area where they are kept.

loans.use: Buying artificial flowers and large flower vases, and renovating the piggery.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Mrs. Lolita M. is 39 years old, married and lives at Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has 4 children. Her husband is a fisherman. In her own little way, she wants to help her husband with selling fish. She plans to opens a “sari-sari” store (general store) in order to have another source of income. She became a member of Paglaum MPC in December 2005 and has availed of loans several times. Now, she is applying for PHP3,000 to buy fishing nets. She looks forward to someday having a better future for all her children after they finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets & gasoline for fishing

loans.name: Mehrabudin

texts.en:
Mehrabudin is the son of M. G.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has six children. He owns land on which he works hard to earn more money and to achieve all the goals of his family members.

He has been involved in this business since he was a child. His father was a farmer and he learned how to work on the land from his father. He is very interested in farming and would like to progress well, so he wants to take an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for the term of 10 months.

He would like to mention that this is the best process which can support all entrepreneurs to expand her or his business and be a good businessperson in the future.

loans.use: progressing business

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Ros N., 58, is a fish seller in the local market of Kampong Cham province. She typically makes US$2.50 per day. She has three children, one is a student, another is a garment factory worker and the other is a mechanic. Her husband, Mok Noo, 50, is a farmer and makes US$2 every day. Ros N. is asking for a loan to purchase more fish from fishermen to sell at the market. (Ros is pictured with her husband and her grandson).

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Aybjon

texts.ru: Косимов Аюбжон проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 31 год. Женат, имеет 2 сыновей. Клиент занимается торговлей,этим видом деятельности занимается более 6 лет. Торговая точка находится в районе Рудаки.  Клиент покупает и везет товар с города Душанбе с торгового центра Садбарг.  Торговля у клиента идет хорошо , так как у него есть оптовые клиенты. Торгует он продуктами питания и хозтоварами. Аюбжон обратился к нам за повторным кредитом, чтобы увеличить товараоборот.
texts.en:
Aybjon K. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 31 years old, married, and has two sons. He works in retail, as he as for over 6 years. His store is in the Rudaki district. He buys goods and transports them from the Sadbarg shopping center in Dushanbe. Sales have been good since he has wholesale customers. He sells groceries and housewares. Aybjon came to us for another loan in order to increase sales turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mme Akossiwa D. est née le 31/12/1960 à Nyigbé, mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle a pour activité principale, la fabrication et vente de beignets devant sa maison d’habitation. Actuellement la demande dépasse largement l’offre, mais elle n’a pas les moyens nécessaires. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour s’approvisionner en farine et huile afin de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettront de subvenir aux charges de sa famille et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akossiwa D. was born on 31 December, 1960 in Nyigbé. She is married and has three children. As her main business, she prepares and sells fritters in front of her house. Currently, demand has greatly surpassed her supply, but she does not have the means necessary to meet this demand. She is thus seeking a loan to supply herself with flour and oil in order to respond effectively to the needs of her clientele. The income drawn from her business will allow her to provide for her family and improve her standard of living.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare and sell fritters

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 35 years old, married and the mother of two children, who are in school. She lives with her family at Sefwi Wiawso in the western region of Ghana. She is a trader who sells tomatoes. She treks to remote areas within her community to buy tomatoes in bulk. Sometimes she spends days in the farming areas in order to get fresh and attractive tomatoes. For now she complains about the high cost of tomatoes. She is requesting a loan to buy tomatoes in bulk so that her customers can have a constant supply.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes in bulk

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Eight years ago, Lolita L. started a business. She has a small store situated near their house. She thinks that venturing into the sari-sari store business will provide a good life for her and her family because they will have a resource to meet all of the family’s needs.

Now, she needs additional capital. She wants a loan of PHP 16,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. This loan will help her to achieve a better income for her family. She will buy additional groceries to display and sell in her store.

CEVI helps Lolita sustain her business. Now, she is still part of CEVI’s credit program. She receives loans, training and an insurance coverage package.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
“The more the merrier,” is Josephine's comment about having a big family. She has nine children, three of whom are still in school. Josephine is happily married to Romeo, age 57, who works as a farmer. Her family resides in the rural flat area of Cabisera 27 Ilagan, Isabela. 

Josephine manages a hog-raising business in the back of their house. The business helps them, especially in times of emergency. That is why she wants to maintain it and make it more productive someday. 

Having a big family is not easy.  She and her husband are doing their best to cope with necessities, so she decided to venture into another business: selling vegetables. She believes that having another business is more beneficial to her family than to depend only on hog-raising, where they have to wait 3-4 months for their income.  

Josephine still aims to be even more progressive, and for this reason, she is requesting a second loan of PHP 8,000 from Kiva lenders to expand her vegetable and hog-raising businesses. She hopes that, with the loans, she can support her family, especially the educationof her three children who are in school.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Brao

texts.en:
Brao O. is from the village of Zone 1, Luyong Bonbon, Opol Misamis Oriental. She is 60 years old. Brao is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Brao owns and operates a business venture as a fish vendor. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Brao has been engaged in her business for over 38 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Brao joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brao is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Brao from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Albazine

texts.pt:
Albasine Samissone Gumende nasceu no distrito de boane, tem 45 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 3 e 22 anos. Os dois filhos mais velhos freqüentam escola (secundaria Joaquim Chissano). Não estudou para alem da 4 classe devido à falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores.
Vive na casa própria somente com sua família e sem ninguém mais sob sua responsabilidade. A esposa faz trabalhos domésticos.

Nunca saiu de boane, mesmo a altura da guerra dos 16 anos, permaneceu vivendo de agricultura de subsistência e outros biscates. Ano de 2002 terminou com sucesso a formação de condução de automóveis, de ligeiros e pesados. Trabalho há mais de 3 anos na Fabrica de cimento de Boane (SURENA) como motorista e com salário mensal de 6.000,00MT. Iniciou com a construção da casa de alvenaria com o credito que recebeu em um Banco comercial (BCI). Após a conclusão, não preferiu continuar devido as modalidades de pagamento que não são flexíveis.

Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de colegas tendo solicitado o primeiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000,00MT para dar continuidade com a construção da casa.
Este é o seu segundo credito no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, aros para janelas e outros) para a penúltima fase de construção.

Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos. Sonha ver a sua casa terminada para melhor confortar a sua família e posterior compra de mobília e outros bens de consumo.
texts.en:
Albasine Samissone Gumende was born in the district of Boane, he is 45 years old and is married and has 3 children who are between 3 and 22 years old. The two oldest go to school (high school Joaquim Chissano). He couldn't finished passed 4th grade because of his parents lack of financial resources. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't have another responsibilities. His wife keeps their home in order. He has never left Boane, even during the war when he was 16 years old, he stayed working in agriculture and other odd-jobs. In 2002 he successfully finished his education on driving automobiles, light and trucks. He worked for more than 3 years at the Cement Plant of Boane (SURENA) as driver with a monthly salary of 6,000MT. He started the construction of his masonry house with a credit he received from a Commercial Bank (BCI). After finishing this loan, he preferred to stop because of the payment plan which wasn't flexible. He learned about Hluvuku-Adsema thru co-workers and requested the first loan for 15,000MT to keep on building his house. This is his second credit for 20,000MT in order to buy materials (cement, windows frames, among others) for the next phase of construction. He expects to pay the credit without any trouble and access to new credit. He dreams to see his house finished to support better his family and later on buy furniture and other items.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
God Is Able is a group of four borrowers led by Veronica C., a 29-year-old college student and the single mother of two children aged 5 and 12 years old. Her children’s educational levels are kindergarten2 and 7th grade.

Veronica lives and works on the Old Road, a community with mixed poor and middle-class Liberians.

Veronica’s business is hairdressing and she has been running this business for more than three years. She started this business with a small shop and the rainy season was her greatest challenge. Good service and human relationships with her customers enables her to reach far in this business.

Veronica hopes to establish a bigger saloon. She needs this loan to purchase more hairdressing materials because the more materials she buys the better services she can offer.

Veronica dreams of making herself and her kids successful.

loans.use: To purchase more hairdressing materials

loans.name: Isolina

texts.es:
Isolina, de 52 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia y tiene muchas ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se dedica a la venta de calentadoras, radios, ollas, relojes, etc, básicamente todo lo que es usado en un hogar. Su puesto es muy concurrido, ya que atiende muy cordialmente a sus clientes.

Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar la mercadería que vende, ya que compra todos los productos en la ciudad de Desaguadero (distrito de Puno, fronterizo con el país de Bolivia) y le es muy cansado. Para más adelante espera tener una tienda grande donde pueda vender sus productos con más tranquilidad.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Isolina con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más cumplidas y responsables. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Isolina is 52 years old, and a loving and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her family, and she would love to improve her quality of life. Her business is located in the San José market - a very important market in the city of Juliaca - where she sells heaters, radios, pots and pans, watches, etc. - anything one could use in a home. Her stall is very popular, as she provides great customer service. What Isolina loves most about her business is talking to the ladies in the neighboring stalls. She has been in this business for 17 years; she thinks transporting the products from the city of Desaguadero (district of Puno, in the border with Bolivia) to her stall is the most difficult task of all and leaves her very tired. In the future, she would like to have a larger store from which to sell her products more easily. This is Isolina's sixth loan with Kiva partner MFP; she is determined to pay all her installments timely. In her communal bank, she is one of the most responsible and reliable members. With the PEN 1,500 she is requesting, she will buy more products to better her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica es una madre soltera de 26 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes le brindaron lo necesario para que pueda seguir adelante en sus planes de negocio, por lo cual está muy agradecida y trata de apoyarles con los gastos de la casa.

Desde que tuvo la oportunidad de ingresar a trabajar para una línea de belleza no dudó en hacerlo, pues siempre quiso trabajar de manera independiente y este negocio le permite no descuidar a su pequeño hijo. Es así que desde hace unos años está trabajando vendiendo productos de belleza por los alrededores de su distrito, pues es ahí por donde tiene amistades quienes se han convertido en sus clientes y diariamente solicitan sus productos.
Lo que más le agrada de su actividad son los lazos de amistad que mantiene y nuevos que entabla, pues está constantemente visitando a sus clientes.
Jessica considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio está en aprovechar las ofertas de los productos que hay en los catálogos, pues según estas ventas recibe premios adicionales que le ayuda a mejorar su stock.
Sus planes a futuro son de instalar un stand en su localidad, pues siempre anheló tener una tienda que pueda administrar.

Este es su noveno préstamo (individual) con Microfinanzas PRISMA y desde que inició su trabajo con la institución siempre fue responsable y comprometida, tanto de manera individual, como con su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará grandes cantidades de productos de belleza para venderlos en la próxima campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 26-year old single mother who lives with her parents. They provided her with assistance so that she could move ahead in her business plans, for which she is very grateful, and in return she tries to help them with the household expenses. When she had the opportunity to get into a line of work selling beauty products she did not hesitate to do so, as she always wanted to work independently in a way that would allow her not to neglect her infant son. Thus, she has for some years been working selling beauty products around her district, and has had friends who she turned into customers who solicit her business daily. What she likes best about this activity are the bonds of friendship that she maintains and the new ones she strikes up as she is constantly visiting her customers. Jessica believes that the profitability of her business rests on taking advantage of the product offers that are in the catalogs, because when she makes these sales she receives additional awards of product to increase her inventory. In the future she plans to have a stand in her locality, for she has always longed to have a store that she can manage. This is her ninth loan (individual) with Microfinanzas PRISMA and since she started to work with the institution she has always been responsible and committed, both individually as well as with her communal bank. With the money that she is requesting she will buy large quantities of beauty products to sell in the next Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es:
Reymundo tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Nuevo Paraíso, del distrito de Rázuri, en la provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas y 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral. Nos cuenta que empezó a criar animales desde pequeño y que durante este tiempo ha sabido atesorar el conocimiento y experiencia necesaR. para el manejo de granjas. 

Usualmente cría patos y los vende a los comerciantes de carnes de la zona. Hace poco tuvo que vender todos sus patos y empezó a criar pollos con la finalidad de mantener su negocio. El mismo les prepara los alimentos y cuida de ellos. Con los ingresos de este negocio cubre sus gastos personales y sostiene a sus padres que, debido a su avanzada edad, no pueden trabajar.

El se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la alimentación y sanidad de sus pollos. Reymundo es muy responsable y trabajador. Su más grande anhelo es retomar su cría de patos porque considera que son más fáciles de criar y que no requieren de mucho cuidado.
texts.en:
Reymundo is 40 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the village of Nuevo Paraíso in the District of Rázuri, Ascope Province in La Libertad region, which is 3 hours and 15 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Reymundo raises and sells poultry. He said he began raising animals as a child and has been able to absorb knowledge over time and gain the experience necessary to manage a farm. He usually raises ducks to sell to local butchers. He recently had to sell all the ducks and has now started raising chickens in order to maintain his business. As with the ducks, he feeds and cares for them in the same manner. With the revenue he generates, Reymundo is able to cover his personal expenses and support his elderly parents who are unable to work.

This is Reymundo’s first loan from Edypme Alternativa. He is requesting 1000 soles to purchase feed and medicines for his chickens. Reymundo is a responsible and hardworking individual. His greatest wish is to return to raising ducks because they are easier to care for and require little attention.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed & medicines for his chickens

location.town: Nuevo Paraiso - Rázuri - Ascope - La Libertad

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr: M. Rosalie est née le 04 Septembre 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rosalie est mariée à KPAMEGAN Pamphile, un agent à l’OCBN au Bénin, et est mère de trois enfants, dont un est à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. C’est depuis 14 ans que Rosalie vit au Cadjèhoun à Cotonou. Rosalie vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Pour cela, il y a deux ans, Rosalie  vend des jus de bissap et aussi des boissons à son domicile. C’est dans les dépôts de vente de boissons que Rosalie fait ses approvisionnements. Rosalie est à son quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois crédits précédents que Rosalie a obtenus auprès de ALIDé ont été bien remboursés.  Rosalie sollicite ce quatrième crédit afin d’augmenter le stock de produits et de satisfaire davantage les besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
M. Rosalie was born on September 4, 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to KPAMEGAN Pamphile, an OCBN agent in Benin, and she is the mother of three children, one of whom is in her care.   The children are all in school and live together with their parents.  For fourteen years, she has lived in Cadjèhoun in Cotonou.  She works in aid of her husband to cover family expenses.  To do so, she has been selling bissap juice and also drinks out of her home for two years.  She stocks up from sales outlets which sell beverages.  Rosalie is on her fourth ALIDé loan.  The three preceding ones that she obtained from ALIDé were repaid.  She's requesting this fourth loan in order to increase her stock of merchandise and to satisfy further the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beverages (non-alcoholic and fruit juices)

loans.name: Darhanbat

texts.en:
D. Darhanbat is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Zavhan province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian tent. His son and daughter are both university students and his wife works at the local hospital as a nurse. 

Darhanbat operates a small transportation service in his town. He drives local residents where they want to go in the area. His business has been successful and he has built a reputation as a good driver. He is saving money and hopes to expand his operation in the near future. Eventually he plans to purchase a large bus to expand his service. 

Darhanbat is working hard for the future and says, “all I want is to support my children so they will have happy lives.” He is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (550 USD) loan to purchase machinery parts for his business.

loans.use: to purchase machinery parts

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mr. Touch M. lives in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He is also a duck breeder. His wife, Mrs. Em Khen, is a Khmer cake maker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Touch M. decided to request a loan to buy an iron pot for his wife’s business. Additionally, he would use the rest of money to buy duck food to support his poultry business. He is 48 years old and the father of four children. One of the children is employed in a garment factory, one sells Khmer cakes and the others attend the local school. His wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy an iron pot and duck food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sewing notions

loans.name: Iponi

texts.en:
Iponi A. is currently in the business of selling used clothes in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase new shoes and bedsheets to sell. Iponi is 40 years old and married to a businessman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase new shoes and bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Marifel Jangolan Group

texts.en:
Marifel J. is from the village of Pan-ay Diot, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years-old and the group leader of a four member group loan offered by Kiva partner PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marifel is married and has one infant child.   Marifel owns and operates a business selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Marifel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marifel joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marifel is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish.
